Reviews.Title: “First rate all-around”
Reviews.Author: olive2012
Reviews.Content: Big, pleasant rooms, very reasonable price ($129), simple light switches and the such that didn't require an engineering degree to turn on, free internet (though in and out a bit for Skype calls), 2 TVs and microwave, and a convenient, downtown location for conferences. This is the best value/quality combination I've come across in years. I'd go back in a minute if I was in Toronto again.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently great!”
Reviews.Author: Brooke S
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Cambridge Suites each time I go to Toronto for business and every time the service is always great, the rooms are always tidy and the food is always delicious. The hotel itself has great furnishings as well as a very convenient business centre which is very helpful during those trips laptops are not handy. The hotel is conveniently located in the heart of it all right downtown which is a walk away from my office and a walk away from the mall! I look forward to each trip out East and truly feel at home each time I walk in the hotel doors.

Reviews.Title: “weekend business trip”
Reviews.Author: xxam
Reviews.Content: Flew into town for a quick one-day meeting and needed to book something in downtown, while some bigger hotels were close to capacity because of two conventions in town. I was glad to find the Cambridge Suites! The room was immaculate, beautifully furnished. Public areas were spotless. I appreciated Mark's quick help with check-in and finding the correct number for the Airport Connector van (the company itself gave me the wrong contact). My only tiny complaint is while the outer doors of the front entrance are automatic, the inner ones aren't, which makes it hard for people to negotiate a heavy door and luggage at the same time.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Rooms and Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: OntarioJellybean
Reviews.Content: We booked two rooms for a girls get together in the city. Both rooms were roomy. Huge bathrooms a bonus. Front desk staff were helpful and very accommodating with holding our luggage til our need to catch our transportation. Free wireless in room was so helpful for those last minute plan making. Fruit and cucumber water in the lobby a nice touch. Located steps to everything...no need for a vehicle. So impressed, I've booked again later in March for a weekend with my hubby.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: alimar1
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my niece for a couple of days at this hotel. Front desk staff were so helpful especially, Mark. Emerson helped us with our luggage,very polite. Room is very nice and clean. Spacious. Close to all amenities. However, bartender on Sunday afternoon has poor customer service. Whatever she was doing or watching on her screen was more important than serving us. We decided to leave and had lunch somewhere else. We came back for dinner but the server was her again (Lauren?). No warm greeting at all. We decided to order in room dining. The server was very nice and polite (Victoria?). We will be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: TorontoAmc
Reviews.Content: Our Chicago vacation was unexpectedly changed into a Toronto staycation and we needed to find a place to "get away", even though we couldn't get away. The Cambridge Suites served the purpose quite nicely. The room was big with lots of seating and a good sized table. Since we were staying for almost a week, we wanted more than just a room. The king bed was comfortable enough to sleep in every day which speaks to the quality of linens and mattress. Internet was included and suitable to the job of surfing the web for good restos and museum hours. The staff were friendly and the maid service well provided. After we checked out, we left the car parked in the under ground while we attended a concert which was very appreciated. The location is excellent - within walking distance of almost everything that we wanted to see.

Reviews.Title: “Toronto with a warm smile”
Reviews.Author: Firewater29
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for two nights over a weekend. We found a truly wonderful group of hotel staff that added to the pro's of the hotel: great location, in-out parking privileges, well-kept and clean rooms, a more than just continental breakfast, and silent rooms where you can sleep and not hear any neighbour. We were treated with warm smiles by helpful employees throughout, which to us is a vital part of our travel experience when visiting a new city. Toronto with a big smile. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “1st & last time...”
Reviews.Author: HabsfanJez
Reviews.Content: I've had the pleasure of staying at some of the best hotels around the world. Unfortunately I can't say that Cambridge suites is one of them. The hotel is nice & the room was great. Where this hotel is seriously lacking is in their customer service. Lynn was amazing.. As well as Victoria.. They made up for the poor service. Astri & Frank.. Unprofessional with very poor attitudes toward their job and hospitality. I will not return to this hotel after my 1st & only visit.

Reviews.Title: “Rip Off - unless you are nostalgic of the 70's”
Reviews.Author: PourJF
Reviews.Content: My bad. Finding a room por the PDAC mining conference 2 weeks before a 35,000 crowd movement to Toronto might not have been the best idea. And to pay $600 a night for staying in place that has furnitures from another millenium, very poor wireless interest (when it functiuns, which is intermittent) and sub-par elevators taking you 10 minutes wait every time you want to go somewhere is a complete rip-off. Despite staff honorable efforts to offer top-quality service. Unless I repeat this mistake again, chances that I go back to this places are close to nil. And brown on brown on brown is not very cool for decorating. And green moisture on the bathroom ceiling does not help in any way.

Reviews.Title: “Good But Not Great”
Reviews.Author: onthegoover50
Reviews.Content: How did this place get to be number 4? Its good but not classy! The Good....staff, The Not So Good....rooms are renovated with newer curtains and carpet but the furnishings are older and tired looking. The bath fixtures are older and a bit cranky. The Bad.....a running toilet and no internet for the weekend. OK so thats not really bad,..they were trying to fix the internet. We would stay here again if we had to.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious room in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Frances_Martin
Reviews.Content: My room was a quiet haven after a flight from the UK and I loved the inter-connecting layout of living room/kitchen, bedroom and bathroom. Two wide screen TVs were included although there was little worth seeing on Canadian TV except the BBC World channel! Fast Wi-Fi was available free of charge and the front desk staff were very helpful, e.g. print facility for online flight check-in. The Sunset Grill just down the road was great for breakfast and the Eaton Centre is 5 minutes away for shopping. Hot tips for craft beer are Bier Markt (Esplanade) and C'est What (nearby).

Reviews.Title: “Really nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: olssonm
Reviews.Content: Stayed in one of the King bed suites. Very well appointed, nice working area. Large separate washroom/getting ready area. Small kitchenette area with a sink, microwave and small fridge. Nice setup. Really good location, easy walk up Yonge Street. Definitely worth the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: Paul A
Reviews.Content: I love the rooms here, the sleeping area is completely separate from the sitting area and bathroom. Great for entertaining friends or clients. Staff handling check in, check out, bar services, room cleaning, etc. were all extremely friendly and polite. It is easy to see that customer service and satisfaction are key priorities for this location. Will definitely be back and highly recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “The very best Toronto hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: LarryEmm
Reviews.Content: One of the nicest hotel I've stayed in. The hotel was spotless as were the rooms. The staff was more like family than employees. The restaurant and bart were excellent. We were so close to the Eaton Centre, we could be there in 3 minutes! Can't think of anything that could have improved our stay. We're heading back asap!

Reviews.Title: “Family Day Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Suemarie99
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Cambridge Suites Hotel in Toronto over Family Day weekend and enjoyed it very much. The king suite was clean and spacious and very quiet. I used the workout room on the 22nd floor which has 3 treadmills which overlook the city with a nice whirlpool and sauna on an upper level. The front desk staff was welcoming and had our suite ready the morning we checked in. The concierge assisted us in choosing a restaurant - Fred's Not Here - which was delicious and made dinner reservations for us before we went to the Second City comedy show. The fruit flavoured water and apples in the lobby are a nice touch. The location is great. We walked one block to the Bay - connected to the Eaton Centre to shop and one block to the Sunset Grill for a lovely breakfast. Even all the cabs outside the front door are clean inside which is important to me.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - will return”
Reviews.Author: MommyEsqNY
Reviews.Content: Will stay here again. Spent one weeknight w/ my 10 year old son. Very clean. Comfortable beds. Staff courteous and accomodating. We arrived very early and our room was ready - we checked in early, this was great. Restaurant on-site is elegant, casual places located close by Hotel is centrally located, close to street cars (trolley) subway and buses. Great for kids because of suites (course) but also because relatively small lobby and number of rooms compared to mega size hotels. I did not want to have to cross a sea of conventioneers to get to elevators. Our suite was spacious with 2 dbl beds in a small bedroom which opened up on a living room with sofa bed and arm chair, mini bar with a sink, small table with 2 chairs.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: doolallyderby
Reviews.Content: Great location. Great suite. Great bar! I can't think of anything negative to say about this hotel. Very comfortable and everything you need in the suite. Helpful staff and even inexpensively did a full wash of clothes downstairs which was much needed after my travels. Wouldn't think about staying elsewhere if I returned to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “This Place is Suite!”
Reviews.Author: ajscubapro
Reviews.Content: We arrived here tired after an extremely early flight to Toronto from Havana. We were apprehensive because a chap called Martin we bumped in to in Playas del Este in Havana had told us how awful everything in Toronto was and how awful the people were too-he was from Toronto. Mercifully he could not have been more wrong. Toronto, the Torontonians and The Cambridge Suites are all excellent. The suite had everything we could have wanted and a superbly comfortable bed. There was a clean, large bathroom (the only thing missing was bubble bath) and separate dressing room. Two 42" TV's and a bar were provided. The room service menu was impressive and there was a good selection of information. Location for us was perfect with many great eateries and bars around. They have a good laundry room which I utilised to clean nearly 3 weeks of dirties from Cuba for $7. Imagine what this would have cost if using standard hotel cleaning services. During the 1 hour dry cycle I did a lightning zip tour up the CN Tower-wow! Ryan at the front desk helped me with this, he was very helpful. later that night Joan was helpful in recommending a good bar nearby, the King Edward (Eddie to the locals). Later we returned to the Suites and dropped in to the Portico bar for a drink which is very comfortable and has nice lighting. The bartender Richard and his helper Cheryl were lovely and great to chat with. We met a couple of regular residents and stayed up far too late and paid for this the next morning. It was worth it though and we had a fabulously comfortable lie in. In conclusion, I would stay here again. It is much cheaper than some other Toronto locations but I don't know what else you could want to justify more expense except maybe bubble bath.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful weekend getaway with family.”
Reviews.Author: TorontoMom2three
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a great Family Day weekend thanks to Cambridge Suites. Hotel was able to accommodate family of 5. Efficient check in and clean, comfortable suite. The location was perfect with easy access to Eaton Centre,Yonge-Dundas Square and using the PATH system to get to the Hockey Hall of Fame. So much more to explore in the city so we will definitely be back. Thanks to Tim and staff!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: spinnell
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Cambridge Suites Hotel for 3 nights. It was the perfect place for us and our son. The rooms were comfortable and clean and the bed was very comfortable. The stocked fridge and snacks available in the room is a great idea, but you pay for the convienience. The location was great as we were able to walk everywhere. We also had room service a couple of nihts and the food was awesome! Every staff person we met was courteous, friendly and helpful. We will definitely stay here again when in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Like coming home each time”
Reviews.Author: MerchantAdventurer
Reviews.Content: My company uses the Cambridge Suites as our preferred hotel in Toronto. I have enjoyed 4 stays there so far. Each time I return it is like coming home. The rooms are well appointed, clean and warm. The staff are consistently attentive, friendly and welcoming. I sent a tweet to my followers recording my pleasure at being back and was surprised to find a gift in my room with a cheerful 'thanks for the sweet tweet' note from the manager. Very conveniently located.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for meetings and business events”
Reviews.Author: Jp297
Reviews.Content: Our company has worked with this hotel on and off for around a year, holding smallish training courses in their meeting rooms. Their meeting staff have been consistently professional and always go the extra mile to ensure that the meetings run smoothly and they work with our company's individual requirements to help us as much as possible, as we cannot be on site as we are based in the UK. The catering sales manager who works with us, Maureen, is always incredibly helpful and also very efficient. The clients are always happy and praise the hotel and service.

Reviews.Title: “Neat room layout”
Reviews.Author: M H
Reviews.Content: Our room had an unusal L shape layout with a bedroom, living room and separate bath. The room was quiet, which is unusual in Toronto. Great service. Great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “They need to change the name to Cambridge Sweets!”
Reviews.Author: Doug B
Reviews.Content: ...because the rooms are SWEET! Perfect location central to everything downtown. Lots of room and yes as other reviews indicate a little dated but how much time are you spending in your room anyway? My only complaint is the position of the bathroom and change area closet doors. You tend to bump into them when moving around these rooms. Toilet/shower room door could have a bi-fold door to save space because it is located within the change/dressing room that could be secured for privacy.

Reviews.Title: “Suit and efficient”
Reviews.Author: MSQ0612
Reviews.Content: Checkin was quick adn in order Lobby small and not pretentious Elevator (3) clean and efficient Room (double bed) on 19th floor was the highth of efficient use of space Bedroom had separate door to and from living room and bathroom Bathroom had door between sink ara and shower/toilet Living room had pull out sofr and table sitting area with an area dedicated to coffee (kurig) sink , microwave and fridge 2 TVs Very clean and bright Breakfast was good , hot cereal , scrambled eggs, juices, cold cereals pastries, fruit and teas and coffee All in all a 8 out of 10 Would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Night!”
Reviews.Author: Camilla T
Reviews.Content: There is nothing that I don't like about this hotel. You have a choice of self parking, along with there being a public parking garage not even a block away. The rooms are clean, comfortable and very moden. The staff were all very friendly and took care of us quickly. My boyfriend and I stayed at Cambridge Suites last year for my birthday and we loved it; however we love it even more after our most recent stay. Since it was my birthday we ended up getting a free upgrade to a bigger suite, along with a card, a bottle of white wine and a pack of chocolate covered almonds. Thank you so much Cambridge Suites for making my birthday special =)

Reviews.Title: “Does not meet expectations based upon reviews”
Reviews.Author: joannetravel
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent, and if I chose to stay here again, that will be a major factor. The biggest negative was the bathroom. It is very dated and the shower has mould in the door area and the grout is stained. Flooring in bathroom has cracked tiles. Not appealing at all and would be the main reason for not staying here again. Also, the bathroom lighting is annoying as both the toilet area and sink areas lighting turn on at the same time and if some one goes to the toilet in the middle of the night, the door opens directly into the bedroom and the lighting is disturbingly bright. Also, the sink area stone counter has water stains that give the area an unclean appearance. At least I am assuming they were permanent stains. Beds are very comfortable. We travel a lot, and not having courtesy bottles of water looks cheap and is inconvenient. I will not pay $5 for a bottle of water. Giving bottles of water daily is so cheap to do and is appreciated by the customer, why not do it--it is the small things like this that distinguish an ok hotel from a very good hotel. Another nice touch we found in New Zealand, was fresh milk provided for coffee. Here you get the long life type and it is just not as good. With a fridge in the room already, this would be a nice touch. The main room was quite nice. A bit dull in decor but certainly fine. But that said, the room was not adequately lit. We found it quite dark. Service was adequate, but at better hotels, the service is friendlier. The front desk staff were fine, aside from some misinformation we received about the "PATH", but they did not go out of their way for the quests. I have stayed in one hotel, that within a few minutes, the staff were greeting us by our names and even knew our room number. We were here for four nights and I doubt staff recognized us at all and certainly never asked us if our room was satisfactory. They just don't make an effort to notice, greet and welcome customers. That said, when we were looking for some milk for coffee, the bar was very nice about giving us some to take to our room. The amenities are fine in the bathroom, but I would like to see the soap placed in the bathroom. Coffee was not great and of course, I mentioned the lack of fresh milk. Also, only one green tea and one regular tea was provided. What if both guests like the same kind of tea? We had to ask for some regular tea so that the two of us could each have a cup. Overall, it was ok, but nothing special. I expected better based upon reviews I have read.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Break in the City”
Reviews.Author: Mickeysays
Reviews.Content: I recently spent a weekend at the Cambridge Suites to take a little break from winter. The Cambridge is a long established suites style hotel in Toronto with a good reputation which it well deserves. All the staff are courteous and helpful, the rooms are large with all the conveniences and even the parking garage is clean and well lit and I am completely comfortable when my wife stays alone at the Cambridge when in town on business. The hotel is located close to the Eaton Center, The Art Gallery of Ontario, The St. Lawrence Market and numerous restaurants. It is also only a block from Toronto's subway which makes getting around town as simple as it could be.

Reviews.Title: “In Toronto on business 4x per year - I refuse to stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: brenda w
Reviews.Content: As always, what's not to love.... Rooms are always clean, staff is curtious and friendly, the beds are a dream to sleep in. I was attending conference at Royal York but wouldn't give up tradition of staying at Cambridge Suites. I rather deal with the stress of trying to navigate the PATH than sleep elsewhere.... Best service yet, when I couldn't fly out due to a cancelled Porter flight, I immediately called Cambridge Suites. With a brief explanation of my checking out earlier that day but my flight being cancelled they quickly had me setup in another great suite and they price matched my first night...I didn't have to beg...I love it when companies treat me with dignity! Looking forward to another great stay next quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, lovely accommodations”
Reviews.Author: SFNM28
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at this hotel last weekend and really enjoyed it. The suite was a great size--nice sized living room with couch and desk, decent sized bedroom, bathroom had two entrances. The bed was extremely comfortable, shower was wonderful. No complaints at all and an excellent price for being downtown Toronto! We walked to the CN Tower and to the Eaton Centre. There are several very good restaurants nearby as well. I hadn't been looking forward to going to Toronto in wintry January--we were attending a good friend's wedding--but the Cambridge Suites made the experience very pleasureable indeed!

Reviews.Title: “MONSTER awesome service for Monster Jam Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Chan P
Reviews.Content: We had incredible service from Cambridge Suites once again. Highly recommend this hotel for their friendly staff, clean and spacious rooms and location. We even forgot our nightlight which was of sentimental value... I contacted the hotel, someone responded to me within 24 hours, told us they had found the light and had it sent out to us in a very professional manner. (properly packaged for breakable item) Go to Cambridge suites... it is Monsterously Awesome Customer Service.. You won't be disapppointed!

Reviews.Title: “Super location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Halifaxnixe
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this Hotel several times in December and am looking forward to another stay next month. As I usually fly in to Billy Bishop Airport, I simply take their complimentary Bus and then walk 10 minutes to get to Cambridge Suites. How convenient is that? I can also beat any traffic issue in TO because Streetcar and Subway is so close. On the ugliest of days one is exposed to the elements a mere 3 Seconds (and even these are under a Glass Dome), because the Entrance to Toronto's Path is that close, bringing one to the Subway and all kinds of attractions, shopping, dining . Actually, you don't even need a coat at all! Staff has always been quick, patient, polite and helpful. And all this in a sincerely friendly way. The Suites are awesome, I love everything about it. The bed, mmmh, makes for a great sleep. Cleanliness has never been an issue! The only drawback really is their breakfast. I love to start my day off with great food, and the choices are just not appealing. All in all, it is my choice of Hotel whenever I get a chance to visit TO.

Reviews.Title: “needs a hot breakfast and reward program too little too late”
Reviews.Author: SMacDonald
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Cambridge Suites in Toronto over a dozen times for business travel over the last twenty years. It used to be fantastic, then between 1998 and 2005 it went downhill, many of my colleagues no longer wanting to stay there. Now though, it is back up in the ranks again and offers the great quaility of a suite hotel for business travellers. My only and constant beef with this hotel is their lack of a decent hot breakfast from their restaurant. Something I love to do when travelling is ordering a nice hot breakfast that can get me well into my day before I have to begin thinking about food again. Also, their lack of a loyalty program really bugged me and of course now they have introduced one but that won't help my 20 years of staying there which was never recognized.

Reviews.Title: “We stay here whenever we can”
Reviews.Author: mitti33
Reviews.Content: We love many things about the Cambridge Suites: * The suites are a great size. * Love the separation between the bedroom and living room (the doors are super). * We really appreciate the dressing room and all of the counter space. * Superb location. * Always clean and the staff is friendly. * Accessible parking lot. * It can often be easy to find reasonable rates for such a spacious accommodations in downtown Toronto. * Comfy beds and dark rooms for great sleeping. The shower and tub area could use some updating but that's not enough for me to rate this hotel as a 4.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Experience”
Reviews.Author: Chezzer27
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business in September 2011 and had an excellent experience. My suite was huge, almost too big for just me on my own. The front desk staff were really helpful and the location was perfect. There was great dining just around the corner and the flagship Bay store was only steps away. I got a great deal on my room making it terrific value for money. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Suite Hotel Well Located in Downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: kaberle
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Toronto over Christmas 2011 and wanted to avoid cramming 2 adults and 2 small children into one standard hotel room. We got the "Deluxe" suite, rather than upgrading for the "Cityscape" suite. The Deluxe had plenty of room in the living area for 2 adults and 2 children. Flat screen tvs in both the bedroom and living room, meaning you can put the kids to bed and still watch a show. The bedroom (we had 2 double beds), was separate, and a bit small, but functional. The pullout couch was actually comfortable. The bathroom is decent with a separate sink area which was handy when getting 4 people ready in the morning. The Cambridge Suites are located right downtown, a couple blocks from city hall which means you can walk with your skates to the rink at Nathan Phillips. The nearest subway station is only a block away. A couple downsides. Cleanliness isn't what I would have hoped for. I am pretty particular on this point, but I don't think I should find Skittles and wine corks from a previous visitor under the coffee table, or cookie crumbs in the pullout couch. Housekeeping also knocked on the door at 9am on the day we were checking out, and then asked for specifics on what time we would be leaving. Other than that, the staff was friendly and courteous. The window in the bedroom leaked a ridiculous amount of cold air from outside (it actually moved the sheers) and we had to cover the window with a blanket. Overall, I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied! Excellent experience.”
Reviews.Author: Pichtoune_71
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at the Cambridge Suite Hotel - family of 5. The staff was courteous and helpful. The check-in experience was efficient. The room was spacious and clean. The bed was comfortable. The soap, shampoo and other personal products of good quality. Excellent value and awesome location, close to shopping mall and the Elgin Theatre.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: rykmac44
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple of nights and it was great. Very easy to get to by car and then everything was in walking distance! Tim Hortons is down the street, the Eaton Centre is 1 block north and the subway is close. The room is very spacious for 4 adults and the shower and toilet are separate from the vanity....a great feature while getting ready! Having 2 TV's was also nice. One in the bedroom and one in the living room. There was a fridge, mini snack bar, plenty of counter space and a nice double sided desk. The only downfall was the internet code was only good for one computer and you would need to pay for additional ones. Overall a wonderful, comfortable hotel that we would stay at again!

Reviews.Title: “My Toronto home away from Home!”
Reviews.Author: Frederick_M3_Texas
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a business trip--my 3rd such trip to Toronto--first time at this hotel. They HANDS DOWN beat out the competition, and are now the only hotel I use in Toronto. Great staff, very friendly and accommodating--caring individuals that make your stay comfortable. Gym is small and doesn't boast much equipment, but they remedy that with passes to a nearby fully equipped gym just a few blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “convenient & comfortable”
Reviews.Author: bajangirl2009
Reviews.Content: we spent 4 nights including Thanksgiving weekend at the Cambridge Suites (our first visit) and we found the suite we had to be very comfortable with everything we needed. Our son joined us from college for the weekend and it was great to have 2 TVs so we could watch our channels before bed while he could watch his in the living area. The location in Downtown is superb and within walking distance of major shopping and also giving easy access to buses/streetcars etc. I would definitely stay there again on my next visit to TO.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: ShoppingBound12
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect for what we were there to do - which was shop and dine out with friends. A minute walk to Eaton Centre and you're off to spend loads! Our greeting and checkout went smoothly and there was no waiting in lines. Room - Nice but dated. It appears there are some renovations going on as we noted on other floors - but our room was clean and comfortable. Bathrooms - plenty of space, towels and clean. I've read how quiet it is here - it's not bad, but do keep in mind you are in the heart of downtown TO - so there is a little street noise. Would we return next time we visit TO - I'd say yes, we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Chrissy J
Reviews.Content: Great value for the price - room (more of a suite) was spacious and clean. The location is perfect, within walking distance of almost everything. The staff was amazing - we checked out early in the day, but the hotel let us keep our baggage there until our flight. Would recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Bad Value for the Money”
Reviews.Author: Katie E
Reviews.Content: I stayed here to spend an evening downtown with some friends, and for the several hundred we paid for the suite I expected a LOT more. The parking garage was "under construction", so trying to find a place to put our car that wasn't taped off was difficult. Once we got upstairs it was no better- the room was cramped, the bathroom was a joke- the stopper in the tub didn't even work- and we found a pile of pencil crayons on the floor behind a door. Apparently their approach to cleaning is pretty --. The beds were utterly unremarkable, and so was the view. Calling down to the front desk for a wireless access code for the 2nd laptop we had was a waste of time, as they charge TWELVE DOLLARS for an additional access code to their network, and the free one can only be used on one computer. I have never encountered such an absurd money grab anywhere. Location is great, but there are plenty of better places in the same area. Spend your money elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Better than most”
Reviews.Author: MJZimmer88
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a couple of times for work. The suites are a fair size, better than most other hotels I've stayed in for work. My only complaint is the bathrooms are all a bit uncomfortable. The location is great, only a couple of blocks from most of the big banks in the city, and there's a bunch of food options nearby. Rooms were clean and spacious, there are two large flat screen televisions, and the hotel WiFi (paid, not free) was quicker than most other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Some businesses call anything a suite”
Reviews.Author: Adamsamurai
Reviews.Content: Started here from the 13th of December to the 18th because it said it was a suite hotel and I wanted a suite. Location was good however when trying to get back to the highway its a bit difficult. Devlin was fast but lobby area is tiny a sure sign of what is to come.got to my floor and hall way was very tight.got to room and there was a fold out beef and eaten fruit treaty next to the door. Open door and there lied the most ill shaped living area and not to mention terribly small. Had to move the night stand to stretch my legs.wet bar was a nice feature but bedRoom was also tight and small.I could see that this room was probably meant to be a double room but they thought it easier to make it a suite. Complained and front desk said they had no others any different; note a good hotel will prove this. Oh yeah and I had look up a store for me. Sure they Gave me the address but place had burnt down a few years before. funny concierge they are. cleaner wanted to clean room and I informed that I will be out in a half hour.when she came back I asked for another 3 minutes. She tools me that she was busy and would wait for three minutes, I am not sure why I was getting attitude. Not so great experience. Wont stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Konglong
Reviews.Content: Room was clean and spacious. Was my honeymoon trip and the hotel sent us a bottle of champagne and strawberry foundue as compilmentary! Very thoughtful! Hotel is just a stone throw to subway and many great eateries and shops around.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Lawgigal
Reviews.Content: I purchased two nights at the Cambridge Suites from Sniqueaway (great travel deals!). I booked a room with two beds and a pullout couch since it was for a girls' weekend. The price and location were excellent - just steps away from the Eaton Center and a nice walk to the fashion and arts districts. I thought that the room would be a bit larger from the pictures but it was certainly large enough for the three of us. It was nice to have a fridge for our booze and snacks. My friends took the bed and I got the pullout couch so I can't comment on the beds. The couch was fine - nothing special. There was lots of bedding and a nice choice of pillows. I liked the vanity and closet which separated the bathroom from the sleeping area - it gave a bit more privacy for the three of us. We used the fitness facility and found it to be fine - the stair climber was a bit mickey mouse but the elliptical trainer was fine. The front desk was very helpful - even providing us with umbrellas when we asked.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, great location, a few minor drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: LeeGoldberg
Reviews.Content: Back in 2005, I practically lived at the Cambridge Suites for work and I loved it. I was there off and on for months. The nicely appointed rooms are like mini apartments and have everything you need for a comfortable and productive stay.And you are walking distance from most locations downtown and not even half-a-block from the Eaton Center (which you can also reach underground through the PATH system). I returned on business this week and was pleased to discover that not much has changed...but keep in mind that the reasonable room cost does NOT include $22-a-day for parking, $10-a-day for the spotty (at best) wireless Internet connection (which only covers one device at a time), and $13-a-day for a continental breakfast (scrambled eggs, fruit, cereal, pastries and toast). You can't get around paying for the parking or very spotty Internet, but you can get a much, MUCH better breakfast deal by going to the Sunset Grill on the corner of Richmond and Yonge...mere steps away from the hotel. Also, be careful driving into and out of the parking garage. it's very narrow fit to get in and to navigate the ramp (particularly on your way out) and the parking spots can be a tight fit, too. There's a reason why there are so many paint scrapes on the pillars. All in all, it's a great place to stay for business or pleasure to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort, Location, and Peace”
Reviews.Author: NLKWinnipeg
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Cambridge Suites Hotel for a week, four nights in a cityscape suite with my partner, and then three nights in a deluxe suite. For a longer stay, it is hard to beat the Cambridge Suites. To begin with, you have a suite with a separate bedroom and living area, making it feel much more like a small apartment. There is a mini fridge and microwave if you want to do some in-room dining. One of the best features, particularly if you are travelling with someone, is the separation of the toilet and tub/shower from the sink/dressing area. Two of us were able to get ready for meetings in the morning in much less time than it would normally take. The bed(s) were very comfortable, there was plenty of storage, and while the rooms are a little tired, they are clean and quiet, even when you are right across from the elevators. The lobby is elegant and quiet (for anyone who has stayed at the Delta Chelsea as often as I have, you will understand what a blessing this really is), and the service was friendly and prompt. The cityscape suite came with included Wifi, although you have to get a code from the operator to use it. It also came with a really good continental breakfast in Portico. There were a couple of hot choices (scrambled eggs and oatmeal) and the usual fruit, bagels, toast, juices, and hot beverages. The cityscape suite is not a lot different in layout than the deluxe suite, although you do get more space, a little foyer with table, and a nicer dining area. There are also upgraded amenities, and those along with breakfast are enough to make it worth upgrading if you can. This hotel is really well located for both downtown business meetings and for shopping. There are lots of good restaurants nearby, and as long as you don't mind being locked out occasionally (always take a coat with you), you will generally have good access to the PATH network. The only problem is the building across the driveway from the hotel (which is the access point for the PATH) closes on Sundays and evenings with no warning, which means you may find yourself having to come back outside with no warning. There is easy access to the subway which means most of Toronto accessible. And there were always taxis available when needed. I highly recommend this hotel and it will definitely be my new home away from home whenever I am in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel suite experience downtown, but staff needs better training”
Reviews.Author: Carlos G
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Toronto for a wedding and decided to make a vacation of it along with the wife and 3 young kids. The challenge traveling with 3 young kids is you really need to a suite with multiple rooms or you won't be getting much sleep! We almost stayed on the water, but saved about $100/night and the overall experience was probably better. Their suites are HUGE. They had free wifi in the lobby and they always had iced water with some sort of fruit available in the lobby, which we took full advantage of (as opposed to paying for bottled water from the minibar or finding a store). The parking underground was hilariously under construction, dusty, and with drapes all over the place, but remained open and they charged full price, but still cheaper than alternatives. We mysteriously were "checked-out" of our room a day early by the staff -- as in we got a final bill checking us out even though we weren't leaving. I had to go downstairs and explain this to the staff, who were completely confused and said nothing was wrong. I had to show them my original booking information that showed me as staying another night so they fixed in. We were also "double-billed" -- this wouldn't be so much an issue except it was almost $1700 double-billed, plus a foreign exchange fee of somewhere like $50 on each exchange. First the hotel said we were not double-billed and that the other charge would simply disappear. However, calling our credit card company, they told us the only way for the double-charge was if someone at the hotel charged our card twice, because the charges were on separate days!... the hotel never admitted fault, so although they said they would fix the problem, it took multiple calls by us to get the credit card company to refund us.

Reviews.Title: “Annual Stay”
Reviews.Author: Zywot
Reviews.Content: Every November my husband & I meet our friends in Toronto, to celebrate November Birthdays. For the past few years,we have stayed @ the Cambridge Suites. This hotel is wonderfully convenient for shopping ,dining ,& the theatre. The staff are always friendly & quick to tend to our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and clean hotel, wonderful staff and close to everything”
Reviews.Author: hector d
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent the weekend there for our 38th anniversary. We have gone there for weekends several times in the past for our anniversary. We love this hotel due to it's being a suite, close to everything, clean and staff are really nice. We were surprised to have a delivery of a cheese tray and bottle of wine delivered to our suite. We thought it was from our kids but it was from the hotel to congratulate us on our anniversary. What a wonderful and thoughtful gesture and totally unexpected. I highly recommend this hotel. Price is right and we really enjoyed it. Thank you very much Theresa for that gesture. We really appreciated it.

Reviews.Title: “Longer stay convenience”
Reviews.Author: Wedgewood_11
Reviews.Content: I chose the Cambridge Suites as I was going to be in Toronto for 6 nights over a weekend. I wanted something larger than a regular hotel room and convenient for shopping on the weekend. It was half a block from the Bay/Eatons Centre Mall so it fit the bill. The suites have a separate living room area, microwave and fridge and the location was perfect for the weekend. The bathroom could use an update - the tub/toilet room was very cramped and a modern walk-in shower would be appreciated. It is not on the PATH so I would reconsider staying here if the weather is going to be very cold. It was very mild (albeit rainy) the week I was there so walking outdoors was find. The staff at the hotel are very friendly and helpful. I prefer smaller hotels and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “This should really be a five star hotel. Amazing deal!!!”
Reviews.Author: verypicky_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 days and loved it. I'm a snob when it comes to hotels -- they have to be clean, modern, chic and spacious. I was a bit worried when I booked because the suite was so cheap. I thought there would be a catch -- but I was wrong. It is definitely my favorite hotel in Toronto. The hotel and suite were very spacious, clean and modern. The staff were extremely friendly and nice. The complimentary breakfast buffet was much more comprehensive than I had anticipated. The mini-bar was suprisingly reasonably priced. The restaurant was great -- awesome salmon. I would definitely recommend this hotel to someone looking for a top 5 star hotel but not willing to pay for one. GREAT DEAL.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in the heart of a great city”
Reviews.Author: Katris
Reviews.Content: Toronto is a great city. And Cambridge Suites is a great hotel located at the center of it all (walking distance), but it is also very quiet. Thereâ€™s everything around (restaurants, mall, very close to CN tower): Yonge Street around the corner. Perfect location Staff is friendly, although most of the time occupied with guests. There is a bar/restaurant downstairs and the lobby ambiance is really nice. I never used the gym since I walked so much during the day that I had no energy to even take a look at it later. For standard rooms breakfast is not included, which is not a problem with so many places in the vicinity. As for the rooms, even the standard is huge; bedroom is separated from living room, each one with their own TV, with a door that blocks aisle noises even more. So sleeping quality, with the exception of some street noisy ambulances, was really good. You have a microwave and a sink, coffee maker and a little fridge. Perfect bed. Bathroom is super big, and water pressure is also very good. Lots of natural and artificial light, which I appreciate. Drawbacks: In their page and in hotel reservation pages they say they have safety boxes in every room and that is not true. I believe they will make that happen soon, but it should be reflected when it takes place and not now. That is misleading advertisement Wi-fi in the room is not free for all; at least not for the standard rooms. You can have it, but you will need to pay. Speed is decent, although not great (at night it gets quite slow) One of the best economic choices for Toronto

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be better.... Don't hesitate, just book it.”
Reviews.Author: FloppyDonkey
Reviews.Content: First review... But felt compelled after our experience.... 4 nights, everything went perfectly. Two 40" LCD tv's, tons of channels, bathroom is very spacious with toilet and shower separated from the sink and wardrobe... Sofa and armchairs bigger than in my home. To but some balance into the mix, I wish they did not charge for wifi in the room. Wifi is free in the lobby, but I must admit, I do like sitting in my room mapping and booking my trips without being in a busy lobby. Really nice decor and condition. I dare you, you will not be dissapointed. I'd say you are 5 mins walk to the yonge / dundas (times sq equivalent) where you can hop on the sightseeing bus to get everywhere, (35cad per adult for 7 day pass.) a further 5 min walk to the bus terminal for niagra... (megabus online) Â£40 all in for two adults, a lot more with the local sightseeing company) no different...

Reviews.Title: “Yearly Retreat”
Reviews.Author: Travel2plus1
Reviews.Content: Once a year a good friend and myself head to Toronto for a weekend of theatre, dinner and catching up. We have stayed at The Cambridge Suites Hotel for the past 4 years, although we have not eaten at the restaurant so I cannot comment on the food, the hotel is clean and comfortable. We often pick up dinner and take it back to the suite so we can eat and talk. The staff are truly friendly and helpful making the stay very pleasant. There is a surcharge for parking but it is not out of line with any of the other parking facilities in Toronto. A short walk to public transit and shopping as well as many of the theatres. I would highly recommend this hotel and cannot wait for our weekend next year.

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: mark d
Reviews.Content: If this hotel had more amenities - e.g shop/coffee shop/pool, then it really would be very good indeed. We stayed in a cityscape suite which was excellent - roomy, lots of amenities good view. The gym/hot tub is small but was not busy when we were there and had great views. The breakfasts are very good (although some meat option would complete the menu really well) , the staff pleasant and efficient and the hotel is extremely well located. A huge plus for me was the quietness of the rooms - cannot recall hearing any noise from in or outside the hotel and this is something that has had a huge negative impact me in other hotels i have stayed in this year

Reviews.Title: “Central, Reasonable and friendly!”
Reviews.Author: VanBC_girl
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were in town for the weekend and had friends fly up from NYC to visit as well. Given we planned to barely be in the room, we decided to share the room - there was a king bedroom and a pull our sofa. Although happy about saving money, I did worry that upon arrival it would possibly be too small - regardless, I booked it. The hotel is very central, near shopping, restaurants, etc. The staff was friendly, the lobby welcoming. Our room was on the 12th floor, with basically just a view of an office building. However, it was very bright which was nice, as both the main room (where the sofa bed was) along with the king bedroom both had large windows. The bathroom toiletries were all eco which I very much appreciated. Internet was $12 per day so we passed, although they did say the business centre floor had free internet usage (possibly not for standard rooms; I can't remember, but for a king suite it was free). We had great sleeps, and the hotel really wasn't noisy at all. However, our room was on a corner which I am sure helped. The room was nice and fairly modern, and one thing I liked was that the sofa bed blanket was a nice white modern duvet, vs those ugly hotel blankets you usually get. The hotel bar was a bit dated, and the bathroom was wheelchair friendly so felt a bit odd with push up handles near the toilet, and roll in access for the shower, etc but happy they have that for those who need it. Overall we had a great stay, and for the price, I would definitely return. I couldn't believe how expensive Toronto hotels are, and this was one of the few that was nice, central and affordable. I recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Scottbc
Reviews.Content: We recently held our annual board meeting at the Cambridge Suites. From the initial quote to final check out, the service was outstanding. Reservations were amazing and on arrival at the hotel we were delighted with the rooms (lots of room to work and relax in your own living room) and the service. All the staff were friendly, welcoming and professional. Nothing was too much trouble. The hotel is in a superb location - extremely close to the Eaton Centre and lots of restaurants. There were 10 people in our party and everyone gave rave reviews about what a great hotel, location and service. Outstanding!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: ian_ok
Reviews.Content: Excellent experience at Cambridge Suites hotel. Very nice staff at check in. Our family had also arrived and we were given an upgrade to floor 21 (floor 22 above is the top floor with more suites, gym, sauna and Jacuzzi). All suites are slightly different. Ours had a larger bedroom with windows on two sides (great city views). Flat screen TV in bedroom and DVD. Separate lounge area with sofa bed, another flat screen TV, desk (free internet), fridge/microwave/sink area with basics required for cooking. The bathroom could be accessed from both sides so could be used by people sleeping wither in the lounge or main bedroom. Lovely Jacuzzi and sauna located within the gym on the top floor 22. Fantastic views with glass down to the floor, so not for the faint hearted! Great way to ease the aching legs after the sight seeing of Toronto. Good quality breakfast buffet with fresh fruit salad, yogurt, oatmeal, scrambled eggs, cheese, muffins and pastries. Also bread, waffles and bagels to toast. Usual fruit juices, tea coffee. So although not full choice the quality is better than many other hotels. We also ate at Portico, the restaurant for the hotel, see other review.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience!”
Reviews.Author: 900Paula2011
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Toronto for a solo vacation Nov 14-18. The location of the Cambridge Suites was perfect. It's near lots of the main attractions, I walked to most of them (Ex: Hockey Hall of Fame, CN Tower, Hard Rock Cafe and Legislation Building.) Very safe area. Lots of construction projects going on in downtown Toronto and this hotel was far enough away from all of that so it was very quiet, at least from the 13th floor. My hotel room was more like a small apartment than a hotel room. Lots of room and comfortable furnishings. Irma did a great job keeping my room clean during my stay. Hotel staff was very helpful giving me directions, advise and were very friendly. A couple convenient things they do is convert your US dollars into Canadian money (at daily rate) and they "cashed" my Travelers Checks. That was great! They also mailed out post cards for me (there is a post office close by too). I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great for people with special needs”
Reviews.Author: Debi K
Reviews.Content: My 24 year old son had a serious knee injury and we needed a place to stay for a few days (with no stairs) after his surgery. We arrived directly from the hospital and he was in tremendous pain. I can't say enough about the fantastic service we received. Every staff member was very very attentive...they couldn't do enough to help us out. In addition to all the normal stuff you would expect, this included helping to get him into our suite, fixing a problem with his wheelchair...the list goes on and on. The service is really fantastic. In addition, the hotel is very comfortable...it really feels like the next best thing to being at home. My son loved the comfortable king-sized bed with great linens and pillows. He was really happy to be in that bed. I've stayed in many hotels over the years, and this one rates very highly, including when compared to more expensive properties.

Reviews.Title: “Great for business and pleasure!”
Reviews.Author: Joe_Bester
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Cambridge Suites during the Toronto International Film Festival. We had the most pleasant experience! The suite we stayed in was wonderfully spacious - we even used it for a business meeting. The bed/linen was clean and fresh and made for a very comfortable stay. Only criticism is that the room service is very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great value -”
Reviews.Author: David C
Reviews.Content: I stay here frequently and have stayed at almost all of the hotels in Toronto. Granted, there are many that are nicer (Ritz, 4 Seasons, Intercontinental, Park Hyatt, etc) However, the Cambridge Suites is a great value. Nice big suites, good beds, and lots of room to spread out. If I am in the downtown area, I typically stay here for its convenience. Some of the rooms are in need of updating, but it remains very clean. Recommend that you request one of the "upper" floor rooms. These will cost a couple of dollars more, but it is worth it for the extra quiet and nicer linens. Good breakfast as well.

Reviews.Title: “An amazingly nice hotel with great value and location”
Reviews.Author: Thundarr357
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here many times and always enjoyed my stay. Very convenient location easy parking. Near Eaton Centre and TTC(Subway). All rooms are 500 square feet so no worries about getting a small room. Breakfast is good and complementary but it can get a bit crowded at times. Staff is always very nice and professional. Hotel is very clean and well kept up. East facing rooms are better and when you upgrade to cityscape on the higher floors you get a nice view plus bed is more comfortable and internet is free. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and I have. Not really a family hotel no pool or childrens activities more of a business oriented facilty.

Reviews.Title: “The suite's the thing - but no pool”
Reviews.Author: Cath617
Reviews.Content: Excellent location! All rooms are suites, plenty of room, flatscreen in the bedroom and in Living room area, Full doors to close off bedroom, microwave - two mini fridges - there is a hot tub and small exercize room (small but clean, and not busy)on top floor with view of city - When we booked we asked for early check in and they added a note but said no guarantee, it was not a problem and we were able to check in at noon. Check out is 1 which is later than most. Housekeeping staff are wonderful, morning front desk could be more friendly - helpful when asked but didnt volunteer info - also we missed the included breakfast by 10 minutes, I wondered if I might get a cup of coffee but instead was told there were plenty of breakfast places in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel In The Heart Of The City !!”
Reviews.Author: Chinaski3
Reviews.Content: I have recently returned from a week in Toronto staying at the Cambridge Suites. I canâ€™t recommend this hotel highly enough. From the moment we arrived the reception staff were excellent and the checking in procedure was extremely smooth. We had a â€˜cityscapeâ€™ room which was perfect, very clean and spacious with an excellent maid service. Fantastic views across downtown Toronto. The location is ideal to explore the various districts of Downtown, the Distillery District, St Lawrence Market, Harbour Front, Queen Street, Cabbage Town, China Town, Little Italy, Kensington Market and Dundas Square were all with a shortish walk. I didnâ€™t get the opportunity to eat in the restaurant (Portico) but have heard very good reports. Checkout was also very smooth. I would definitely recommend this hotel for people looking for a quality hotel in the heart of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice stay but need to get bathroom refurbishment finished”
Reviews.Author: Jojicat
Reviews.Content: This is our second review of the Cambridge Suites and once again virtually everything about our stay was good - the location is perfect for town, reception staff were always helpful and polite as were housekeeping. The lounge and bedroom areas were exactly what we needed - comfy seating and bed. However the bathroom was still a huge letdown - it was seriously in need of an update and the design needs thinking through. To wash my hair at the same time as having a bath I had to get out and go to the shower. Also who decided the best place to put a toilet roll holder was 6" from the floor so that it is impossible to reach comfortably and it means that you have to pull so much up it then trails over the floor as soon as you let the end go. This seriously needs to be addressed as it is unhygienic as well as awkward. This is the only thing letting the experience down which is why I still rated the hotel as very good. Also we were really impressed by the manager who, on commenting on the bathroom after our visit, fed back to us that they are currently in the process of changing all of the bathrooms and has assured us we will get a room with a new bathroom on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy the SuiteLife!”
Reviews.Author: Kenmw
Reviews.Content: If you like feeling the comforts of home while on vacation, you'll get that feeling at Cambridge Suites Hotel. It is luxurious, yet cozy. The amenities are excellent and the staff are very polite, attentive, and knowledgeable. The hotel is in a very convenient location wherein you can walk to many local attractions. Cambridge Suites Hotel has been our home away from home for several years now when we vacation in Toronto. The pricing is excellent and we have always been satisfied guests.

Reviews.Title: “A nice luxury hotel, well located with focus on rooms rather than communal areas”
Reviews.Author: RLondonUK
Reviews.Content: The hotel is tucked just off a main road, making for a nice entrance. It's very well located and walking distance to the main street with bars on it, and Toronto's tourist highlights. The staff are attentive and polite, and check-in was prompt. The room itself is very nice. I wouldn't say it was the most luxurious room i've evr stayed in, but it was very well sized. A nice living room with dining table and flat screen TV, a big bedroom with a further flatscreen TV, a good size dressing area and a nice moern bathroom. The rooms were spotless, modern and quiet. The hotel is also well located for parking should you choose to hire a car. The hot tub on the top floor of the building is a great idea and when we used it there was no-one up there which was great. It's a very nice hotel if you plan on spending the majority of your time seeing Toronto, as beyond the nice room and hot tub the hotel does not offer much. But i would definitely stay there again. I went with my girlfriend and we both had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “A suite for the price of a room.”
Reviews.Author: Ricard013
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stay for 4 nights in September 2011 on a business trip to Toronto. The suite was very roomy and had a fridge, microwave, sink and coffee machine. The location is great and close to Eaton's Mall and the convention I was attending at The Sheraton. This was my second time staying there and will stay there again. Price is reasonable especially with the one bedroom suite. The front desk was very helpful to my wife who did most of the sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “A great choice”
Reviews.Author: MisterMikeSeattle
Reviews.Content: I stayed here two nights in October for business. I was completely happy with the experience: nice big and clean rooms, superb front desk service, convenient on-site parking garage, excellent location within walking distance of the downtown shopping core as well as the funkier University Ave shops and great restaurants. I highly recommend Cambridge.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and fab rooms”
Reviews.Author: DaveMoutrey
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel up after searching on-live for a while, Toronto seemed to be full when I wanted to be there. It was a bit more than I wanted to pay but it was worth it. Great suite with a good view over Toronto. Well located for business and leisure districts. Good service and the breakfast was good. It you like in room entertainment the TVs are good with a big selection of channels. Good internet connection. Very clean and well maintained. Really enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “First Rate”
Reviews.Author: ccooke715
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Suite was spacious, staff was friendly and it's in a great location. Parking in the lower level was $22 which is reasonable. Only complaint was a little noise from neighboring suites when the water was running but a minor negative. Would stay nowhere else on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel would recommend staying”
Reviews.Author: michelle m
Reviews.Content: The wife and I have stayed at this hotel a few times and have nothing bad to say about it. The front staff is excellent, rooms are great and the restaurant is excellent. All around a great place and excellent location. Walk out the door and you have every thing you need.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every way!”
Reviews.Author: FlyingScotsman52
Reviews.Content: I had read numerous positive reviews of Cambridge Suites before booking a five-night stay in mid-October 2011. I must admit that I was a bit sceptical but I found the hotel and location excellent in every way. The Airport Express 'bus drops at The Sheraton Centre from where it is a 10 minute walk to the hotel. The staff at the front desk were exceptionally helpful with everything. My room was on the 9th floor, spacious and spotless. The king bed was exceptionally comfortable and room facilities - coffee maker, microwave, two flat screen TVs all were used! I didn't use the breakfast facility which I thought was a bit overpriced ($15)for continental-style. Due to the hotel's superb location right in the downtown core, there are many excellent eating places within a few minutes walk - Sunset Grill is closest but a bit basic, try walking a bit further along West Richmond Street and look for Quinns/Shopsys on the north side of the street. Also for lunch or supper try The Keg on York Street.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Dave M
Reviews.Content: We decided to spend the long weekend in Toronto with friends and needed to find accommodations. I looked on Expedia and found the Cambridge Suites Hotel was well priced, had a great location and it's reviews on both Expedia and Trip Advisor were excellent. I called the hotel directly to ask a few more questions about the property and the person assisting me was exceptional. I ended up booking right then and there and the reservations agent was amazing. She answered all my questions, was incredibly polite and professional, and made the booking process easy and most importantly for me...fun! AMAZING! We arrived at the hotel and were warmly welcomed at the front desk. Our room was immaculate and very spacious. LOVED the large bathroom area and separate seating area. Everything about this property did so much more than exceed my expectations. What I am most impressed with about the Cambridge Suites Hotel though is the incredible staff and the high level of professional, but approachable service that I experienced from every member of this team. From the reservations agent all the way to our check out, every person we encountered made us feel like the most important person in the hotel. Fantastic. We will definitely be making this property our Toronto "home" for future visits.

Reviews.Title: “New Discovery”
Reviews.Author: quecber
Reviews.Content: That hotel offer nice room suite downtown Toronto and not expenses

Reviews.Title: “Good location and value”
Reviews.Author: Vacatrip1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Cambridge Suites (cityscape rooms) over Labor Day, 2011. Pros: The rooms were spacious, modern, and very clean. The location of the hotel is great. Good value. Cons: The thermostat did not seem to work and was over-cooling the room. We had to shut it off completely to manage the temperature. Poor breakfast selection.

Reviews.Title: “A three night stay in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Semlohjd
Reviews.Content: In one word ' excellent'. The staff are attentive, friendly and helpful. The room was clean and comfortable, and the facilities were first class. I look forward to my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Dated and some issues”
Reviews.Author: MarinaWinnipeg
Reviews.Content: Well I was worried that exactly what I had thought I would get was what I got...this is an older renovated suite hotel...dont like the layouts and the rest is just main stream nothing outstanding about this hotel and not worthy of the rating or the placement on trip advisor... as far as I am concerned. Missed wake up call and poorly cleaned bathroom and just a call from the guest services mgr...politely brushing aside the issue and asking if they could organize my wake up call for the next morning...well ugh no..if you cant organize it right for one day... why should I trust you the second day...had to ask to have my drycleaning brought up to my room at 5:25...nope I dont like it here...in a world full of choices I am making another..how is that for dialogue!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rose D
Reviews.Content: The moment we walked into the small clean lobby we were greeted by courteous staff. The concierge desk was kind enough to provide us with a map and even marked out where the hotel was situated, so we could find our way back. Not only is the location of the hotel convenient, but Cambridge Suites Hotel Toronto offers services and amenities that are second to none. The hotel provides guest with a 4 hour complimentary use of their bike and provides a lock and helmet, which we didnâ€™t utilize, but it was nice to know that Cambridge Suites offers this service. My husband & I stayed in the spectacular Cityscape one bedroom suite, which features a king size bed, separate living room equipped with an entertainment bar that includes a mini bar area microwave, refrigerator, Keurig coffee maker- featuring complimentary coffee or tea and mini bar. The mini bar can be a little pricey, but the cost is affordable unlike the previous hotel we stayed at. Cambridge Suites Hotel â€“ Toronto General amenities include: private bathroom with complete bath amenities, bathroom with a vanity area, 2 telephones with voice-mail, wireless and wired Internet access, complimentary local and toll-free calls, 37â€� LCD HDTV in the living room and bedroom, hairdryer, iron, CD/DVD player with MP3 docking station, and ironing board and in-room safes as well as a complimentary newspaper every morning. Andy at the concierge desk was very helpful in getting my laptop connected so I could get online. It was so cool to be able to tweet @timostrem â€“ general manager right from our room. Every-night at home I fall asleep to the sound of a fan. When I requested a fan from the hotel, Andy saw that a fan was delivered to my room, so it felt just like home. Now thatâ€™s service! Cambridge SuitesIn fact all staff at the front desk were very helpful and always willing to answer my endless questions. I was also impressed with the other staff at the hotel that were always polite and courteous and greeted us each time we passed with a friendly hello. Tim Ostrem general manager of Cambridge Suites welcomed us to the hotel with a complimentary bottle of chardonnay, chocolates and book- Hotel Hobbies- 50 things to do in a hotel that wonâ€™t get you arrested. ( I was so busy enjoying the hotel & Toronto I had no time to read the book.) Cambridge Suites Hotel â€“ Toronto There are only 12 sophisticated suites on each floor of the hotel, so the floors are very quite unlike in other hotels. I absolutely loved the sliding doors on the bedroom that separated the Cambridge Suites Hotelbedroom from the living room and dining area. The vanity area is a womanâ€™s dream, providing lots of room to get ready for a day out on the town. I wish I had that kind of vanity in my home. Cambridge Suites Hotel Upon turn down request the maid brings up 2 bottles of water, chocolate and pulls the curtains shut. This is a really nice touch. Cambridge-Suites-Toronto-Unfortunately my husband and I slept so well in the comfortable bed that we missed the continental breakfast provided by the hotel. Sadly I can not comment on the food.

Reviews.Title: “A great alternative to the usual business hotels”
Reviews.Author: KSlondon
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel through the reviews on trip advisor as i have previously stayed in the Royal York a number of times (the rooms are very dated and cramped ) and the Sheraton (not impressed ) .This was perfect for me for 3 days of business meetings-everywhere was within a 10 min walk from the hotel . It was great to have the high speed (free) internet in the Cityscape rooms and also to not have to have business papers and laptop squeezed in to the bedroom ,making use of the lounge area attached to the bedroom . OK i agree with the other reviews that after a few days the breakfast did get a little boring but I found that a small price to pay for the extra room the suite gave .I will definitely use this hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Would Return -- but not perfect!”
Reviews.Author: kaadaq
Reviews.Content: Stayed in late September in a Cityscape suite. Traveling with my wife and young daughter. First, the good: Front desk staff was very friendly. Self-parking with in-out privileges was reasonably priced. Our room was a two doubles room on the 21st floor, across from the elevator. The room was fairly well insulated, as we heard very few sounds from the corridor. The room itself was decent size, with a bedroom separated by french doors, kitchenette, and bath with sink area separate from toilet/bath. We liked the large safe provided in the bathroom (unique to Cityscape suites), which was plenty large enough to put in our netbook bag, my wife's purse, and our portable DVD player, which we didn't need because the bedroom had its own player provided. High speed internet (provided free in the cityscape suite) was fast and easy to use with the code obtained from the desk. The Keurig coffee maker in the room was a nice bonus. View was not bad, esp. given that we were wedged between a few large buildings (the view from the 22nd floor fitness center is even better). Shower had good temperature and water pressure. The towels offered were the largest I've ever seen -- very comfy! Included breakfast was adequate, if uninspiring. Cereal, muffins, bagels, yogurt, cheese, fruit -- standard fare. Hotel is in a great location, walking distance to Eaton Center and connected to the Path via the parking garage. The cons: The parking garage is very compact. The spaces are narrow, there isn't a lot of room to get in and out of the spaces, and the entrance & exit is very tight. Upon returning to the garage one day, someone parked in front of a sign that clearly said "NO PARKING AT ANY TIME", essentially cutting off the proper angle for entering the garage, causing us to scrape our fender on the guard on the way in. After a few days of the exact same menu, the breakfast was, frankly, boring. The hotel would do well to mix up the offerings a little. As for the room itself, a few simple things stood out. First, almost all of the doors stuck. The two french doors leading into the bedroom didn't match (the windows on one were longer than the other). Also, the bedroom was a bit cramped with two doubles; almost wished we had booked a king and shared with our daughter. Tile on the bathroom floor was scuffed, and the tub itself was very obviously patched. The furniture in the lounge area was a little too big -- we couldn't get the refrigerator door open fully because of the large round end-table. About half of the refrigerator space is taken up by minibar items, which reduces its usefulness. We also had one day where we left our room by 9:30am and didn't return until after 4, and yet the room hadn't been cleaned. The front desk explained that it is not uncommon for room cleaning to take until 5:30pm (maybe because checkout time is so late -- 1pm?) None of the above interfered with our stay, but just stood out as odd, or perhaps a lack of attention to detail. Speaking of lack of attention to detail, we encountered a VERY serious oversight on the part of housekeeping when turning over our room from the previous guests. Fortunately, the front desk staff was as shocked as we were, and the head of housekeeping personally came up to correct the problem and further inspect our suite. Upon returning to our room that night, there was a very kind note and a small gift from the assistant manager apologizing for the incident. We felt this was VERY appropriately handled by the hotel staff -- not too flippant, not too excessive. Well done! All in all, despite its flaws, we had a very good stay, and enjoyed the location very much. I would definitely return to Cambridge Suites the next time I am in Toronto, and I would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “U Can't Beat this Hotel for Price and Value”
Reviews.Author: ILUVFOOD
Reviews.Content: We felt this was an amazing value for Toronto. Two room suite with two flat screen televisions in an immaculate hotel. You get a decent breakfast for the $205 price per night and there's even a place to wash your laundry if you need to do that. Excellent front desk staff. I say look no further than this place for the best deal in Toronto. Lots of business professionals agree. The place is packed with them!

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: MBlaha
Reviews.Content: Very central right in the heart of downtown Toronto, this hotel is a good choice to explore the city. Don't worry about going there by car; we did so without having stayed in the city before and without navigation systems (only equipped with the - unprecise - map of the car rental company), and it was no problem at all! Safe parking is provided by the hotel. Beautiful and spacious suites at a really reasonable price. Definitely worth visiting - and staying!

Reviews.Title: “Spot-on for a city trip”
Reviews.Author: MoxBxl
Reviews.Content: A perfect choice for a trip to Toronto. Spacious suite, large bathroom, plenty of storage - slightly dated deco, but all clean and well maintained. Located right in the centre, so a perfect base to explore Toronto. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Small gym, good breakfast. Exactly what you need if you're on a city trip - a satisfying experience!

Reviews.Title: “Met and exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: EMMS
Reviews.Content: We started our 2 week holiday in Canada with 4 nights at the Cambridge Suites hotel - and we weren't disappointed. We had a Cityscape room which offered fabulous views, 2 spacious rooms each with a massive TV, excellent bathroom with plenty of space and a power shower, great breakfast, location superb, staff courteous and helpful - they even have bikes which we used to visit the Toronto islands (great way to spend half a day).

Reviews.Title: “Wedding- hotel for out-of-towners”
Reviews.Author: Gus002
Reviews.Content: My wife and I retired a few years ago. Prior to that we stayed at different hotels in Toronto regularly. This hotel seemed to us to be the best value and we chose it for the out-of-towners for our daughter's wedding. The whole wedding came off perfectly; we were very pleased with how the hotel looked after our wedding guests. The front desk, the household and restaurant staff were all great. The hotel does a lot of little things right. We like the suite size rooms, good beds, location of the hotel (on the PATH underground walkway) and the workout room ( fine for our purposes). We booked cityscape rooms which came with breakfasts and free Wi-Fi - we thought was a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Surprise”
Reviews.Author: M C
Reviews.Content: I came to the Toronto Film Festival for the first time, picking this hotel of recommendations on Tripadvisor App. The hotel was very professionally run with helpful and courteous staff, well appointed rooms with all the facilities for the light business traveler (we really appreciated the inclusion of an easy to use WiFi service) and a really great in house restaurant, Portico, on the ground floor. The TIFF festival has movies in cinemas all over the downtown area and I would emphasize that the Cambridge Suites Hotel is perfectly situated in the middle of all the venues, putting all within equal walking distance. For this reason I would particularly recommend it to TIFF attendees; even over the more expensive hotels down near the festival's headquarters in King St West.

Reviews.Title: “Toronto Suites hotel”
Reviews.Author: Edmontonoutbound
Reviews.Content: Cambridge Suites has a convenient location on the eastern edge of Toronto's financial core. Free Wi-Fi and a continental breakfast (at least on corporate bookings) is an added value. Ask at the front desk for a free pass to an off site gym, about 2 blocks west. Shampoo and assorted toiletries are at the lower end of the scale. Quick checkout via receipt under the door helps to get out quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Large and spacious and very convenient”
Reviews.Author: tiisai
Reviews.Content: Room is a little dated but very spacious and clean... Can walk to everything downtown... Right across from Eaton

Reviews.Title: “nice location”
Reviews.Author: Solotraveller888
Reviews.Content: for shopping addicts . this is the right place. just a block away from EATON SHOPPING CENTER and 15 minute walk to the AMC center. you can book a trip to NIAGARA near the AMC. much ceaper than booking with the hotel, the deluxe room is huge , the bed is comfortable. aircondition works perfect and no noise. onlt complain ...need more effort cleaning the room. take the tram is chinatown for 3 dollars.. the best chinese food i have ever tasted. you can also take the tram to king street WEST the so clles entertainment district. if you prefer to walk to the area,, it takes around 2o minutes

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but starting to show its age”
Reviews.Author: GR_MI_traveler
Reviews.Content: Last weekend was our third stay at the Cambridge Suites in Toronto.
