The downtown location is close to the subway, Eaton Center, and a short walk to the lake shore and other attractions. We enjoy the space and amenities of the large suite, which are hard to find in downtown Toronto. For being downtown, it has good windows, so you don't hear the street traffic and can get a good nights rest. It is reasonably priced (for a downtown hotel) on the weekends and holidays. The best rates are on their website. If you plan to have 4 people in the room, do not go for the cheapest price which only has a sofa (and not a pull-out sofa). The reason for only 4 stars, instead of 5, is the hotel is starting to show its age. There have been recent soft renovations, but the hard fixtures (e.g. sink, counter-top, tub) are starting to show signs of 10+ years of wear.

Reviews.Title: “nice, but a little noisy”
Reviews.Author: thenev
Reviews.Content: Nice place to stay, v central. Found it a little noisy at night so pack the earplugs if ur a light sleeper.

Reviews.Title: “A true gem in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: AndrewW2
Reviews.Content: This was a fantastic, high value and quality accommodation that Iâ€™d return to any time in Toronto. I am actually a Toronto native and stayed here during a return trip to my home town. The location cannot be beat and what really made the difference was the staff. The staff held the highest standards, better than youâ€™d fine and large luxury chain hotels - a real testament to Canadian hospitality and the Canadian hotel business. Rooms are excellent and all rooms are suites. This means a separate living area from the bedroom. This extra space and a sofa make all the difference. There are two fantastic flat screen tvâ€™s in each of the rooms and a coffee maker, fridge and microwave. The room was spotless and in excellent condition. The dÃ©cor was neutral and enjoyable. Lots of space, including in the toilet area was very appreciated. There were three of us staying for three nights and the room was very comfortable for three adults. The pull out bed was comfortable and had nice bedding kept in the drawers. Small touches like an Ipod player and nice toiletries were very much appreciated. Real value add was the free wifi in the reception which also seems to reach upstairs. Although in increments of 30 minutes, the wifi was free and very appreciated when most other hotels take the opportunity to gouge you. In the lobby, there was ice water and apples and the hotel had umbrellas to borrow â€“ really appreciate the attention to detail. A big thanks to the staff, including Ryan who made the trip very memorable. I would definitely stay here again in Toronto. This is a fantastic property.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sylvy1952
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel by sheer chance as we had booked another hotel but on arrival found it unsuitable for our stay.The Cambridge Suites were just what we wanted near to the sightseeing spots and lots of restaurants.The suite was very comfortable and large enough for the 3 adults in our party,staff were very helpfull and friendly. We did eat in the hotel restaurant one night and the food was really good found a great place for breakfast called The Sunset Grill food was good and very reasonably priced. The only thing I did find annoying was the extra charges for WiFi and car parking which were quite excessive, as having stayed in lots of hotels on our trip this was the only one we had to pay for WiFi and parking, Would stay here again and reccomend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for small family.”
Reviews.Author: chnc3288
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in a standard suite over Labor Day weekend with our 2 boys, ages 4 and 6. If I return to Toronto, I will seek out this hotel again. Major pluses: + Unlike so many suites we have tried over the years, the thermostat was quite effective at keeping the temperature consistent in all 3 rooms (living room, bedroom, and bathroom) no matter which doors were open or closed. The fan speed adjusted by itself to regulate the temperature, but also did not shut down completely, so the white noise level was quite consistent. So many other hotels have noisy systems that wake up the kids as they cycle on and off overnight. This made a big difference in allowing all 4 of us to sleep soundly in our respective rooms. + The king bed in the bedroom was excellent, being firm but with a soft layer on top. We didn't sink toward the middle at all. The pillows were allergen-free, another rare find (I have severe dust allergies), and were supportive at the neck while still allowing the head to sink ergonomically down. + All surfaces had been wiped clean, which is quite unusual. Usually, there is some stickiness or greasiness . . . somewhere. + The layout allowed us to put our boys to bed in the living room, while enjoying some quiet evening time in the bedroom afterward The bathroom could be entered directly from the bedroom or the living room, so we didn't have to walk through and wake them up every time we needed the bathroom. + The fitness room on the top floor has a sauna, beautiful whirlpool, recumbent bike, treadmill, free weights, and exercise balls. + The location was an easy walking distance for small children from the TTC subway, several street car lines, Union Station, and St. Lawrence Market. We didn't go to the mall, but it's also quite close by. + Parking in the underground garage was included with our package for the weekend. + We didn't hear a peep from any other room. They must have excellent sound proofing.

Reviews.Title: “A Bit Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: 3onaTrip
Reviews.Content: A family of three with eight year old stayed in room 2106, a Cityscape 2-Doubles Suite, for three nights. As a result of hurricane Irene, our flight to San Diego was canceled and we chose Toronto as a last minute substitute destination. Based on Trip Advisor reviews, we selected this hotel. We were disappointed by the small size of the room and felt claustrophobic having windows so close to the adjacent high rise office building. The nightly rate of $251.10 (Canadian) included a hot buffet breakfast, a $25 credit to Portico (hotel restaurant), and fruit flavored cold water in the lobby. Self parking was $22 per night in an adjacent garage. The hotel is a block from downtown Yonge Street, about a mile to the CN Tower, less than two miles to the Royal Ontario Museum, and about four miles to Casa Loma. We had dinner and dessert at Portico, which we enjoyed very much, but we would not have tried it but for the $25 credit.

Reviews.Title: “A very well run hotel in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: keithfrombucks
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from the annual trip to visit our son who works and lives in Toronto. Having been impressed with Cambridge Suites Hotel during a two week stay last year would things be the same this time round? We need not have worried the Hotel delivered the same high level of comfort, customer service and value as before. From the front desk through to the spacious well maintained accommodation all aspects of of our experience pleased. The house style seems to be calm efficiency, just what older folk such as ourselves need. A two week stay is normally ample time to tease out any failings in an establishment and apart from a couple of minor blips we thoroughly enjoyed our extended vacation. Cambridge Suites is ideally located in Downtown Toronto for transport links, the vibrant Waterfront, museums, shops and all other major attractions in this wonderful city. As we anticipate being annual visitors to Toronto for the foreseeable future our intention is to continue to support Cambridge Suites, which has, thus far, exceeded our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, but outstanding value”
Reviews.Author: Animal70
Reviews.Content: This is NOT a hotel with a big imposing lobby, a huge pool, a 5-star restaurant, and a lively rooftop bar. If you need these things, go elsewhere. This IS a hotel that gets all the essentials right at a great price. It is centrally located. Suites are large with appropriate furnishings. Everything is clean. Design is simple...not too modern, but not tired either. You might even say everything looks a bit cheap, but in a functional sort of way. The staff are friendly, attentive and helpful. The restaurant in the lobby (Portico) is a mirror image of the rest of the hotel -- simple menu, but good food at reasonable prices. I agree with all the reviews that suggest this is a great place for families. If you want to stay in downtown Toronto with children, this is an excellent choice. None of this would be deserving of the highest rating on TripAdvisor alone however. What makes this a fantastic package is the price. This has to be the best value in Toronto. I will certainly be back.

Reviews.Title: “great location great staff”
Reviews.Author: dgmsd
Reviews.Content: had a great time here staff were friendly and knowledgeable. Nice gym sauna whirlpool on the top floor overlooking the city. Staff arranged a car to take us to the airport cheaper than the shuttle for three and very swanky

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Wazari09
Reviews.Content: This rooms are excellent and everything is new and confortable. The space is also very good and the bedroom is separated from the living room, wich gives some privacy. The staff is outstanding and always ready to attend you in all your neeeds. The location is also very good, just beside Eaton Center and all the main attractions. The negative side is that they charge for the wifi, although they provide a business center with 2 PCs, internet and printer for free, and that there is no safe on the rooms. I would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in an excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: Graham H
Reviews.Content: The Cambridge Suites Hotel is in a great location, a block away from the Eaton Centre and close to a subway entrance. The hotel also has direct access to the PATH which is perfect for escaping the weather. The rooms in the hotel are nice and large with a separate bedroom and lounge. There are coin-operated laundry facilities which is perfect for long stays. The staff are always friendly and will to help with an enquiry. I stayed at the hotel for 2.5 months and would throughly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “WE WOULD BE BACK”
Reviews.Author: Rubbery36
Reviews.Content: Booked in here after our orignal hotel was not suitable for wheelchair users as I am, stayed with my wife in a suite and the room was perfect. All staff at hotel were pleasant and dealt us in a very proffesional manner. Had a meal in the hotel restaurant which was first class and found the access to all down town attractions very easy, was only minutes away from Eaton center and a pleasent walk to the CN Tower and Ferry to the Islands. Would recommend this Hotel as a first port of call to all friends. Only thing I would recommed was double beds instead of Queen beds as they are a little small for persons over six feet tall and large in stature.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: CMcD79
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Thurs-Sun. Booked a City Scape suite so we got free breakfast daily downstairs, and free WIFI. (booked it on their website) It was worth it because the ease of going downstairs for breakfast was nice, the food options are a bit limited (we stayed at a holiday inn Sun night and they had more options), cereal, eggs, oatmeal, toasts, yogurts, juices and fruit but it was enough. Just got boring after 2 days. The room itself was clean and well kept. The maid did a turn down service at night and brought up 2 bottles of water, chocolate and pulled the curtains shut, nice touch. The bathrooms do need some updating, they weren't horrible by any means just doesn't exactly match the room. My boyfriend used the gym and said it wasnt great, the machines werent exactly working. We did use the the gym they have an association with that was a few blocks away, which was pretty good. The hotel gives 4 hours complimentary use of their bikes and provides a lock and helmet, which we did utilize, and it was fun to ride down to the water front and had lunch. All the staff was very friendly and helpful. They called taxi's or car services for us when we needed it. They even had an umbrella to use for the rainy night. Convenient location. All in all I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value in the Heart of Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Debbie154984
Reviews.Content: Upon our arrival at the reception desk, we were offered an upgraded Cityscape corner suite which was spacious, spotlessly clean, with a comfortable King bed, and a large bathroom with separate shower and bath that sparkled, with lovely toiletries included. We were very pleasantly surprised by the welcoming note and chilled bottle of Peller Sauvignon Blanc from Mark of Guest Services. With its central location in downtown Toronto, we were able to take advantage of great dining and entertainment options. From the courtesy of the cleaning staff, to the welcoming nature of the reception staff, to management sending pre and post-visit messages, we feel that the entire TEAM at the Cambridge Suites is "on their game"! My wife and I look forward to our next visit to Toronto and we will be staying with the folks at Cambridge Suites. Kudos to all.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable and Convenient.”
Reviews.Author: LBennett03
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel because of the high rating from Trip Advisor but also we got a very reasonable pre-pay deal. Parking is extra at $22 but for downtown Toronto, that is a good price (especially for underground private parking!). The location is perfect if you want quick access to the Eaton Centre and the subway line. Bed was very comfortable and impressed with the fact they have a recyling and composting programme. You could even cancel the daily paper delivery and your account would be credited for the cost of the newspaper. Having on en-suite refrigerator and microwave also was very handy. We were on a higher floor and being no stranger to downtown Toronto, we found it quite quiet. I also wanted to give the room attendant a special thank you and we had forgotten an item and she was able to arrange for its return very quickly. Have already recommended this hotel to others, especially if you are travelling for an extended period of time or with family.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: stuartSydney
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location. Couldn't be more central in TO. Staff very helpful with all requests. Rooms a great size. We stayed in cityscapes suite Very big suites. Would stay here again for sure. Free wifi also very fast

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Service”
Reviews.Author: Chan P
Reviews.Content: We stopped for a drink at the Porticore Restaraunt after dinner. Elaine was our server and she was fantastic. Whenever I would say thank you - she would say - "with pleasure" and that made me feel special. Thanks Elaine!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: WendyM58
Reviews.Content: I searched for a suites hotel in downtown Toronto with a balcony to no avail. Finally settled on this instead and we were extremely happy with it. Location was wonderful, less than a block to Eaton Centre and a subway station, lots of restaurants and other shopping nearby. Didn't wish for the balcony once, we were hardly in the room anyway, and when we were, we just wanted to cool off. The parking here is excellent, lots of space, even for a full-sized car. We actually chose to take a taxi one evening for convenience instead of the car, and the hotel is so close to everything that the taxi was very cheap. People were friendly and helpful, would definitely choose this again. One caution, the restaurant is ridiculously expensive for breakfast, and it wasn't even that good. We found several places for breakfast nearby, especially Mon-Fri (not as many choices on the weekend).

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay and good value”
Reviews.Author: DOD56
Reviews.Content: We were in town for a conference and stayed here because it was less expensive than even the discount group rate at the headquarters hotel. We are glad we did. This is a true suite hotel, with separate bedroom and living rooms. There are a large refrigerator, microwave, iron and ironing board, and coffee maker, and plenty of outlets for all those electronics we lug around these days. Both rooms have large, flat screen TVs. A nice touch - the bathroom is equipped with assist bars and the barrier at the bottom of the large stall shower can be removed for wheelchair access. Our quibbles about the room itself are minor. For a fairly new place, some of the cabinetry seems cheap and is already showing wear; the bedroom and closet doors were always getting in each other's way; and the lamps on either side of the sofa are not very practical - it was hard to find a good reading position. Several days we would come back in late afternoon to find our room not yet made up. We would have to cool our heels in the bar to get out of the maid's way, but we were not unduly inconvenienced. There are a suana, hot tub, and exercise machines on the top floor. There are a bar and restaurant on the ground floor. We did not try the restaurant, but overheard many favorable comments. Parking is $22. per night - by my research, the cheapest around. WIFI is charged by the day or week. The hotel is conveniently located for most business and pleasure travelers. A subway stop is just around the corner. All the staff were very pleasant and friendly. We really felt welcome. If you want to stay in this area of Toronto, we urge you to check out the Cambridge Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Spent our 12th anniversary here, and it was great.”
Reviews.Author: Patrick_G1976
Reviews.Content: Originally I booked over the phone. I received my confirmation email shortly after and noticed a mistake. I called back and the mistake was fixed without hesitation or hassles. When we arrived the front desk was very courteous and friendly. When we walked in to our room, there was, at first, a bit of a cigarette smell in our room, but it seemed to quickly dissipate within an hour or so (I'm sure that the guest before us didn't realize that this was a non-smoking establishment ... not the hotels fault, so we don't blame them). The bed was nice enough (I'm never extremely comfortable in beds other than my own), and I slept quite well. Check out was very simple and quick. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who is staying in a downtown location. Close to shopping and theaters.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeds Expectations”
Reviews.Author: WinterBreak
Reviews.Content: Suite hotels tend to be cookie-cutter and dull, with low ceilings. Cambridge Suites works with this basic model but pumps up the volume. Desk staff were super nice and responsive, and the room was much bigger than we had a right to expect. Same with the fitness center--who'd a thunk we'd get a whirlpool and sauna and big sunny windows?

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't get better than this in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: jessikaCalgary
Reviews.Content: Clean, spacious rooms along with amazing service and a perfect location. Very few hotels have a 1 PM check out and they even extended ours to 2 PM with no hesitation what-so-ever. Furthermore, we are a family with 3 kids and they accommodated our whole family in one of their 1 bedroom suite rooms. Most hotels make us get 2 rooms. The bathrooms are clean, functional and spacious and the hotel is pristine with comfortable beds. The exercise room is a little tight but space is at a premium in Toronto. Breakfast is fine---not superb but you can certainly find some nutritious, filling choices. Will definitely stay there again next time we visit Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: cpayne
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the hotel for 4 days. Very nice hotel with exceptional staff! Rooms are spacious and clean. We had the suite which was great since we have two kids. The location of the property is great and if you love walking, you can really get around the city on foot (Younge street is just a block away). However, public transportation is also close by. The staff was always happy and went out of there way to accomodate our needs. The free breakfast was just OK (eggs, fruit, waffles, etc.). Great stay and would definitely stay again if we ever go back to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good rooms but shame about the smelly shower drain and restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Nina_newforest
Reviews.Content: A great base for exploring the city, right in the centre. The room was clean and spacious, bed was really comfy and all the staff were super helpful and friendly. The only areas for improvement are the bathroom/wet room drain which was extremely smelly and the breakfast offered in the resturant was poor.... a bit of scrambled eggs, some fruit and cereal - not the usual tasty canadian cooked breakfast we'd become accustomed to in other Canadian hotels and lodges. Other than that we'd come back and stay at the Cambridge Suites

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Great Stay!"”
Reviews.Author: bruceli_88
Reviews.Content: My family was in Toronto for 3 weeks in Canada and of which we stayed about 10 days at Cambridge Suites in July 2011. The last time when we were in Toronto was about 25 years ago when my wife and I were still students. Cambridge Suites is right in the heart of downtown Toronto, within walking distance of Yonge and Queen, in fact, if you like walking, you can cover most of downtown on foot even to Chinatown to the northwest, Harbourfront in the south, Jarvis on the east and a good stretch of Yonge on the north. Cambridge Suites has got one of the friendliest people around - always helpful and polite. Service is excellent, and you will always see a big smile no matter if it was early in the morning or late in the evening. The suites are large enough to easily cater to 4 adults. The business centre, though small, is sufficient to check emails or browse the web for more interesting things to do in Toronto! There is a small gym right at the top-floor which you can see Toronto beautiful skyline - especially during the night. It also comes with a restaurant on the ground floor, and a coin-operated laundry room in the basement - great that you need not bring that much clothes when you can wash and dry them within 2 hours!! Food? Well, there's a convenience store just right opposite which opens late - great if you need to grab some munchies for the late night, or there's a Subway across the hotel. Tim Hortons, McDonalds and a bunch of quick-eats are just round the corner on Yonge, or if you rather the food court at Eaton Centre. For us, breakfast was at the Sunset Grill just up the street on Richmond. The staff is very friendly and accommodating but it can get pretty busy!! As for transport, Queens subway is just below Eaton Centre, accessible through the Hudson Bay building ... but when you have so much to see, who needs the subway! Overall, we really enjoyed our stay at Cambridge Suites. Great stuff you guys!!

Reviews.Title: “Just what I needed”
Reviews.Author: tallbanker
Reviews.Content: Central location convenient to business district, terrifically friendly and helpful staff, clean modern comfortable rooms (great bed!), no-fuss climate control, good assortment of breakfast choices for the continental breakfast, handy "kiosk" for printing airline boarding passes. Would definitely stay here again, and would even pay my own money on a non-business visit! A little street noise, but, hey, this is a big city, and it was not intrusive.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel- Great Town”
Reviews.Author: jrjojo
Reviews.Content: Loved the Cambridge Suites Hotel - while visiting Toronto for a Red Sox-Blue Jays game we were pleased to find this very centrally located (and affordable) gem of a hotel. Their rates and service were quite good (although the room service-in-a-box we could have done without).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NYMpotter
Reviews.Content: This review is slightly overdue, but my husband, myself and another couple stayed at this hotel for a weekend in March 2011. Each couple had our own one bedroom suite and it was very spacious and clean with a king size bed, refrigerator, stocked mini bar, and large bathroom. The city views out of our corner suite were incredible. For being in the heart of downtown, Toronto you could not hear the noise from the street in the least. Cambridge Suites is in a superb location. The weather was nice, at a balmy 35 F and no snow or rain that weekend, so walking long distances was not a problem for us. The Eaton Centre is about a half a mile away, and there are a variety of other little shops and restaurants on the way. Queen Street E. (the young hip bar/shopping scene) is about a mile away, and very accessible if you are staying at this hotel. Also the farmer's market, which is heavily advertised in the brochures throughout the hotel, is so-so. Kind of cramped and busy on a Saturday. It seems like it's the place to get your fresh fish and meats for the locals. Pros: Great bed, spacious suite (with two flat screen TVs), location and more location (it is really in the center of everything), clean, large bath. Cons: Restaurant is super pricey - we did not eat or even order drinks from here, and you must pay for parking. SPA is just o.k., it would be nice if they had a pool, but that is just my preference. **Tip the hotel is on a one-way street so as you are coming down Richmond, the hotel will be located on your left. Look out for its sign; we passed by once and had to go around the block again, which took 15 minutes because of traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for downtown toronto”
Reviews.Author: Philpoo
Reviews.Content: My wife i and our son were going to toronto for 1 week and we were looking for a "suite hotel" and found Cambridge suites. It was an incredible value for the price I was able to get especially since we had a bedroom and he had a sleeper sofa in the living room. The living room had a nice table where we ate breakfast, a refrig and microwave. the bathroom had 2 entrances which was nice. The front desl staff was OUTSTANDING and helpful in every way. There was complimentary coffee in the lobby in the AM and fruited water after that. Had the bedroom been a little larger or had more drawer space I would have given it 5 stars instead of 4. Would definitely return to the property.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in dowtown Toronto!”
Reviews.Author: MartyDouglas
Reviews.Content: Four days for a lake cruise, theatre, dining out, visits with friends required a central location in walking distance to several venues or short taxi rides. Cambridge Suites filled the bill with a suite that gave us room to spread out, entertain or just duck the heat on the hottest day in Toronto's history. The concierge and front desk service was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Boytts
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located in a quiet location. Reception staff were friendly and very helpful. spacious room with kitchenette, all very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great suites for the price of a room”
Reviews.Author: NYChrisF
Reviews.Content: Located in Downtown Toronto, the Cambridge Suites Hotel is literally steps away from everything. We have Cityscape suite which offers a spacious bedroom with incredibly comfortable king bed, full bath, living room with sleeper sofa, dining area and fully-stocked kitchenette with sink and microwave. In-room coffeemaker is a Keurig with excellent individual-cup coffee brewing. Housekeeping provides all the milk, cream, sugar, etc. you want , as often as you want. Ditto the bath supplies, which are high-quality Pharmacopia soaps, shampoo, conditioner and body lotions. Also provided: shower caps, hair dryer, oversized bath towels and plush bathrobe. After a day of sightseeing, all this plus the sauna on the 21st floor make me wish we weren't leaving tomorrow. More notes: Toronto has an excellent transportation system, and the Cambridge Suites Hotel is close to subways, buses and trolleys, so there is no need to worry about a car, parking, etc. Hotel offers a complimentary continental breakfast, served in the adjacent Portico Restaurant from 6:30-9:30AM weekdays, and 7-10AM weekends. If this is early for you, less than a block away is the Sunset Grill, serving breakfast 7AM-4PM. Cityscape suites offer complimentary wireless internet. Hotel staff is welcoming, helpful and cheerful. Concierge made great suggestions for restaurants, of which there are every imaginable ethnicity and price range in this cosmopolitan city. If you're staying a week or more, why pay for an ordinary, overpriced room in an overrated hotel when you can literally get an apartment? On second thought, maybe we won't leave tomorrow!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: Lynnie660
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed two nights at this hotel with two friends. We had a lovely, quiet, clean room with a separate livingroom. It was everything we wanted in a hotel - good location for shopping and we really enjoyed the proximity to the theatre where we had tickets to see a musical. The staff at the reception desk was very helpful in recommending a great Italian restaurant nearby as well as directions to Yorkdale mall. I would highly recommend this hotel for families. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “great location, super hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CGHM
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights with our 2 children (ages 5+7) The staff were all very helpful and the suite was of a very high standard. The hotel is very central and 2 minutes walk from a huge shopping mall. The suite had everything you would expect - cutlery, plates, microwave, fridge etc and the main bed was so comfortable i thought i was at home! Check out was 1pm which was great.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Penny8964
Reviews.Content: The room, the view, the continental breakfast, the service, and the location were all perfect. I highly recommend this hotel. It even had on-site parking at a very affordable price. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, good value for Toronto”
Reviews.Author: TrotamundosBetis
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while attending a wedding in the area. Rooms are very large and comfortable if a bit dated in decor. Location is fantastic and the price, relative to other Toronto hotels, was quite reasonable. By chance, others attending the wedding also ended up staying here and all were favourably impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, wonderfull suite, helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: 2dwills
Reviews.Content: We visited Toronto from July 2 to July 7, 2011. I have never been there and was choosing a hotel based solely on advertising description. Cambridge Suites was perfect for us and I would definitely stay again. The location is excellent...walkable distance to Dundas Square, Eaton Centre, the theater, wonderful restaurants, and other "must see" attractions. The two concierges were extremely helpful before the trip (very patient...I called with many questions) and when we arrived as we planned our days. Front desk personnel always had smiles, even when the lobby was very busy. All "behind the scenes" staff members we met were cheerful and welcoming. Our room was amazing! We were on the ninth floor in a corner room, with windows all around. Watching the city below in early mornings and late at night was a real treat. The suite feature's living room gave us a place to relax before dinner, and also gave the night-owl TV space while I slept in the other room. This may sound like a small thing, but it's not after a long day of sightseeing....the bed was very comfortable. Not a board, not all puff, but perfect. Buffet breakfast was delicious and the restaurant very attractive.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place with fantastic people.”
Reviews.Author: Newed10
Reviews.Content: I have had half a dozen business trips to Toronto in the past 18 months. Fortunately, on my first trip, a colleague recommended the Cambridge Suites Hotel - and I've stayed there every trip since! The location is great - handy to public transit and highways in and out of Toronto. The suites are very comfortable, and relieve that "stuck in a hotel room" feeling you get on the road. But the best part is the people!! tI seems like all the staff want to make sure that you truly enjoy your stay. Their incredible. They're definitely doing something right at the Cambridge Suites in Toronto!

Reviews.Title: “A classy grown-up hotel that welcomes little kids”
Reviews.Author: EmSom
Reviews.Content: Beautiful suite especially for the price--the cityscape suite layout was perfect for sharing a room with our young son.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice staff, a little bit dated”
Reviews.Author: dogsareforlife
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a Christmas trip in Dec. Hotel is in a great location and the staff we encountered were really friendly. The suite was fine - we had a very high floor which gave us a good view. Given it was COLD and snowy in Toronto, the rooms were warm and welcoming. After 4 days the complimentary breakfast, which doesn't change, was a bit boring. Quality was OK but nothing special. Hotel restaurant has a nice atmosphere. Housekeeping could have been a bit more thorough with the hoovering and dusting but overall the room was clean (included the somewhat dated bathroom) The king-sized Bed was very comfortable. We appreciated a complimentary bottle of wine which was delivered after we had checked in. I would choose this hotel again - its not a luxury hotel but it does represent good value for money. The micro brewery opposite was VERY enjoyable and served great food and beer - ideal if you are tired after a day's sightseeing. Also liked the old brewery area and the Christmas Market.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: Familytraveler69
Reviews.Content: I found this place here on tripadvisor, and given good reviews, decided to try. I called them directly, got great service, and a good rate. The location is perfect, right downtown, very close to the Eaton Centre, and less than a block to the subway. Baseball and basketball stadiums within walking distance, less than 30 minutes away, but also a short subway ride. Nice breakfast included, and the rooms are a nice suite, if a little small (for a suite, definitely a lot bigger than a regular hotel room). Internet included as well. Other than the fact it lacks a swimming pool, it is a very good hotel and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service at the Cambridge!”
Reviews.Author: BriaNicole
Reviews.Content: My mom & I stayed at the Cambridge Suites for 4 nights. It's in a great location in the middle of downtown. However, you don't have to worry about street noise or other guest noise. All the rooms are suites and are kept very clean. It's not a luxury hotel by any means but it's clean,spacious and the customer service was incredible. When booking, I put a comment that is was a special mother/daughter trip & we were surprised w/ a fruit/cheese platter from the restaurant that night....how sweet! I loved how spacious the suites were and we booked a cityscape suite & the view was great. I definitely think the suite was worth the extra money b/c of the free wifi, complimentary breakfast & views. This is a hotel I would recommend to my family/friends. Thanks Cambridge Suites for making this a special trip for my Mother & I....smiles!!:)

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable with many perks - and definitely a "green" hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: TriciaJean
Reviews.Content: I made my reservations based on previous reviews on Tripadvisor and its location near the Sheraton Hotel conference center. The hotel is not "flashy," but has so many perks. The reception staff are friendly and helpful. Tthe lobby is very small. I stayed in a 3-room suite (bedroom, living room, bathroom), and it was definitely larger than most hotel rooms of comparable price. I loved so many things in the room: 2 flat-screen TVs, the recycling bin (go green!), the absolutely comfortable mattresses and duvet covers, the iphone/ipod clock radio, the drawers in the bathroom. Actually, that was one of my favorite perks - the dresser drawers are in the bathroom, next to the sink. How practical! The shower/tub/toilet room is a little dark and not as nice as the rest of the suite, but clean and just fine. ELAINE in the Portico bar was fabulous. I had room service the first night and didn't feel like going out on the 2nd night so went down to the hotel restaurant/bar. My dining experience was perfect, because of Elaine. She was so friendly, gave good recommendations, and went out of her way to make my dining experience in the bar enjoyable. She was the best!! I traveled alone, but would definitely come back with my husband and daughter to the same hotel. I was very pleased that I stayed at the Cambridge Suites rather than the conference hotel down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place”
Reviews.Author: doug062
Reviews.Content: Just like all the reviews read clean & helpful staff. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shoopashoop
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed for five nights and very much enjoyed ourselves. I've read recent reviews and found them generally congruent with our experiences. Our room was spacious and clean. Continental breakfast was very good. The hotel restaurant (Portico) was very good. Parking was easy if a bit pricey ($22 per night). Wi-fi was free for our particular suite package but it was painfully slow (except in the lobby) and we are unsure of the security features employed by the hotel (someone tried to hack his email account). The exercise room/hot tub/sauna were great. The hotel also has a few bikes that you can sign out and ride around town! Staff were very friendly and helpful (Andy was particularly positive). Located in the heart of Toronto, I'd stay here again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Everyone loved the hotel - too bad we are not going back to Toronto in the near future”
Reviews.Author: swansfromBoston
Reviews.Content: We (family of 4 including 2 children ages 8 and 11) spent 1 night in Niagara Falls followed by 4 nights in Toronto for a summer vacation. We chose the Cambridge Suites hotel due to its fantastic rating on TripAdvisor along with a great rate on their web site. They are also mentioned in Frommers. They had parking under the hotel which was convenient since we drove to Toronto, and also several of the sites were wanted to visit (Toronto Zoo, Canada's Wonderland, Ontario Science Center,) were visited by car. We booked a king bed/sofabed suite. The suite itself was very spacious (?550 sq feet) and had 3 rooms that were connected like a tripod. The living area had a pull out sofa, a chair, coffee table, desk and table. There was a minibar wall with a microwave, sink, and refrigerator. The living room was connected to the bedroom by French doors with opaque glass. The bathroom had 2 doors - one to the living area and one to the bedroom. The suite furnishings and bathroom were up to date. There were two flat screen tvs, one in the bedroom and one in the living room. Having a microwave and refrigerator were invaluable. The kids had popcorn every night, and we ate breakfast in the room every morning. We had debated getting two doubles instead of the king bed, but the opportunity for privacy (having our own bedroom and the children on the sofabed) and slight cost savings outweighed the possibility of a parent having to sleeping on the sofabed. I am happy to report that the sofabed was surprisingly comfortable. The king bed was extremely comfortable. The room was well cleaned every day. The front desk staff was very polite and helpful. They need better photos on their website as the photos do not do the room justice!

Reviews.Title: “Great for family travel!”
Reviews.Author: LLynn
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my mother and son July 1st & 2nd 2011. Cambridge Suites Hotel is easy to get to from main highways in Toronto and provides on-site self parking ($22). You can enter & leave as often as you need to with your car for no extra charge but the hotel is pretty much within walking distance of major activities/sights including the CN tower, Hockey Hall of Fame, shopping, restaurants, etc. The front desk staff was immensely helpful and friendly. Our room wasn't ready yet in the morning when we checked in but the staff gave me a courtesy call on my cell phone when it was ready and already had our bags in the room when we came back later that afternoon. From local maps to questions about local restaurants - the staff was very able to happily answer all of our questions. We were given a $25 food voucher for the on-site restaurant Portico and the food was absolutely fantastic. We had it delivered to our room for a reasonable fee as we were tired from a day touring Toronto. Dinner arrived for three of us in less than 30 minutes! Continental breakfast the following morning was wonderful with scrambled eggs, warm oatmeal, bagels, muffins, yogurt and fruit but the best thing was the banana smoothie that was offerred along with several other juices/coffee. What a nice treat in the morning! Rooms are clean, comfortable and reasonably spacious. We had a room with two double beds and the living area had a comfortable pull out couch for my son. Each room had its own flat screen TV, mini bar, more than ample size bathroom and dining table that fit four but was easily prepped for business as a desk (plugs, etc.) It fit The only drawbacks is that it doesn't have a pool (although a fitness center w/ jacuzzi is available) and the in-room movies are expensive ($15.) We did not receive the wake up call we requested (thankfully we woke in time to get to our appointement) and a minor suggestion is that complimentary toiletries should include shower gel instead of bar soap. Overall....I would definitely recommend staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great comfortable place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: diane32724
Reviews.Content: The suite was spacious and very comfortable. The bathroom was divided so that the tub and toilet were in one room and the sink area had a huge dressing area with lots of counter space. The suite had two closets and lots of drawers. There were two flat screen televisions. The living room had a wet bar with a nice size refrigerator. The ice machines were centrally located. The staff at the Cambridge Suites were so friendly, and helpful. The hotel seemed to be in a quiet location. At first we were not sure that we had booked a place to stay in the right area of Toronto. It was in an area that was an easy walk to many places.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for families”
Reviews.Author: SJayinCT
Reviews.Content: This is a very well run suite hotel with a friendly and helpful staff. It is situated in the financial district and as such is convenient via walking, subway and/or trolley to most of the tourist attractions. The suites are spacious, quiet and include a separate bedroom. The living room has a comfortable pullout sofa, a microwave and a refrigerator. The cityscape rate includes free internet connection and continental breakfast for not much additional cost. A great choice for parents and children or grandparents and grand children. Ask the staff for restaurant recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “Fully recommended”
Reviews.Author: Stranger44
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Cambridge Suites for 5 nights in May along with 2 other couples and absolutely loved it. The location was fantastic, the suites were spacious and very comfortable, the breakfast was good, the service was excellent and the staff all very helpful and friendly. My partner and I had come to Canada to get married and we got to our room to find a bottle of sparkling wine and a platter of cheese, nuts and fruit which was a lovely surprise and a really nice touch. It wasn't the cheapest place but taking into account the cost of other hotels in the area and what we got for our money, we felt it was good value. The only slight niggle was that the wifi only seemed to work in patches. It was fine in our suite but didn't work at all in either of our friends' suites as the signal was not strong enough. Luckily there was the option for wired internet but it was still a slight inconvenience and presumably something which could be remedied.

Reviews.Title: “COMFORT, QUALITY, LOCATION & STYLE”
Reviews.Author: chris_devlin55
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in June 2011 and had a Cityscape Suite. We got a great rate - it pays to book early - we also found that the hotel's website gave the best rates when compared to all other sources. We arrived 4 hours before official check-in time but were immediately allocated our suite which meant more time to explore the city. Suites are excellent, spacious and comfortable and the hotel is just around the corner from Yonge Street and the Eaton Centre. The hotel is linked to the PATH system of underground shops and stores, so if it does rain, you can go shopping without getting wet. There is a good buffet breakfast with limited hot food (scrambled eggs etc) - the breakfast room can get a bit congested at busy times. There is an exercise room and hot tub on the top floor with views over the city. We had originally booked a different city hotel for our trip but changed to the Cambridge Suites when we saw reviews on Trip Advisor. We were also impressed to find that Tim, their General Manager took the time to respond to many of the comments made. Would return to this hotel without hesitation

Reviews.Title: “We stayed here two times in a row and it was great both stays. We will definitely come back.”
Reviews.Author: tacoma2011
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very well appointed, beds are comfortable, room are clean, nice to have bar fridge and microwave and kuerig coffeemaker. Continental breakfast was adequate. Hotel staff awesome, very very friendly, extremely helpful and always going out of their way for you. Great location, within walking distance to may restaurants, Eaton Centre and cabs always available. Hotel very accomadating, let us have early and late checkout,so baby could nap didn't charge us any extra. Thanks. Cambridge Suites

Reviews.Title: “Feels like home - everytime”
Reviews.Author: vosbuk
Reviews.Content: A great hotel in the downtown Toronto area, providing excellent service from check-in to departure. Love being greeted by name and the fact that my personal preferences are always taken care of for the next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, would definitely stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Nitro114
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, would definitely stay again on our next trip. Close to restaurants, shopping and trolley cart pick up out front. Rooms were a great size and staff were very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean and spacious”
Reviews.Author: Vadid
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel located very near Younge Street, entertainment, and 10min walk from lakeshore. Rooms clean with benefit of second room to relax in. Fridge, tea/coffee machine, good televisions, wi-fi, sink and microwave. Nice hot tub on top floor with city view. Also sauna. Service good. Breakfast ok if nothing special. Pillows a little lacking in support for me.

Reviews.Title: “Hmm, not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: RICHSHAR
Reviews.Content: Ok so we stayed in Italy at soem wonderful hotels, we had a flight from Rome to Toronto and arrived to pick up a rental car whilst there was a strike going on, this was very public and unpleasant. We arrived at the hotel which seemed to be organised chaos. Service was self help and staff were pretty much there for themselves. After the initial reality shock and I realised a different service culture prevailed I just got on with SELF HELP. Breakfast appeared again agmonst a competing for food and tables. Drove a rental car to niagara falls and enjoyed the interlude. Only passing through.

Reviews.Title: “Well situated, very comfortable suites”
Reviews.Author: HazeAus
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well situated, easily walkable to interesting places such as the entertainment district and is also directly connected to the PATH underground system. We came during an unseasonal heat wave and it was convenient to duck into what felt like our own tunnel on the way to explore the city. For the last leg of our honeymoon, we were happy with winding down in a nicely appointed suite at the location without a steep price to match. The staff were friendly and efficient. For a longish 5-night stay I was impressed with the unobtrusive yet effective housekeeping service, such that our suite was always kept immaculate without the feeling of having had our space (and progressively spread out gear) intruded upon. The continental breakfast had a nice selection and kept us going through our stay. Overall the hotel provided a very nice base for a relaxing week in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations”
Reviews.Author: Paul K
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Cityscape King & Sofabed room. Clean, quiet, outstanding staff. One block from bustling Yonge Street.

Reviews.Title: “Quietest room i've ever stayed in...”
Reviews.Author: Griffin83
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights the last week of May. We had an executive suite which was huge and very comfortable. A gigantic bed, seperate living room, which was very spacious and comfortable and 2 enormous TV's. It was bigger than some apartments! Best hotel i've used in Toronto and such a comfortable, quiet nights sleep, very little city noise made it into the room.

Reviews.Title: “For A Suite Stay - Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: Australian_Kiwis
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend. For Kiwis and Australians, who tend to travel for extended periods, this suite hotel is perfect. Great value, quiet, and perfect location for Shopping, Theatre, Tours, Cafes, Restaurants etc. Rooms are a good size, are clean & tidy and come with kitchenette (microwave) etc. City view beds are very comfortable. Lounge is separate to the bedroom with room for dining room table etc. Service throughout was excellent - many thanks to Mark and his team. (Even a thank you note from the housemaid). Guest laundry and inclusive internet is always welcome.

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Bernadette90
Reviews.Content: This hotel is center to downtown, very close to all the hustle and bustle but still a very quiet spot. Within walking distance to most things. The suite was spacious and very comfortable with all the things you would need. Staff was extremely helpful and very polite. Room was very clean. Cityscape suites entitle you to a complementary breakfast which was good but not alot of choices.Would reccommend this hotel to anyone traveling in the Greater Toronto Area that wants beautiful rooms with an affordable price.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay in Cambridge Suites”
Reviews.Author: AlanSusan
Reviews.Content: My DW and myself have just returned from a 7 night vacation in this hotel. It wa as wonderful experience and it is difficult to think of any negative comments. All staff that we came into contact with were friendly and very helpful. The location is excellent and we paid extra for a City Scape room which was on the 20th floor. The rooms were large and well maintained and this package had the benefits of both a complimentary continental breakfast plus internet access. The room that we had (2008) was also very quiet. We would not hesitate to stay here again if we were to return to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Our Favourite Hotel”
Reviews.Author: the_staycationers
Reviews.Content: This hotel is our overall favorite hotel of any hotel in any city we have been in. Very comfortable rooms, great downtown location, and friendly staff always make our stay at Cambridge Suites very enjoyable. Its too bad there isn't one in the other cities we like to visit :-)

Reviews.Title: “Amazing.”
Reviews.Author: adammacd
Reviews.Content: The room was absolutely perfect. Great value for money and the staff were extremely helpful. Also the location is great as it's close to everything. I will return, I had a perfect stay.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious Suites & Professional, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Micknyny
Reviews.Content: The suites are very spacious with the bedroom being completely isolated from the rest of the suite / hallway. There is a wet bar, refrig, and microwave in the room. If you are looking for an excellent night's sleep, this is the hotel: you would be hard pressed to hear any noise from the hallway or neighboring rooms. The room & bathroom could probably use a slight makeover as they are showing their age, but the bedding quality is excellent (new & firm mattress) and the suite was very clean / well-maintained. The hotel staff are professional, helpful & friendly. The restaurant and bar are very good, and at first, we thought the prices were expensive; however, after sampling other restaurants in the area, it just turns out that Toronto is expensive city (bear in mind, I am a New Yorker) -- so, the hotel prices were on par with the quality offered. The hot tub and sauna in the workout room with panoramic were very nice. Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Charlotte1512
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel after having read reviews and we were not disappointed. The room was big with a separate living room and very clean indeed. The bathroom was also very big and could be accessed by both bedroom and living room, so ideal if you are three people sharing the room. The only thing I would say is that the bathroom could do with a little spruce up as some of the tiles were cracked and just looked a little "tired", but it was spotlessly cleaned every single day. All the staff that we came into contact with were really helpful and friendly. The location is perfect and within walking distance of theatres and The Blue Jays (Baseball). There are plenty of bars and restaurants on the doorstep, and you can park, at a charge, under the hotel - we found it to be one of the cheapest options as we could come and go as we liked as it was a daily charge. We would definitely stay here again and again - very good indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Our favourite Hotel in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Wi-FiNomads
Reviews.Content: The hotel was as reliably perfect for us as always when we stayed there last weekend. We had come to Toronto to spend some time with our two boys who live there, and the large suite was ideal for visiting with them and their companions. We have been staying exclusively at the Cambridge Suites when in Toronto for over 15 years now. The comfortable, ample rooms, the consistently-excellent service and good humour from all staff, the convenient parking and access to the amenities of downtown Toronto, the great food in the Portico and complimentary breakfast, the quiet - all this in one package makes Cambridge Suites unique. We love the Hotel. We will always stay there when we visit Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience, location was perfect, rooms really big and fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: Stefano011
Reviews.Content: Spent a week there and had a great experience, location was perfect, rooms really big and fantastic service. Personell went above their tasks by anticipating my needs more than once e.g., I ran the 10k race on the 1st of May and the concierge offered information and help withtout me asking for any. They found me safety pins for the race on the spot and offered me a free breakfast for the race....I found the attention to detials and the care they took really fantastic. Hotel is super central and the rooms are huge with all sort of amenities that make the stay so confortable.

Reviews.Title: “Gluten Free”
Reviews.Author: shonamStAndrews
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in the Cambridge Suites, Toronoto. The staff were very friendly and the rooms were spatious, clean and comfortable. It is very well situated for eaating out and shopping. I am coeliac so finding restuarants that are safe to eat in when you travel can be quite difficult, especially on the first night when you are exhausted from an early start and a full day of travelling. It turns out the the assistant manager of this hotel is also coeliac, and so the waiting and kitchen staff are all clued up on what is safe to eat and what is not. The food was really delicious and for the first time ever I stayed in a hotel without accidently being served a dish with gluten in it.

Reviews.Title: “Girls Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Linda0520
Reviews.Content: Very clean rooms, wonderful bedding, very quite (slept great very night!). Staff was always accomodating. Great bargain in the heart of the city. Looking forward to staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, value and location.”
Reviews.Author: TestieTourist
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights at this hotel for a family wedding. The staff, to begin with, was great. Check-in and -out easy, parking right on the premises (and, for Toronto, at about $20.00 per night with in and out, a great bargain). Suites were spacious, comfortable and QUIET. Location was perfect. Could walk to Roger's Centre, art gallery and the theatre district. Couldn't ask for better. In all we'll be back

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: AW-Canada
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have been taking long weekends in Toronto for over 10 years now. I would say we have probably stayed at the Cambridge Suites over 17 times. We have tried other hotels BUT ALWAYS come back to the Cambridge as it cannot be beat. Each and every time the staff goes out of their way to make us feel welcome. I have never had to wait longer then 30 seconds to speak to anyone at the front desk. In person or by phone. The location is great as it is connected to the PATH network and if you like shopping at the Eatons Centre you do not even have to go outside to get there and back. All the rooms are huge and every one offers a separate Living Room with TV and mini bar, fridge and MW. You can watch TV while your spouse sleeps in, in the separate bedroom (that has a second TV). Full sofa, chair, etc, many even have a Dining Room area with a table! Parking is extra but is always available, indoors and very secure and easily accessible direct from inside the hotel. The hotel is kept very clean and neat. There are always fresh apples in the lobby and on the floor with the Exercise Room. I just hope that this review does not lead to the hotel selling out during our next visit to Toronto as my partner basically says now that he does not want to stay anywhere else. This is my first review, so I probably left out some things seasoned writers put. But I just felt that as I have used tripadvisor so many times to find out what hotels are like in other cities, it was about time I let people know about our great find in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Delightfully Memorable”
Reviews.Author: ShellyNoelly
Reviews.Content: Some friends and I had a weekend trip to Toronto for a few nights on the town for a birthday celebration. I'll admit that this hotel was not my first choice as it is a bit pricey but I can see why. The hotel was easy to find as it is centrally located, and parking was readily accessible. The hotel lobby is beautifully decorated equip with concierge, a comfortable seating area, cold refreshments and complementary apples. The Check-in process was very professional yet personal we were assisted by Theresa who went above and beyond(i'll explain how in a bit). Our room was a one bedroom suite with a Queen size bed and kitchenette. The furniture was up to date and appealing, the use of space could be better but it was comfortable and the French doors definitely add to the decor.Their housekeeping is impeccable as the suite was very clean and fresh, also their houseman are very prompt with requests. In the evening we were assisted by Lynne who I must say dealt with my friends very eloquently despite their slight inebriation. She was courteous and helpful with helping us find places to eat at 3am, and we appreciated it. What made this stay so memorable was the Front Desk noting the issues that we had expressed in passing with a cake shop that that we ordered from( we didn't get our cake). Upon returning to our suite some desserts were brought to our suite which was simply delightful! I would strongly recommend this hotel for anyone who appreciates quality and attention to detail. My only suggestions would be to add a full length mirror, or simply more mirrors in general to the suites and to allot more space for entry to the parking garage it was really quite a tight fit. Thank you again to all the hotel staff who worked together to make our stay delightfully memorable , you are a four diamond hotel servicing five diamond standards.

Reviews.Title: “confortable, excellent food, too expensive, hidden fees everywhere”
Reviews.Author: isalarouche
Reviews.Content: First and foremost, sorry for my english, I am french speaking, hope you will understand everything. I am a physician and I was in Toronto for business. I go there 10 times a year if not more and usually I stay closer to the airport or at the Hilton. This time I chose the cambridge because of the rating in tripadvisor.com. I do travel a lot, so I do know what to expect from a good-medium and bad hotel or a restaurant. Before my arrival, I did ask a box of chocolate chip cookies and a some orange pekoe tea in my room (if possible) with an extra warm blanket (if possible). I was also happily surprised that there was a price-fixed menu (three-course) at 59$ that you had to pre-paid at time of reservation (that what I thought!).... As I always eat in my room at supper time, I did buy it plus the price of my room. SO : 205$ per night plus taxes for my room PLUS 59$ per night plus taxes for my meals (just supper without beverage, without mini-bar or extra of course) = $894.96 CAD When I arrived in Toronto on April 28th 2011 at night, the service was fantastic, everybody was nice, the front manager was very helpful. The only thing, but it is also my fault, is that I did ask if there was a hotel parking (because I saw that there was a public one quite expensive for 19$ just beside the hotel) and she said, "of course, just turn on the right, I will give you this little card, I will take your licence plate and as long as you stay with us, your are fine to stay there." So I thought it was free!!! I would NEVER park my vehicule there for 20$ a day (there was one half price 1 minute away) or at least, she should have mentionned it or there should be a discount. There is no point to take the licence plate and all that for nothing. I could have take the ticket for the exact same price. So I felt a bit frustrated there. Then, my room... so beautiful, small but very cozy. My tea was there, with milk in the fridge. The cookies was part of the usual room package but anyway, it was good cookies! I loved the hair and skin products! I did appreciate that the internet was free of charge... thank you!!!! That is very nice, something that we do appreciated. Anyway, I did spend the money in candy in the mini-bar (but I'll talk about that in 1 minute). And the extra-blanket was ON the bed! : ) The second day, The cleaning lady even left the drawer open to show me that there was ANOTHER BIG FLUFFY BLANKET available if I wanted one! And I slept very good, thank you Want to talk now about the food, this is, by far with the confortable bed and pillow that I wanted to bring back home, what I liked the most. Don't want to say that I fell head over heel for everything but almost.... and I did eat out a lot once and I am from Montreal (restaurants capital of the world). The Salmon was WOW, the steak was good, the risotto was good BUT the CHOCOLATE POT DU CREME -in fact, to let you know it is "pot DE creme au chocolat" - (it is like a chocolate pudding but 1 million times better) OH my GOD, I ate that on my last night, I was sorry it was because I would have ordered that over and over and over again, even at 9$... The second thing that frustrated me is that when I checked in I asked the front manager if I could eat my pre-paid menu in my room instead of in the dining room even if there was the regular charge of room service, she said, I think that i would be ok, but let me check with the restaurant and I will call could in a minute or 2. She did, there was no prob. So I ordered the salmon, etc. They came in and I had the surprise to sign a bill of 93$!!! What the hell.... I just added a diet coke to the order, so the server said, "well if you already paid, it is probably an error, just sign it and you would be able to verify it at the end...." BUT NO COPY FOR ME!!!!!!!! AND I WAS VERY MAD by the fact that there is an addition of 20% of gratuity on my bill. Which I find a bit over the top. I usually give that anyway, but I hate when it is already on my room service bill (and it is room service, not dining room, I mean, the lady is not serving me for 45 minutes here!!) And there is already a fee for room service and the 20% is calculated AFTER all the addition, so it is a lot of money. Anyway. I found that it is kind of stealing my money and I don't have anything to prove it (the server left with the unique copy -all hotel I've been always gave me a copy in the room). So it as been like that for 3 days, which I've been said the same thing by three different persons : well talk to the manager at the end of your stay to arrange thing out. Sincerely, usually, I am the kind of girl the talk right away up front, but I was too busy (I left at 4 AM and came back exhausted at 7-8PM at night). One last thing that I have to give you credit for : some crazy kids started smoking some ... and it smelled quite strong everywhere (your windows can open, it is a good thing, but some people think that they can smoke and nobody will smell it because of that : WRONG!!) anyway, you did an excellent and fast job, it was late and you knocked on the door and managed the situation very professionally. I thank you for that. Finally, here what I do have to say and the reason why I would probably think twice before going back to your place: My trip was done, I looked at the bill under my door : 1200$ , ouch!!!! with an almost 50$ bill of minibar! (I ate 2 box of cookies, 2 diet coke and 1 bottle of evian, that was it!) and I took my three "59$" meals plus 1 diet coke and 1 glass of milk and 1 extra appetizer at 13$ and the first day I didn't realized that the gratuity was included so I gave her (lucky her) 15$ tip extra on top of what she already have. SO, I went downstairs, pretty shocked. The first thing the front manager told me when I said that I would like to review my bill because it was a bit more elevated than what I expected and that my minibar bill was too high he said: " you had quite a party!" !?!?!?!?! I said excuse me? He said, "well you had that kind of a bill because of the red wine, the scotch, 2 vodkas, ..." then i interrupted him and said that I didn't even drink... this bill was not mine, etc etc, He did not believe me, Then asked me if I had company and maybe he had a drink without me knowing... I was not happy! I was by myself, working hard, and this bill did not belong to me, I wanted to go, and it seemed like he had to have proof and take a blood test for my alcohol level. Anyway, we finally agreed to removed 17$ from the bill because I was tired of this discussion... this make my 3.50$ cookie boxes a bit more expensive! Then came the restaurant to discuss with the same guy....... Already a lost cause, to this day, I still don't know where my additionnal 200$ went, well, not true, I know that I did pay a 20$ each day for the parking (ouch-ouch-ouch = 60$) and that I did pay an additionnal 20% (after all taxes and room services fees included) for gratuities (I think that this is at least 40$ more than what I expected there) So at the end, the hotel expectations was met, that is for sure, but I think that , or I misread small characters or there is hidden fees or you should say to your client, "for a nominal fee, you could use the hotel parking, it is so and so per day. Also, I do think that, and this is my traveler experience talking, that your gratuities % are elevated for room service (specifically because your price are high, it is a tough bill). But maybe it is hotel independant, I don't know, but the food is fantastic. For the minibar bill, I am sorry, but the front manager that early morning was rude. I was there to do the correction of the family physician exam for all the Canada for the College of Family Physician for all the weekend, I was exhausted, I was not there to party. For this guy to tell me " you had quite a party" and " maybe it is your company who had a couple of drinks" was not something to say. I don"t know where the alcohol went, I don"t drink, but I had to pay partially for it and I am mad.... please review that in the future so that it does not repeat again, thank you. SO AT THE END, WHY I DO NOT RECOMMEND IT : THERE IS OTHER HOTEL AS CONFORTABLE LESS EXPENSIVE.... nothing out of the extraordinary that worth 1200$ for 3 days!!!

Reviews.Title: “Convinient, Friendly, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: fishr
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed from April 28-May 1. We were in Toronto helping our son pack up at the end of the university year before he came home for the summer. When I made the reservation the agent gave me the pay-up-front-non-refundable rate without requiring any payment up front. I told her our son would be staying in our room on the second and third nights and she didn't charge us the extra-person fee. The room was a Cityscape Suite which included breakfast. The room had a seperate bedroom (king bed) and a living room with a hide-a-bed. The room was equipped with a fridge, microwave and Keurig coffe maker (which unfortunately didn't work). The room was clean and spacious. Breakfast was served in the hotel's restaurant and included hot and cold cereal, scrambled eggs, yogurt, fruit salad, breads, coffee, tea and juices. Very nice. Parking is conviniently located in an underground garage under the hotel and was reasonably priced by downtown Toronto standards. The Queen subway station is a very short walk away. The staff were very pleasant and helpfull. All in all it was a very pleasant stay and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I have ever stayed at.”
Reviews.Author: skytre
Reviews.Content: We could not find anything to criticize about this hotel. It is centrally located close to all of the major attractions in downtonw Toronto. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The rooms are large, well equipped and quiet. We would actually plan future trips around this hotel, mainly due to its proximity to the downtown attractions, the price and the friendly staff. The top floor hot-tub and sauna has an amazing city view!

Reviews.Title: “nice rooms and fantastic service!”
Reviews.Author: monty031
Reviews.Content: my husband and I spent a weekend in Toronto and this hotel was perfect for us. The location was great, the rooms clean and the staff very friendly. I would certainly reccomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, great food and a great nights sleep”
Reviews.Author: Heather3333
Reviews.Content: My last stay at your hotel was fabulous as usual. I even had a chance to use the workout room a few times on this visit and enjoyed your great meals in the restaurant (shrimp/scallop risotto and fruit water is my favourite). All the staff is friendly and helpful and the beds are so comfortable. I hope to be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: kateandtokyo
Reviews.Content: stayed for 3 nights, really helpful staff prior to stay as emailed to ask for a late check out which was no problem. Friendly on arrival and quick check in. room a fab size with lareg double bed, seperate closet, dressing and washing area and seperate bath/shower and loo. Great toilettries by pharmacopia, plenty of towels and extra bedding, great living area and very well stocked and priced mini bar. Bed vert comfy and rooms quite and good temperature. Good gym on top floor for quick workout. Nice buffet breakfast - cereals, fruits, pastries, hot oatmeal, scrambled eggs, toast, waffles and bagels. Didnt eat here for dinner. Water, apples and newspapers in lobby daily, great location for Longe St shops and st Lawrence market, harbour and cn tower all within walking distance. would certainly recommend for great value and lots of great space to live.

Reviews.Title: “Tremendous Value”
Reviews.Author: KJA10
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable hotel. Fabulous value. Would recommend the advanced booking with the suite and continental breakfast. I don't think you can find a better deal in Toronto. Although they say continental, it seemed to be more formal with dinnerware, formal dining tables etc. The staff was very helpful and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “great location - great staff”
Reviews.Author: treg
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in many city hotels around the world and there is nothing we can think of to fault. From beginning to end the staff were professional and helpful especially Jo and Jennifer on the front desk and Michelle the guest relations manager who made our stay extra special. The configuration of the rooms is excellent and they resemble more like apartments than hotel rooms. In the middle of downtown Toronto the location of Cambridge Suites is perfectly placed for touring the city. Whilst we dont often go back to the same place twice without doubt if we return to Toronto there is only one place we could ever consider - and its here !

Reviews.Title: “A little crown jewel in Toronto!”
Reviews.Author: marcopolo230170
Reviews.Content: I have visited many hotels during the last 10 years, and I could say that Cambridge Suites Hotel is one of the best value I have stayed in. Perfect location (close to Yonge St. and Dundas Square in Downtown Toronto), magnificent facilities, an attentive service and a more than reasonable price, you will not be disappointed if you choose this little crown jewel in your next visit to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, mediocre restaurant experience”
Reviews.Author: TorontoGradstudent
Reviews.Content: We booked and pre-paid for a king city- scape suite for the Friday over Easter weekend. We live in Oshawa and had tickets to see the Lion King and thought we'd make a night of it. The hotel is centrally located near richmond and younge so if you are a tourist and want to hit many of the attractions, the location was pretty good. The rooms were clean and VERY spacious; would recommend for a girls or guys weekend to make use of the great wetbar and sitting space. Check-in was super fast and easy though if I would complain about anything it was the $22 parking for the day. A little pricey; free parking would be a great perk. Loved the nice lobby with lemon and cucumber water coolers but the elevators were slow, an American we ran into said the same thing. My only major complaint would be about Portico, the restaurant. At the risk of sounding lazy, I don't feel like writing two reviews. Portico is rated in the top ten for restaurants in toronto on this site, something which I can only attribute to travelers and not locals doing most of the reviews. The menu looked good, even if a little spare on appetizing appetizers. We both had tomatoe soup to start, it was okay but for $9 a bowl it should have been great. I had the gnocchi, which was good, and my husband got the seabass, which was rubbery and came with SUPER bland steamed veggies. The portion was paltry, I understand it's a higher end restaurant and the portions are small, but this was much smaller than it should have been, especially considering it was lackluster in flavor. Needless to say, I wish we went to the Keg. It would have been the same price and much tastier. Buyers beware: great hotel, skip the restaurant!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff and spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: jaylaw333
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Cambridge Suites Toronto. The staff was very friendly (especially Mark at the Front Desk). Rooms were nice and spacious and the location was ideal. Good value hotel. Only downside was the parking garage at the hotel, which was going through some construction. That made parking in the garage (taking car in and out) quite a hassle. I would stay here again, however, and would recommend this fine hotel to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Next time we visit Toronto we'll be staying here”
Reviews.Author: farmersb0y
Reviews.Content: Stayed in various hotels in Toronto some big name & some boutique but this is the best when location, quality of room & level of service are considered. We had not considered using the in house restaurant but it was so good we decided to dine here 4 nights during our 8 day stay.

Reviews.Title: “I loved this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: particulartraveler88
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on TripAdvisor recommendations and I'm so glad I did. Everything about this hotel worked for me. The hotel staff was extremely nice and helpful and spent time helping me orient myself in the city, and find and book personal activities that were of interest to me. The room was spacious and spotless and the quietest hotel room I think I've ever had. The bed was very comfortable and I could actually figure out how to use the alarm. Location is nice central downtown. I got a great price via Expedia and I would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “You did it again!”
Reviews.Author: DyanandPaul
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoy our weekends downtown - and Cambridge Suites is where we stay. This time we went for our anniversary, we were made to feel at home from the minute we got there till the minute we left. It's the attention to detail that they all show, from saying hello as soon as you walk in, taking my husband express in the elevator to the ice machine and waiting for him to bring him back, to sending a hand written note to say "Happy Anniversary". Never a detail missed. Thanks once again Kimberly, you helped make our weekend memorable. Dyan

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: lowfatmomma
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed at the Cambridge Suites. I will never stay anywhere else when I visit Toronto. After booking I contacted Mr. Ostrem the manager and advised him of the importance of this trip and asked for his help in procuring a well located room. My SIL, BIL and I were staying for 3 nights with me to attend a special graduation. Upon arrival we were upgraded to a room to die for!!! What a generous surprise, as well as other special treats. Good quality toiletries, breathtaking views, spa tubs, steam room, we felt like royalty. This hotel was within walking distance to the TIFF Lightbox Theatre, Royal York (where our Porter shuttle dropped us), Steam Whistle Brewery, Kensington Market, China Town, many restaurants,1 block from the Hudson Bay department store, we actually never took the subway once although the stop was very close. All the staff were so kind, including the in house Portico restaurant. Our trip was AMAZING and our hotel stay was the "Icing on the Cake". Cannot say enough.

Reviews.Title: “Bigger room = better stay”
