Reviews.Author: marilynseattle
Reviews.Content: I love the suite configuration in this hotel. Because there is a separate bedroom, dressing room, bathroom and "living" room, it seems more like home, less like those little boxy hotel rooms. Ask for a corner room - lots of light, and in the room I was in, the desk was positioned right near the window so when I was working, I could look out onto the streets of Toronto instead of looking at a wall. Great location, the staff is universally friendly and helpful. I travel a lot so have seen a lot of "luxurious" hotels. This one's not luxurious - but as a woman travelling alone, I want a hotel that's more like home.

Reviews.Title: “I would have given this hotel 5 stars if.........”
Reviews.Author: sandytoez
Reviews.Content: .....we had received the room we booked. Over a month passed since I booked a King Suite and paid in full at time of booking on line only to arrive and be given a suite with two double beds. This was a little disappointing. We were given a free continental breakfast to make up for it but it still took the shine off "date night". I did not argue, question , or debate our "reservation" with the nice young man at the front desk but even as we tried to rationalize the cause of this, we could not think of a reason for not being given the room we booked and paid for in advance. Still the hotel has nice qualities. Friendly front desk staff, clean rooms however there was an unpleasant odour in our room and we wished we could have opened a window. The beds were comfy with nice clean crisp fresh sheets. The TV's are nice. The breakfast was tasty with good coffee. Great location close to Massey Hall. Would we stay again? Can't say right now. Lots of choices in downtown Toronto and since Cambridge Suites Hotel did not honour our reservation I will research other spots for the next time we visit the city.

Reviews.Title: “What a pleasure... highly recommend!!”
Reviews.Author: sarahandkyle
Reviews.Content: We went to this hotel for the Stevie Nicks & Rod Stewart concert on April 2, 2011. What a great location!! Moments from Yonge St. and a hop, skip, and a jump from the Air Canada Centre. I liked that the hotel was slightly hidden, but not really. Excellent parking for a downtown hotel. Much better than Montreal parking!! I think this may be the first time I have stayed at a hotel that looked exactly like the photos I have seen online!! Amazing! We stayed in a plush king sized room. It was clean, spacious room, big table with chairs, 2 LG flat screen TV's, nice couch and arm chair, large bathroom, wonderful & comfy bed. I cannot say enough about this place.. we didn't get to fully experience the amenities since we were only there for a short while, but we did use the room service and the meal was lovely. I recommend skipping out on paying for the brunch in the restaurant downstairs and going out to eat instead, though, because it was only mediocre. I think that is the only thing that I could say bad about the hotel. The price was right, great location, friendly staff. I highly recommend this hotel for a stay downtown Toronto!!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with our stay!”
Reviews.Author: mhillshoxie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a 3 night spring break trip with our 11 year old daughter. The location is great - just around the block from the subway and the Eaton Center and lots of restaurants around. The room was very clean and the hotel was a great value! We live in Michigan, but hope to be back to explore more of Toronto and will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Cambridge Suites is Sweet!”
Reviews.Author: dl_harrison
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at the Cambridge Suites once again recently and had a lovely experience. I have stayed often for both business & pleasure and will continue to stay there. Additionally, I often block rooms for coworkers. At Cambridge Suites, nothing gets missed. Every last detail is looked after. The service is exceptional; food is fantastic and the suites are lovely. The Team at Cambridge Suites is professional, friendly and always a joy to work with. Thanks for always taking care of things!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Joyceb12
Reviews.Content: At a reception hosted by Cambridge Suites for members of the International Association of Administrative Professionals, Toronto Chapter, we were impressed with the excellent service and attention to detail that was provided. The food, the music - there were two very talented and gorgeous harpists - and the hospitable staff made for an enjoyable evening. Cambridge Suite is indeed a hidden gem! They will go that extra mile to make your occasion a memorable experience. Conveniently located in the heart of downtown Toronto and easily accessible by subway, the Cambridge Suites would be an ideal venue for speaking engagements. The meeting rooms are adequately sized, and furnished with the necessary audio/visual requirements. Tim Ostrem, thanks for helping resolve our IT problem with the powerpoint presentation - you made our day!

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable 5-Star Service”
Reviews.Author: kfricker
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of attending an informational seminar hosted by the IAAP (International Association of Administrative Professionals) at the Cambridge Suites Hotel located in downtown Toronto, Ontario. The venue was the ideal location for guests that came from near and far and offered the perfect sized meeting space to accommodate our group of 45+ participants in comfort and in style. The audio/visual and set up of our room was perfectly suited for our presenters with such a professional and cozy atmosphere where we could accommodate a large group and still have an intimate connection with the speaker. Throughout the course of this evening my colleagues and I were fortunate enough to be able to tour the incredibly lovely and spacious suites that the hotel had to offer. We were able to enjoy a very sumptuous variety of hâ€™orderves, specialty deli & cheese selections and fantastic desserts! We dined on a very sophisticated presentation of appetite fulfilling dishes that always tempted us to go back for more. All the while, we were treated to the spectacular talents of the entertainers presented to us that evening. Who knew Harpists could be the new â€œsophisticated and hot thingâ€�? Firstly, I discovered that this hotel is an ideal place to extend modern and stylish accommodations, spectacular cuisine and a variety of meeting space to our colleagues and business partners. But, foremost, I have finally encountered what I have heard of but never experienced until now â€œImpeccable 5-Star Serviceâ€�. Every single member of the staff were engaged and sincerely interested in doing everything in their power to make our experience at the hotel the best it could be and they exceeded our expectations! I highly recommend this venue for both traveling professionals and local meeting planners to accommodate their groups.

Reviews.Title: “Downtown comfort”
Reviews.Author: bosniaMoncton
Reviews.Content: The hotel is excellent value for both tourists and business travellers.The suites are large and convenient.The location is amazing.Service is outstanding.I had a reservation problem which was solved expertly and swiftly by Sanrra Kim.

Reviews.Title: “This will be our go to place for Toronto now”
Reviews.Author: QuilleysKid
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference while several other large events were also happening. Despite the hotel being full we never felt rushed. Check in was at 4 as obviously room change over was difficult but very friendly staff offered to hold our luggage and give us a call when our room was ready. Room was nice - cityscape room and the extras were as advertised. Internet was a little slow at times but expected due to heavy traffic. Had dinner at Porticos both nights and was well worth it. Wait staff/bartender was excellent and would like to give a big shout out to Elaine ( hope this is right) one of the friendliest and most professional staff I have ever met. We are very grateful for the strawberries that appeared later the evening and can give unconditional recommendations for the desserts. Had a great time listening to the impromptu concert that happened in the lounge as we settled for the evening before supper and Junos. Only slight things kept this from having the effortless feel of a five star - no creamers etc found for coffee in the fridge for the AM eyeopener and failure to replenish the coffee the next morning. Both dealt with efficiently by staff but would have been nice to have them just happen. Breakfast continental was nice but two of the three mornings it was hard to find a clean spot as staff seemed slow to clean up places - maybe a factor that most people weren't paying for breakfast and therefore not tipping? We walked to the Junos at the Air Canada Centre and the PATH made this a warm comfortable walk for the extensive distance ( 25 minutes) - window shopping made the time pass quickly. Eaton's Centre a block a way, easily accessed by the PATH also or a block on street level. Checkout easy and allowed us the courtesy of a slight extended stay as we were taking an early evening Porter flight. Kiosk in lobby that allows check in to numerous airlines much nicer that the single airline kiosk I have encountered elsewhere. As I stated had a great time and would go back. Had an accompanying spouse and the extra space afforded by the suite was great for loitering over a book or coffee while he waited breaks from the conference if he didn't go off visiting sites.

Reviews.Title: “Why stay Anywhere else ?”
Reviews.Author: Haroula
Reviews.Content: Don't bother staying anywhere else. This is our second stay in 6 months and is our new home away from home. The check in is easy. the parking terrific and the restaurant downstairs terrific for dinner. There is a coffee shop on the corner that serves a great all day breakfast and that is where you should go. I honestly have nothing constructive to suggest to the management because the staff is very well trained and pleasant. The night we checked in though we were a bit amused by the young man checking us in. We have put you This time he said, in our Deluxe special suite. It was the Same one we were in before and exactly the same as every other suite in the hotel except for the few expensive ones. . ..As I said we were somewhat amused. We were listening to the staff deal with other guest queries and were so happy to see the polite way everyone was handled. Good for the management in finding/training this group of young people.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel based on location and things to do nearby - not conducive to have more than 3 in a room”
Reviews.Author: Jackie289
Reviews.Content: Thought the hotel was great , clean easy access to restaurants and all points of interest downtown. Not a great room size for more than 3 in your party

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but the best? I don't think so.”
Reviews.Author: thefoureyedpanda
Reviews.Content: Decent suite hotel. Reasonable breakfast buffet. Spacious rooms even if a bit dark. Shower water pressure could be better. Mattress could be better. Small but decent gym. Overall pleasant staff. I couldn't find a safety box. If it is just business and you are there just to sleep it is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Best place in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: jgill7
Reviews.Content: Can't say anything that hasn't already been said. Stayed in Toronto many times and this is by far the best hotel we have stayed in. Better than the Royal York, Sheraton, etc.... Great staff, rooms, gym access, location, and breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: newsygal
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in a number of hotels but this ranked right at the top. Excellent service, clean rooms, perfect location, the price was comparable to other chain hotels and it featured excellent fitness centre complete with a hot tub overlooking Toronto. The staff catered to our every need. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great, clean, modern, spacious rooms!!”
Reviews.Author: djkim123
Reviews.Content: From the point of check in to check out, Cambridge Suites Hotel was great!! Check in was quick and easy, room was clean, spacious, well laid out, did i mention very spacious. The bedding was nice and new. The in-room dining staff was very pleasant. It was a great stay and I'd stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “What every hotel should be!”
Reviews.Author: WayneN067
Reviews.Content: The reception staff were very cheerful, polite and helpful. They had noted that we were on our honeymoon, and warmly congratulated us, and advised that they had upgraded our room. The new room wasnt too different from what we booked (which was a King Bed Suite - with separate bedroom and living areas), but the upgrade was just a little bit bigger, and little better finshed off she said. In doing so, they made us feel like they cared, and wanted to do something something small to make our stay just a little more special. They also gave us complimentary breakfast vouchers for each day, which was not included in the room rate that we selected. When we got to the room they had placed chocolates, and bottle of champagne to greet us. The chocolates appeared on our bedisde table each day while we were there. The room was absolutely great, and in my opinion was what very hotel room should be. A good sized bedroom, with a king bed and city views, joined to the nicely sized, clean and modern bathroom, via a large carpeted powder room with full length mirror, closet, safe and ironing board and iron. The seperate living area was a good size, with dining table and lounge, fridge, microwave, sink, cutlery and crockery. Virtually a small apartment. We could easily and comfortably live there for some time. The living area also had large windows with a nice downtown view. A guest laundry was located at the basement level, with two washing machines ($1 to wash) and two dryers ($2 to dry). The bar and restaurant was well priced, the food was good and the saff were very cheerful and friendly. The hotel is also joined to Toronto's PATH system of underground walkways, with two entrances, so that you can leave hotel to go peruse the city and never have to go outside in the weather! We rate this hotel very highly, and will now use it as the benchmark for any other hotels we stay at. We liked it so much that we are joinging their membership program :) Wayne and Jen Neilson

Reviews.Title: “Good .”
Reviews.Author: Stevekoroll
Reviews.Content: Great location ! Nice rooms .great bar ... Would definately stay there again...

Reviews.Title: “A great stay !!!”
Reviews.Author: cubcruiser
Reviews.Content: I wanted to stay here as many here had good comments and we were celebrating my wife's 60th.birthday. It started with a great smile from the hostess at the front desk. The staff on our stay were the best, always there to answer a question on directions or to advise as to what was worth seeing in attractions.Jennifer(concierge) went the extra step to send a complimentary bottle of sparkling wine up to our room on my wife's birthday. That was an unexpected nice touch that we will not soon forget. We had dinner at Portico. The menu was small but believe me when I tell you that this restaurant is quality plus. I had the coconut cream chicken soup which was to die for. My wife had the baby green salad which was good also. I had the Angus steak and my wife had the bass and both melted in our mouths. Both had perfectly cooked vegies and potatoes as well.The hostess Cheryl was very pleasant and knew when to attend us. This was from start to finish a great meal from a place you wouldn't normally think of having dinner in Toronto. We had a king suite #1603 and had nothing but good things to say. It was clean,quiet and had a corner view which was an extra bonus. Having the extra living room area was nice to have with the couch and chair. We went out to visit the St Lawrence Market and on a winter day we used the underground PATH which came in handy. All said this hotel/restaurant and the staff exceeded our expectations. Thanks to all of you for making our weekend very memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: racheypie
Reviews.Content: Such a great stay. Very accomodating staff. I was able to check in early with no problems, the room was clean and spacious, the elevators were fast, and the location's just great. We also made good use out of the business centre, which had complementary computers with Internet available so that we could plan our days. Did not enjoy the hotel's restaurant, though. Overall, I was very impressed and would love to stay at this hotel again. I completely recommend Cambridge Suites to any traveler.

Reviews.Title: “I couldn't believe it's this good for this price!”
Reviews.Author: tak3
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in early Feb when Toronto had a really cold spell. Upon arrival from the airport, we were immediately warmly welcomed by the front desk staff. Throughout our stay, every front desk person, and we couldn't keep track of how many, were equally professional, provided service with a smile. Even the breakfast room waitress was very pleasant, and she was completely surprised when I gave her a tip. In Miami and New York, I was challenged by the taxi drivers for not giving a big enough tip! Housekeeping supervisor was very visible, as were her staff. They were frendly and provided service with no hesitation. Without a doubt, this has to come from the top. I congratulate the general manager in achieving this level of service. As mentioned before, there are four elevators and they are always very available. I did not recall having to wait for one.... it's always there waiitng for me. One thing I've noticed... all the other guests in the elevator, or lobby, seem to be friendly and in a good mood. Does this reflect that they were all having a good time? From previous posts, not all rooms have equal configuration or furniture. For example, my room has a long rectangular bathroom, consists of double sinks, then a toilet flanked by bathtub on one side, and on the other side a shower large enough for two. My room did not have a dining table. Instead, it had a desk large enough to allow two people working, as there are two chairs across from each other. The two 42" LG TV's , sofa, microwave, small fridge, bar sink are all pretty uniform. Besides service, room size, location has to be the third strong point of Cambridge suites. The PATH underground walkway actually has an exit to Cambridge suites. Mind you, it's not connected to the hotel. The entrance the underground walkway is right across the hotel, perhaps 30 ft? Even in minus 15 celsius temperature, one can easily utilize this underrbround system withpout having to carry heavy overcoat, if the destination is within this region. I attended a hockey game this way. Once again, tripadvisor has helped me in choosing wisely!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but noisy”
Reviews.Author: kahemafi
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on tripadvisor.com, I quickly booked a suite at the Cambridge Suites Hotel. Our family was looking for a weekend getaway to do some shopping and visit the AGO and CN tower. Our first night was wonderful - clean rooms, plenty of space and nice atmosphere. As a family of 4, we like to have a bit of room to roam. The second night was disappointing. A party in the room next door got underway around 8pm and went on all night long. My husband and I are not ones to complain and we thought that perhaps it would die down, but it didn't. My children couldn't get to sleep and the shouting and yelling coming from the next room was aggressive and there was a lot of obscene language (not stuff I care for my kids to overhear...). Yes, we should have complained. It reached a point where I actually feared confrontation and reluctantly decided to ride it out. I also fully expected hotel staff to discover and deal with the party which was obviously well out of control. I didn't sleep, but thankfully the rest of my family managed to nod off after awhile. We left a message with the manager and my husband followed-up with an email. We received an extensive apology and our assurance that this was an isolated and uncommon occurrence. Indeed, we should have called the front desk during the night we didn't have the presence of mind - I was trying desperately to avoid having my children witness a confrontation. We are satisfied with the apology and we would return to the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay..will return.”
Reviews.Author: CathP027
Reviews.Content: Perfect location! So close to the Eaton Shopping Centre, theatre, restaurants and subway. We had a delux room which included contenental breakfast. Room was very clean and nice linens. Great to have the extra space with separate small bedroom, dressing area and living room with small wetbar area with small fridge, microwave and coffee maker (ours was the tasimo type but I believe that varies from room to room). Definetly woud return. Fabulous front desk service, all very pleasent and accomodating - best we have encountered (and we travel alot). Breakfast would normally cost around $13.50 it was OK would like gone elsewhere if it had not been included in the room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Large suite, but needs some paint”
Reviews.Author: BusTraveler0213
Reviews.Content: Quite a good location, close to Eaton Centre and practically next to Queen subway station. My room was a corner suite facing Richmond and Victoria so there was some traffic noise at night (more early in the morning). Bedrooom was a nice size, with plenty of room for a reading chair and big screen tv. Suite also had a good seating area with table for working, separate from sleeping area which is a plus. The suite I stayed seems renovated with new wallpaper and new tvs, but there were brown spots on the ceiling for some reason. There was some lipstick on one of the hand towels so I just used the other one. Also, some hairs on the bathroom floor when I first walked in so made me a little bit nervous. But given location, size of suite, price paid, might stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Value and Service”
Reviews.Author: Gibarca
Reviews.Content: This is often where I stay in Toronto for business. The location is very convenient, close to the subway and Eaton Centre, but just enough off Yonge. Breakfast is very good. Rooms are big and great for working, and separating the work space from the living space.

Reviews.Title: “Warm welcome at the Cambridge Suites!”
Reviews.Author: Anika43
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel a couple of years ago (it was good then, although it had a few more amenities) and it still is good today. I travelled with my sister and we stayed for 3 nights in a 1 King & sofabed Cityscape suite (which included breakfast, a room on the higher floors and free wireless internet). - If you arrive by Airport Express, you'll get off at the Sheraton and walk a few blocks to the Cambridge Suites - Front desk personell is very friendly and have you checked-in in no time! - There are 3 or 4 elevators and they're fast, so you never have to wait long. - Our room was on the 18th floor (room 1801), next to the elevators. - Upon entrance, you step into the living area which has a kitchenette, large flatscreen, sofabed and a dinertable with 4 chairs. Everything is decorated in soft earth tones, very classy. - Through the french doors there is a good size bedroom with a comfortable Kingsize bed, another flatscreen and a desk - From the bedroom and the living room you can enter the roomy powderroom, which has a large closet (with free safe) and a sink. Bathrobes are provided (just 1 when we arrived, but they quickly sent up another one at our request but in the end we didn't use them). - From the powderroom you enter the rather small bathroom with toilet and shower. Ample towels, though .. and ' green' soaps, shampoos etc. - The kitchenette has a mini-bar & fridge for your own groceries, a microwave and a Keuring (?) coffeemaker. Coffee is replenished througout the day. - The hotel offers turn-down service (nice!) and leaves bottles of water, some chocolates and a card with the weather forecast. Free newspaper on the desk in front of the lift - Our room had a view down at Richmond Street, not a great sight. - We choose the 1 King/sofabed option because we both like to have our own space. The sofabed is just not that comfortable for an adult and in my opinion only suited for children. It was a pro though that you can get to the bathroom without disturbing the person in the bedroom! - Another pro: the room was very quiet (even with it's location next to the elevator): very little disturbing noise from outside. - Housekeeping deserves praise: they made up the sofabed (although we refolded it every morning) and refreshed the sheets. - Wireless internet is way to slow in my opinion: we couldn't even Skype with it! - Breakfast was great with a very large selection: hot oatmeal + scrambled eggs, 4 kinds of juice, bagels, white and rye bread, waffles, fresh fruits, yoghurts, milk, cereals, pastries and fruit salad. Topped off with good, strong coffee (just the way we like it) it made for a very good start of the day! - Good selection of in room pay-per view movies. - There is a roof-top hottub and sauna, but we didn't visit it. - Check-out was quick and easy and the billing was correct. - BUT MOST OFF ALL it is the location that makes this hotel worth visiting again: right across the street from The Bay & Eaton shopping Mall, close to entertainment (theatre, cinema's) and you can reach all that using the underground PATH system (we preffered walking outside and getting some fresh air, because shops and restaurant tend to be overheated in wintertime). If you can get a good priced off-season deal, I would absolutely recommend this hotel and would gladly stay there again myself.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service and an AWESOME location!!”
Reviews.Author: ILT-11
Reviews.Content: My friend reserved Cambridge Suites for our stay in Toronto and for a hotel I have not heard of before has really given me a "WOW". We got in on a late flight so we were tired, but once we got there the two young gentlemen, Simon and Hoon, gave us really quick and fast service, and one of them even carried our luggage to the elevator for us. That was really nice of him. I would have to say that the rooms are absolutely amazing! There is a VERY cozy warmth feeling to the room, very spacious and clean, nice furnitures, and a mini bar. We also decided to try out the hotel restaurant Portico the next day, and that was a very delicious meal. I was very impressed and we enjoyed it very much. The location is in the heart of toronto and walking distance to the mall and pretty much everywhere we wanted to go. So it is DEFINITELY convenient for anyone who wants to stay in the city. The next time I come to Toronto I would definitely choose Cambridge Suites again!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and Quiet Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: PNGToronto
Reviews.Content: I stayed for three nights during a brutally cold spell in Toronto. Clean, elegant and quiet rooms in close proximity to the Eaton Centre. Small, but beautiful, fitness centre on the top floor with a lovely whirlpool and sauna. Free passes to the Adelaide Club for the serious fitness addict. Treadmills have individualized TVs for those of us who need extra incentive to work out after a long day of business. The mini-kitchenettes are great for warming up food for those days when you just want to crash.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: hanuman61
Reviews.Content: This hotel is truly amongst the top places I have stayed. The rooms are gorgeous, the staff are pleasant, and there is a great restaurant within the hotel. I had never heard of tripadvisor before, but the bartender Elaine gave me a card for it and since I was so impressed with her service, the food, and drinks, I figured why not share this with others! I visit Toronto every few months or atleast once a year, and I'm so glad I stayed at the Cambridge Suites. Everyone made this stay so great.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Di1_m
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Cambridge for my birthday. Check in was quick and easy and the clerk at the front -Andy, was super great. He wished me a happy birthday and surprised me with a delicious birthday dessert. He definitely went above and beyond! Room service was delicious as well! Great stay and Andy made it that much better! Thanks so much for being awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome! Felt very welcomed.”
Reviews.Author: nursecherie
Reviews.Content: Our stay was great from start to finish. The ladies at the front desk were very hospitable and very welcoming and seemed genuinely happy to have us at their hotel. The room was very clean and well organized. Given that it is downtown, the quietness was a definitely a plus. Our dinner at the Portico restaurant was fabulous and the food was top of the line in taste and presentation. They were very accommodating with my specific requests given my likes and dislikes. The waitress "Elaine" was enlightening and had a genuine love of her job and patrons. She greeted every person that entered the restaurant with a smile and a welcoming hello. I would definitely stay here again with no hesitations.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT STAY”
Reviews.Author: ZaynaG
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful little getaway we had. Such friendly and helpful staff. Teresa at the front desk.. so sweet. Wrote another review about the hotel restaurant/bar... bartender Elane was so great. Already have our friends booked with you for their city escape! I told them look out especially for Teresa and Elane! Wish my bed at home could be like the one we slept on.. it was heaven.

Reviews.Title: “I Wanted to Stay A Month!”
Reviews.Author: TenDotChick
Reviews.Content: And next time it certainly has to be longer than a 1 night stay. I enjoyed the vibe and tone of Cambridge Suites and felt well taken care of the entire time. You have to stop by the desk and say hello to Amanda if you don't have the good fortune to be checked in by her. The clean rooms are laid out well, and have anything you could possibly need. The beds are fantastic and I had a better night sleep than I have had in 100's of hotel rooms across Canada. There are limited rooms on each floor and it is really quiet. Make sure you stay more than 1 night so you can fully appreciate this hotel. I look forward to the next time and am grateful for the experience I had at the Cambridge Suites Hotel, Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Principal”
Reviews.Author: sharondicesare
Reviews.Content: I felt like I was "living Soho" ... if you haven't stayed at The Cambridge Suites in downtown Toronto lately, check it out! The digs are contemporary, the service is five-star, and the location can't be beat. Thanks to Tim Ostrem and his entire team of service professionals for a fantastic experience ... I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “If you're looking for value for your $$, you've found it!”
Reviews.Author: TeeQKo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Cambridge Suites Hotel mid-December 2010. I was there for one night only, but thought I would nevertheless post a TA review, since I found the hotel on TA. I booked my stay over 22 days in advance for a conference I was attending, and I got a rate of $129 for a king suite, directly through the hotelâ€™s website. This was a pre-purchase, non-refundable rate, and I found it very reasonable at the time of booking, given the hotelâ€™s existing reviews and rank on TA. After a very short walk from Central Station to the hotel, I was greeted by a very, very friendly, cheerful and helpful young lady at the front desk (I unfortunately did not get her name), and was turning the key in the door to my room within about 6 to 7 minutes of setting foot in the lobby. The lobby is very inviting, albeit small, and very clean. I had asked at the time of the booking for a quiet room, as Iâ€™m a light sleeper, and they accommodated my request with a room on the 16th floor. I did not hear a peep all night, so the soundproofing is A1. The view was mainly of other office buildings, but that was fine. I had done my research before booking the room, but I was still very surprised by the size and layout of the suite. As indicated by the attached photos, there was a separate bedroom with a king bed, flat screen LCD, and small desk area. This opened to the bathroom via one side, and the living room part of the suite via double doors that can be shut for privacy. The living room area includes a second larger desk. There is another LCD flat screen in the living area, as well as a countertop with a sink and the minibar. Very spacious and incredible value for the money I paid. Also, the room was spotless. A few reviews I had read indicated that the furniture and rooms were in need of upgrading. I suppose I can understand the comment, if someone is used to more upscale and expensive hotels, but the cleanliness, in my opinion, overrides the furniture being a bit dated. And I would not even refer to it as that datedâ€¦certainly the bed is very modern, and the 2 LCDâ€™s in the suite suggest a modern touch. At any rate, the furniture is not worn; I guess that is my point. It is clean, well-appointed, and the suite from top to bottom was very welcoming and inviting. In terms of service, I was only there for a single night, with a very early check-out, but I would definitely say that anyone I dealt with at CSH was extremely helpful, courteous and friendly, either on the phone when booking or during my stay. The check-in, as I mentioned, was very efficient and smooth, and so was the check-out. I would most certainly stay here again, and would not hesitate recommending CSH to anyone I know that needs a place to stay in Toronto (in fact I already have). Great location and a great value!

Reviews.Title: “WoW!! Perfect location, lovely suites, fantastic staff...”
Reviews.Author: mairc
Reviews.Content: Just goes to show that checking with Trip Advisor pays off! This was and is recommended by trip advisor and now by me! Very attentive staff. A few days before we all flew in Ann emailed to make sure that they got everything right for us and it was lickety-split upon check in. Great rooms, friendly staff, and fun bar downstairs. Restaurant was good too. Located right where you want to be in downtown. There's lots happening in Toronto on any given day. We all came in for the Roger Waters "The Wall" (Air Canada Centre) concert and this hotel served very well for the couple of days we were there. First time I stayed here and I\we will definitely be back. You really get soooo much more here for the equivalent price elsewhere and I would say overall you get quite a bit more here. And that means the big name hotels. And I've stayed at most of them. Definitely give this one a try and I suggest you look at their booking homepage first as they had better deals than anybody. By far a better deal. Air Canada's bundling was over $100.00 more to go through them. Cambridge also gave I think $80.00 in restaurant discount coupons. Oh yeah...they were able to pull a limo out of thin air at the last minute and that was no easy feat considering how much was going on in Toronto that night. Very impressed. See 'yall at Cambridge Suites on the next one!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Guest Relations”
Reviews.Author: bear003
Reviews.Content: We have been guests of the Cambridge Suites a number of times in the last few years. We have enjoyed our stays although the hotel is showing some wear in its carpet and furnishings; however, we feel it is imperative that we single out one particular person. Anna, one of the front desk staff, has been outstanding. On a previous stay in July 2010, Anna helped us resolve, to our outmost satisfaction, a situation which arose. Her genuine interest in guest relations brought us back to the hotel in Jan. 2011 for our most recent stay. We arrived very late and the front desk person who checked us in did not inform us of the fact that we were entitled to breakfast. When Anna heard that, she quickly gathered whatever breakfast food she was able to find and delivered it on a tray to our room. In addition to this gesture, she came out from behind the desk every time she saw us to greet us. She extended our checkout time due to our late flight. She checked flight information and even told us she would keep a room dedicated for us if the snow prevented us from leaving. Everything Anna does is above and beyond the normal excellent guest relations required at a hotel. We travel extensively and are well aware of excellent service - Anna provides it to the highest degree!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but pricey”
Reviews.Author: W2traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed there over the New Years holiday with family. Can't beat the location it is right off Yonge street where everything happens.We stayed in the city scape suite with an extra charge which I would probably not stay in again because of the extra charge and no particular special view. The staff was very helpful and friendly, no problems there. Bathroom was a little add as there was no sink in the bathroom. The heating was controllable in the room although it seemed to blow cool at whatever temp it was set at. Overall I would say it was a positive experience but would not pay the higher price to stay again. Very small fitness center. Also though there was free internet in the room but it turned out to be a fee (11.99)

Reviews.Title: “great location $$$ definately not 4 star”
Reviews.Author: andreaobrien
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this suite hotel for a weekend. Wasn't able to enjoy it at all because when I stepped in the room my allergies went crazy. Not sure if this is from the heating system or the all feather pillows and duvets in the room. there were no extra blankets so we froze all weekend and slept in our sweaters. We didn't request any extra blankets because of our already astronomical bill and a clear $25 charge for extra blankets. staff seemed pleasant but overrun at check-in. won't stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for Vacation”
Reviews.Author: nikevr
Reviews.Content: loved loved loved this hotel. I have to say thanks to all the friendly and helpful people who made my stay wonderful. The people at the concierge and front desk were always very helpful and always willing to answer my endless questions and even make reservations for me. All their recommendations for restaurants and places to visit were very helpful. My friend and I stayed in a double queen room with city view. (p.s. view isn't much cuz it faced another skyscraper, but I think that's how all the double queens are). I loved how the room is set up, separate bedrooms from the living room. There's also a little fridge and microwave. It was cozy and clean and the beds are terrific! Location is great, close to everything. We just walked everywhere or took a taxi. The morning breakfast was not bad: waffles, toast, cereal, pastries, scrambled eggs, yogurt, grapefruit juice, orange juice, coffee, teas, etc. good stuff, nothing fancy but enough to get you going in the morning. This place is definitely a business hotel...lots of suits! Gym was kinda small, but serviceable. The view up there is great, especially with the little whirlpool and sauna to relax after a long day. I'm really glad I chose this one! thanks again Cambridge!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: Jojicat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Cambridge Suites for 3 nights in one of the cityscape rooms. The location is excellent as it is really central. We love having a separate bedroom when we stay in hotels as my husband gets up early to do work emails and I can sleep without being disturbed. The bed was really comfortable and we didn't get disturbed by any outside noise. The dressing room was a nice extra and we liked having two wardrobes - one by the front door for coats and boots. Being able to use the communal laundry facilities (as we were flying home from here after 3 weeks in Canada) made life much easier when we got home. Every member of staff we met couldn't have been more friendly and helpful. However, there were some weaknesses in the whole experience. The bathroom looked very dated - it was geared up for disabled access so I am not sure if this is the normal bathroom experience. The bathroom wall was immediately at the end of the (small) bath so this left no room to lie back and relax. Also if you wanted to wash your hair as well you had to get out of the bath and into the separate shower as there was no way of rinsing your hair in the bath - really annoying! The breakfast also left a lot to be desired. The food was not of particularly good quality and choice was limited. We didn't bother to eat there after our first morning even though the room price included breakfast - we preferred to pay extra and go elsewhere. Lastly the wi-fi access was a bit of a pain as between my husband and I we had a number of devices to log in. This involved getting a code for each device and logging each one on separately each time. We've never had this problem anywhere else so ended up using our own dongle to access the internet rather than use the wi-fi facility. All in all the hotel is good value and we would stay there again despite the minor drawbacks. However I wouldn't bother with the Cityscape room as the extras included weren't worth having.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent room layout”
Reviews.Author: DianaBDuBois
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to TO to celebrate my birthday. We were very pleased with the cleanliness of the hotel as well as the size of the suite. Nice that you have a separate bedroom and living room, as he always gets up earlier than I do. Bathroom good sized as well, lots of room to put our things on the vanity. The location is close to shopping and restaurants, and within easy walking distance to subway station and the Convention Center. Parking is a little weird, but once we figured it out, ended up being convenient after all. Staff very accomodating and helpful. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Why Stay Anywhere Else ?”
Reviews.Author: Haroula
Reviews.Content: We arrived late evening and found the location of the parking site a happy surprise. It is immediately in front of the hotel and charges a reasonable $19.98 per week. We needed to do a lot of driving around to visit various elderly relatives so a car made sense. If you are not driving far cab from the airport and cab to wherever you are going if within a 10 mile radius. Parking is not easy in this city. We were happy with the room and the rate that we paid. All was predictable which is exactly what you want from a hotel room. The staff has been well trained and genuinely fun and interested in all the patrons. We watched them interact with other guests and think that this is a well chosen team. ( We own a large business so are especially alert to staff dynamics. This is a wonderful group of people.) So... temp in room can be adjusted to whatever your liking happens to be, it was very quiet and we had great sleeps. We did dine out one evening at Porico downstairs and were delighted with the service and delicious food. I am on a very restricted diet and found wonderful things to choose from. The artic char was delicious as were the roasted vegetables. We had brunch one morning and they made me a great white egg omelette with herbs . It is ideally located to absolutely everything if you need to be downtown. I don't like malls and am of course Very spoiled from living in Vancouver so the eaton centre was not a drawing card. There is an italian restaurant kitty corner to the hotel where we had a disappointing meal and would suggest asking the Cambridge suites for recommendations. We didn't and wish that we had done so. I would definitely go back without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a getaway with friends!”
Reviews.Author: RyanD36
Reviews.Content: Three friends and I stayed here over a weekend of partying. The rate was very reasonable when compared to other hotels in the area of the same quality - the cheapest 4 star I could find. The price on expedia was basically identical to the price on the hotel website so I booked through the hotel website. The room was very big and clean with lots of extras like 2 televisions. The hotel was very quiet as well. Service was great and they found us a room on a high floor like I had requested. The sofa bed was huge and had tons of room for 2 people. Also we had 6-7 people in our room before heading out to the bars, and there were no noise complaints which was good (although we weren't overly loud). The location is really nice, just a few minutes from Yonge and Dundas square. Parking is a bit weird. You can save if you pay for parking directly instead of the hotel but you need to go down at 6AM and 7PM to renew your parking pass, which is fairly inconvenient. However parking through the hotel is reasonable at about 20 bucks a day. You have to pay for wireless which is fairly common in most hotels in TO. We didn't eat at the hotel restaurant or get room service so I cannot comment on the quality of the food. Overall a great hotel to stay at with a reasonable price in a perfect location!

Reviews.Title: “A very comfortable hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: gothicwanderer
Reviews.Content: We will stay at this comfy hotel again. It is close to Massey Hall, shopping and good restaurants. It has a late checkout (1:00 pm). Housekeeping comes twice a day. There are two rooms, with nice furnishings. The king sized bed was a bit hard for my liking, but I am not typical of all sleepers. We also thought that the food in Portico, the restaurant was very tasty. So far it is the nicest hotel that we have found in Toronto, and the price was reasonable (look for special deals on Trip Advisor).

Reviews.Title: “A suberb hotel in every respect”
Reviews.Author: keithfrombucks
Reviews.Content: Our experience at Cambridge Suites Hotel could not have been better. My wife and I stayed for nearly two weeks and from the moment of arrival through to departure it is true to say that we were thoroughly impressed by the excellent standards of service set by the whole team. The location was great for our itenary which revolved around experiencing the delights of TO . The accommodation was clean, spacious and comfortable. We asked for a quiet room and got it, tucked around the corner from the main street. At all times staff were friendly and helpful without being intrusive and a nice touch was an informal early evening drinks reception hosted by the Hotel management. The restaurant offers imaginative and wholesome cuisine and a good wine list. Our son lives in TO so we expect to visit regularly and Cambridge Suites will be our Hotel of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Beverleyp
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Cambridge Suites for 4 nights. The room was clean and had everything we needed. The staff were a pleasure to deal with always polite, efficient and smiling. The breakfast was well organised, unfortunatly we didn't get to try the restaurant for dinner. Would absolutly stay there again if in Toronto

Reviews.Title: “First Class!”
Reviews.Author: LP69
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 days on the second part of our trip to Toronto - with Niagara Falls in between. On the first part of our trip we stayed at a different hotel for proximity to the station, but we decided to walk to the Cambridge Suites to check it out and maybe have a beer!! We walked into the Managers Reception (free snacks and beverages) and were invited to have a drink as we were returning as guests later that week. That really set the tone for our stay. When we returned 3 days later the bar staff remembered us and even that we had been to Niagara for a couple of days. The level of service and interaction with all staff we encountered here was excellent - always a friendly hello, nothing seemed to be a problem for them. The location is excellent - right next to the Bay and Eaton Centre for shoppers, on Yonge Street for plenty of eating options, major sights within walsking distance. Rooms are large with seperate sitting room/kitchenette and well equipped. We also got free wireless internet in our room (Cityview Suite). We didn't eat in the restaurant, but the bar 'snacks' are great - try the Pork Dumplings! Breakfast was buffet style with a good range - but in my opinion was crying out for some Candian bacon as we had in other hotels on our trip (this is my only 'criticism').

Reviews.Title: “Look no further! The best hotel in Toronto!!”
Reviews.Author: M0Bar
Reviews.Content: Visiting Toronto for a wedding, a stay in this hotel was the best option. This hotel is centrally located (in the heart of Downtown Toronto!) and within walking distance of many cultural/tourist sites & shopping areas. The room was indeed a suite: living area (with sofas/tv and workdesk), small kitchenette with minibar, a separate bedroom with large bed, bathroom & toilet, as well as separate dressing room/sink area. The hotel not only offers free WiFi in the reception area (with reception also in bar), but also Ipads for complimentary use by guests (one in each of reception area & bar). The staff is also very friendly and helpful. A special note goes out to the service they delivered when personal items were left in the hotel room. Cambridge Suites went the extra mile by making sure that these items were delivered back in the home country. We will definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KellBo95
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights in Toronto in June. The Cambridge Suites was a great place to stay. The rooms were large and very clean. I loved the extra sitting area, the fridge and the additional TV in the bedroom. Having the large windows all around the room was a big plus. We enjoyed everything about this hotel. The front desk staff was very friendly!! I was also impressed with the other staff at the hotel. I was in the elevator heading down to the lobby when a maintenance worker got on the elevator the floor below me. He smiled and said "Hello" and asked if I was enjoying Toronto. When he got off the elevator he said "have a nice day". Although it was a small gesture, it was very nice. If you like to get around by subway there is also an underground walkway directly from the subway to the hotel. Perfect when the weather is bad. The hotel is only a short walk to Eaton Centre and the main entertainment district. Free Wi-Fi in the rooms would have been nice. We did go down to the business center to use the computers a few times.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Canuckwanderer
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights at Cambridge Suites when in Toronto for business. The registration clerk was pleasant, competent and informative. The suite was large, with a comfortable bed, and good work space. Complimentary breakfast included a variety of cold and hot selections, and was a perfectly fine start to the day. I would have liked more frequent circulation of the coffee refills to the tables, but I may be a caffeine hound. Overall, a very good place to stay in the heart of downtown Toronto, at a reasonable rate, and a welcoming atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “A gr8 hotel with amazing facilities”
Reviews.Author: yashwantdeewan
Reviews.Content: Hi, I stayed in this hotel for almost 21 days during my trip in July 2010. Frankly speaking I was not able to arrange any hotel room for myself in the downtown which were close to my Toronto office at Richmond street. Although these hotels were quite bigger but the room availability was not there at that time. Then I chose to stay in Cambridge Suites Toronto which was just a few minutes away from my office. I was so impressed when I contacted the staff at the reception, staff was very helpful and soft spoken. I was again delighted to see my room, I stayed on the 15th floor of this hotel with a perfect city view. The size of the room was very good and spacious with some other great features. I will give 100% marks to cleanliness. It is wonderful. And you would not believe one of my colleague was from Austalia at the same time and she stayed at the Sheraton Center which was just across the road from my office. She was sharing her experience with me about her room, and when I told her that my room is equipped with two LCDs, one small kitchenette, one mini bar and with one living room. You would not belive that she was ready to leave her room. But unfortunately she didnt do that due to some policies. This hotel also arranges Manager's reception in their restaurant called Portico. It becomes a very happening place in evening specially on wednesday. Hotel is close to all the famous markets like the eaton center, Yonge street. Wonderful lake Ontario is a 10 minutes walk from here. Now again I am coming to Toronto on 15th October and will be staying this hotel again. That's for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, spacious apartment”
Reviews.Author: TorontoDragon
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an apartment here in July and had an amazing stay. Very good price for Toronto and close to everything. Even a Tim Horton's on the corner! Could not fault the rooms and we have a 2 year old and a 6 year old who had more than enough room to play. Will definitely be coming back. Thanks for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully spacious - good downtown location”
Reviews.Author: sarah_2010x
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Toronto in July 2010 for a family wedding. We chose to stay in the city to give ourselves better flexibility for sightseeing etc. We had a beautiful suite comprised of a decent sized living area (with sofas/tv for relaxing, and a large well equipped desk for work), a bedroom with large king size bed and light-blocking curtains, a small bathroom and toilet, and separate dressing room/sink area. The only negative would be the bathroom/toilet - this was quite small and the bath size was not generous. However water pressure was good and we take showers anyway. The sink/dressing room was much more generously sized - plenty of room for two people to get ready. Plus points - the jacuzzi bath on the top floor that no-one else was using when we went. Beautiful views stretching across the north and east of the city. Rather a nice way to enjoy a morning!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely divine in every way”
Reviews.Author: MTHSydney
Reviews.Content: I arrived in Toronto after 24 hours flying from Australia and was absolutely delighted from the time I stepped into reception. I should have known that I was going to be impressed as the email contact I had with the hotel several weeks before arrival was very responsive and informative. Check in was quick, my suite on the19th floor was spacious and well laid out, the dressing room/vanity that joins the bedroom and bathroom is to die for with about 6 feet of bench space, you can even pack your bag on it! Then there is the bed, dreamy is all I can say and I am pretty fussy about this stuff as I am a very light sleeper. This hotel is in a central but quiet location, the service is great in the hotel and the restaurant, and its all reasonably priced if you book ahead. I usually rely on room service when travelling alone but I actually ate 3 of the 4 nights in Porticos restaurant because the food was excellent and the service fantastic. I found the Cambridge suites on tripadvisor but got a better rate by booking direct over the internet. Would absolutely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, modern and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: jcmztravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my parents and sister (a grown up family vacation! lol) on a recent trip to Canada. My mom booked all our trip and thought this would be a little out of the way and a much smaller hotel, I guess it was the 'suites'. But it wasn't, it is a huge 22 story modern hotel in sort of the financial district of Toronto. Our room was great for 4 people, with a separate bedroom and vanity area. We seemed like the only 'family' staying here, at breakfast we saw tons of business men/women. Btw, the breakfast was amazing. Very simple but all very good (and included in the room). This hotel is also within walking distance to the distillery district and st. lawrence market. You could walk down to the water if you wanted but it's a bit further. There are always cabs waiting outside if needed and it's only about a block to the Queen St subway station.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff!”
Reviews.Author: smlevin
Reviews.Content: Didn't know the area before we booked our reservation. Turned out to be a great location! Also, courteous and attentive staff....front desk was extremely helpful, cordial, and friendly. Nice rooms and amenities. We used the available nearby health club (included for free)...fantastic! Definitely worth a return trip!

Reviews.Title: “A perfectly located hotel in donwtown Toronto...Relaxing to stay at!”
Reviews.Author: beanyf
Reviews.Content: This staff and atmosphere at the hotel was very professional. I was there for a conference and I left my luggage at the desk until the end of the conference on check out day. I stayed one night and I will definetly return. The hotel was clean and confortable. The meals were delicious. They had an excellent computer/business center room.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place to stay for the Toronto Film Festival”
Reviews.Author: davidrift
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the hotel for a week while dashing off to venues spread around downtown Toronto to view films. It is centrally located within walking distance to most attractions and near public transportation. Best mode of transport were free bikes available for a 4 hour rental. Suite layout was very good with updated furnishings and a unobtrusive view east.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: HELRAM
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited Toronto to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary. We used the Trip Advisor reviews to choose Cambridge Suites. We announced on arriving that it was our anniversary and the staff offered us complimentary breakfasts for each of the three days we stayed there. The staff throughout was helpful and friendly. The rooms were more than adequate. The avalabilty of a small fridge, a microwave and utensils was great. We visited during the opening weekend of the toronto film festival and the hotel was around the corner from the Elgin Theater which screened some of the gala films. Very convenient. We could walk to the King street theater district, chinatown, the St.. Lawrence Market and Yorkville.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, great rooms”
Reviews.Author: Stephencrowley
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Cambridge suites for 8 nights and I must admit it was one of the nicest hotels ive stayed in. We booked through expedia and got a good price, especially as it was a suite rather than a room, and is rated as the 3rd most popular hotel in toronto. Staff were very friendly and helpful at check in, genuine too, rather than in-your-face overkill friendly! The suite itself was quite spacious, clean and comfortable. The hotel bar is also very comfortable and has a nice quiet atmosphere and very friendly and helpful staff. Attended the managers reception for complimentary drinks and food on Wednesday evening, obviously nothing bad to say about free drink and food! Location was perfect, connected to the PATH system and within walking distance of a lot of sites, such as the eaton centre right across the street, and the CN tower only approx 10-15 minutes away. Anything further can be reached by numerous public transport links near the hotel or from union station, about 5 minutes walk away. Couldn't recommend this hotel enough!

Reviews.Title: “Cambridge Suites are "sweet".”
Reviews.Author: lowfatmomma
Reviews.Content: My GF and I flew Porter, close enough to walk with our bags (on wheels) to and from the hotel. We were in town for a BEP concert and a Legally Blonde., Everything was handy, subway, bus, eateries. Loved we didn't have to buy breakfast, we got a sweet deal since we stayed over 4 nites. Manager appreciation drink and appetizers was very much appreciated as was the free newspaper in our hallway deposited each morning. Loved the room, I slept on pullout couch and my GF had the bed, I was able to access washroom from other door without disturbing her and likewise for her. She normally stays somewhere else when her and her hubby go to T.O. but she is definitely changing that and staying at the Cambridge suites now. We enjoyed a glass of wine up in the rooftop hot tub after a day of shopping, we took advantage of the free shuttle to Vaughn Mills and also Unionville, so we were in need of a hottub chillax!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel in an amazing city”
Reviews.Author: n0rwegianw00d
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Cambridge Suites was the icing on our stay in the fabulous city of Toronto. The place is beautiful and classy. Our suite was VERY nice - we're talking TWO flat screen TVs, beautiful bathroom with a bath tub AND a shower, and a comfortable, enormous bed. The staff was also very friendly and helpful - that was my impression of Canadians in general too! The hotel is a little pricey, but we got a good deal through Expedia. The only small con I can think of: We were charged 8 dollars for breaking the seal on the minibar (we didn't actually take anything out of it). Not a huge deal, but kind of a sour surprise at check-out. So don't break the seal if you're not going to take something!

Reviews.Title: “Used to be great”
Reviews.Author: 1anita
Reviews.Content: We stayed here three years ago and were much more impressed with it then. The complimentary cookies, popcorn and bottled water are no longer offered. The bottled water was prominently displayed with a sign that read "Please enjoy this bottled water. 4.95 will be added to your bill." That little message sort of summed up our stay. We were really annoyed by having to pay for internet in the room. The 'business center' (for free internet) is a tiny closet on the second floor with two computers, rarely unoccupied. If you bring your kids, make sure you request two doubles rather than a king. The fold out couch was in terrible condition and too small for our teenage son. His feet hung off the end. Breakfast needs healthier options. Staff was not very friendly. They never greet you-not in the elevators, not in the hallways, not at the front desk. I used to recommend the Cambridge Suites with great enthusiasm. Now I do so with much less confidence.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but some upgrading is definitely needed”
Reviews.Author: swanster
Reviews.Content: My husband and I along with our teen son stayed at this hotel for 6 nights, our third stay at this hotel.. This visit was the first time we had our son with us and for the first time we requested a room with 2 doubles and due to the medical convention we were left with the choice of the city scape view deluxe suites @ $258/night. There wasn't much to look at even on the 20th floor and we had the corner suite facing the parking garage entrance and it's frankly no bigger than the deluxe suite we stayed in before at under $200/night. I loved this hotel which is the reason why we booked this hotel every time my husband had business in Toronto. The location is great, central and only 1/2 block to The Bay's subway station. I'd always loved the little perks even when we stayed at the "regular" deluxe rooms, such as complimentary bottled water, microwave popcorn and packages of chocolate chip cookies. Imagine my surprise when they were not waiting for us in the room upon check in! I called down to ask about the said complimentary items, I was told that when I'm in the city scape suties, the bottled water is still complimentary and will be available with the turn down service (along with the Lindt milk chocolates) but the popcorn and cookies are now a thing of the past. When I told the front desk that I had my son with me and I was looking forward to the treats for him, they promptly sent them up to the room. However, that was only the one time thing. When it's not broken, why change it? I absolutely loved the Kuerig Kcup coffee maker when we were there in December. Loved it so much that we bought a big one for our household use when we went home. I ran the machine for some hot water when we first checked in and imagine my surprise when the water came out brown! The machine doesn't use filters, it's just a Kcup holder where you fit in the little cup of coffee or tea container for the water to run through. I soaked the Kcup holder in hot water and after awhile, bits and pieces of brown gunk started to flow out. There was a thick layer of brown gunk built up in the bottom of the holder probably from months of use and no one bothered to clean it out. That was gross! When I called down to the desk, it took two tries for them to replace the machine. This is the first hotel I've ever stayed at that uses standard size double beds. They were pretty narrow for 2 people and apparently all the other hotels provide XL double beds (the kind I have at home for the kids' rooms) and the narrow beds are actually "standard". My fault for not asking before booking. The beds are extremely comfortable, bedding luxurious and pillows comfortable. No complaints there except if you try to get on the beds from the foot of the bed instead of the side, the springs make awfully loud noises. Bed springs need replacing perhaps? The bathroom is well set up. I've always loved having the vanity/sink separate from the tub/toilet room so we can all get ready separately. Lots of counter space! I can't say I'm happy about the condition of the bathtub and floor. I'd made a same complaint about the Halifax Cambridge Suites where we stayed a few days earlier and imagine my surprise to find the same condition at the Toronto property. The mildewy grouts and the tap chauking is no longer attached to the tiles/wall. The floor tiles has aged and looked uncleaned. The shower went stone cold for a good minute one morning, so cold that I had to step out of the tub. Not sure what happened but it only happened once during our 6 nights stay. Another nice touch is having 2 bathsheets in this city scape suite but when they're past their prime and no longer fluffy, it's time to retire them. I was quite happy with the smaller bath towels, they're of better and newer quality. The suite door stopped locking for us one morning as I was leaving for breakfast. Imagine my surprise when I double checked the door and it opened. I closed it a few more times and each time the door opened. I called the front desk and a maintanence man was sent up to check the door. I waited for him in the hall and he was surprised when he noticed I opened the door for him without a keycard. He mustered under his breath that may be he needed to change the battery but after a few tries with his master keycard, he was able to lock the door He then proceeded to lecture me on how to close the door and to wait 3 seconds for the door to lock. I wonder if he would give the same lecture to my husband if he was standing there with the same complaint when it was obvious that I was standing outside the closed door for a good 5 minutes waiting for him to show up. I even showed the bar guy in the hall how many times I could open my door without the keycard. By that time I was in no mood to agrue so I just asked him to replace the battery on the door lock. The complimentary breakfast is fairly good. It has fresh fruits, hard boiled eggs, "real" cheddar cheese slices, muffins, bagels, waffles, hot oatmeal, fresh juices and a large selection of good quality teabags. Loved that! We never watched TV in the bedroom until our last night at the hotel and found the remote control not working. I didn't bother to call down to the front desk. It's something that should be checked periodically or daily by housekeeping to save us the trouble of calling for service. There's no charge for Internet connection for city scape view suites but a small charge for deluxe rooms. Are you kidding? I stayed in 9 hotels during the month of August and this is the only hotel that charges for Internet. Providing Internet should be as common as having a phone in the room so they may want to rethink that charge. Parking is $22 a day, plenty of stalls if you go past P1. There are 2 sets of washer/dryer on the P1 hallway on the way to parking. $2 per load. My husband spoke with the management at this property due to my tripadvisor review on the Halifax property. They sent up a bottle of redwine and a $100 giftcard on behalf of the Halifax property which we applied to our account. That was a nice touch and I appreciated the gesture. With the exception of the maintenance man, the staff is helpful and friendly. I've always enjoyed my stay at this hotel but it's begiinning to look it's age and with the cut of perks, it's no longer as appealing to me as before. I give this hotel high rating because it has huge protential and they can certainly make it better if they so desired. The way it is now, it's just one of the downtown hotels.

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable, great service”
Reviews.Author: wanderer2000_10
Reviews.Content: The suite was nicely arranged to handle 3 people. The beds were very comfortable. The service at the front desk was friendly and helpful. When my soon left all his shirts in the room, the staff found them and sent them promptly back to us - which was really wonderful!! Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful accomodations and service,-best anniv. ever!”
Reviews.Author: garyandlinda50207
Reviews.Content: We went for our 30th anniversary, and were delighted w/ both the suite and the personnel. The hotel is right in the heart of the city so everything was w/in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: AF-Yorks
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent two night stay at Cambridge suites. The staff were superb and couldn't do enough for us. The rooms were spacious, clean and well presented with a very comfortable bed. Not much more to say. We had a great time there!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely end to our Niagara Fall trip”
Reviews.Author: HazelEyes67
Reviews.Content: I decided to stay here based on the reviews prior to our stay on July 17th, and I like that the manager is interested in what their guests have to say on Trip Advisor....From the beginning to the check-out, the staff was professional and courteous. I even got a phone call the same night I made the reservations to explain that their computers were down and that I was going to get my confirmation reservation email the next day instead(very impressed) The room I stayed in was large and comfortable.. We stayed on the 16th floor which gave us a nice view of the city..The hotel does not have a pool, but the spa on the top floor overlooking the city made up for it. The hotel is centrally located and walking distant to the subway and trolley....I would definately stay here again...Toronto is a beautiful city that is clean and safe. Also, the people are nice and wIlling to guide you if you get lost....Just open your map and look confused, and someone will approach you without you asking...REALLY!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good, new, reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: Trinman80
Reviews.Content: Downtown Toronto hotels tend to be overpriced for what you get (compared to other major cities), and some of the more famous hotels are usually older, can tend to have cramped rooms or in need of an overhaul. There's nothing extraordinary about the Cambridge Suites, but it performs well in all categories. It's a newer hotel, everything works, very clean, and offers some good deals. Also, the location is quite convenient to the financial district and downtown Toronto tourist hotspots.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Accomodations!”
Reviews.Author: velasupernova
Reviews.Content: Our family was extremely pleased with our stay at Cambridge Suites Hotel. We have NO complaints at all. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Staff even gave us quarters to wash our clothes at the end of our trip. Check-in/Check-out went smoothly. All the rooms were spacious & modern. View was excellent - We had cityscape view on 20th floor. Suite attendants were friendly and professional; our rooms were immaculate every day of our stay. Hotel was quiet. And Cambridges Suites is at an excellent location - 2 minute walk to Dundas Square and close to subway. I will definitely stay again if I return to Toronto and would recommend hotel to all. Thank you Cambridge Suites for the enjoyable stay!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and highly recommended hotel”
Reviews.Author: sevendee7
Reviews.Content: Hotel was convenient to town. Staff extremely friendly and helpful. Room clean and comfortable, room service excellent. Breakfast delightful. We really enjoyed our stay. We would definitely stay again and would recommend the hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “great place, very good value”
Reviews.Author: MariMichelena
Reviews.Content: very clean, modern, kind staff. VERY GOOD restaurant and with the pacage of tickets to the zoo and discount in restaurant, a GREAT deal.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Cambridge Suites Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LoveMKE
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a great location, clean, friendly place to stay in Toronto, look no further than the Cambridge Suites Hotel. Due to the comments posted on tripadvisor, we decided to stay 5 nights and couldn't have been more pleased. We giggled with delight when we saw the room as it is very well decorated and spacious. We were in walking distance to attractions and when we needed to take the train it was so close! The staff was always helpful with great suggestions and went out of their way to help us. There is no doubt in my mind we will stay here again in 2012 when we are back. Thank you Cambridge Suites for helping our anniversary stay memorable.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Choice for Families”
Reviews.Author: TomMQuinn
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife and two young children (both under 2) and thought it was perfect for families. The room (a suite) was large, with plenty of space for us and all our gear. Location - only a few blocks from the Eaton Centre, was ideal. The room service was also pretty good. Breakfast was also included and was good value. The only downsides were a) small bathroom, and b) the internet service was a little slow. I would definitely stay again if travelling with family.

Reviews.Title: “I have absolutely nothing bad to say about Cambridge Suites.”
Reviews.Author: wennj
Reviews.Content: We've stayed numerous times, and have always been pleased with the service, the staff, the rooms, everything. Clean rooms, wifi, Kuerig coffeemakers, adequate cold breakfast buffet, great underground secure parking, great location, etc.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Cambridge Suites!!”
Reviews.Author: OpenSky
Reviews.Content: My husband, two kids and I stayed at the Cambridge Suites Toronto for 4 nights last month. This hotel met all of our needs. We thoroughly enjoyed the 2 room suite, with mini-fridge and microwave, and 2 tvs. The bathoom was very nicely sized. The hotel was quiet and we felt very safe. The parking was convenient and we had in/out priviledges. The location is great and within easy walking distance to Dundas Square, Eaton Centre, City Hall, and many restaurants. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was very clean. We really appreciated the bottled water and chocolates that were left every evening. We also took advantage of the complimentary continental breakfast each morning. We felt very comfortable at this hotel and would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a hotel in downtown Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and great service”
Reviews.Author: PBPhilly
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from a 4 day, 3 night trip to Toronto for a quick vacation. We chose to stay at the Cambridge Suites after doing some research online. Most of the feedback we saw was very favorable and I have to say that mine will be too. First off, the hotel is in the absolute best location imaginable. One block from Jonge Street, the main street downtown. It's within waking distance of many places. As a matter of fact, we drove to the hotel from Philly. Parked in the garage and the next time we got in the car was 4 days later when we were leaving Toronto. The room we had was just the right size, with a living room area, nice size bathroom, fridge and microwave and a very nice bed. The floor and hotel was quiet, even though we were up there during Caribana and there were thousands of young, energetic people in Toronto to enjoy the festivities. The services were just great. There was a small fitness center on the top floor with a very nice whirlpool spa that overlooked downtown Toronto. The staff was right on the money when it came to restaurant suggestions and providing directions around town. The only slightly negative comment I have was when we got off the elevator onto our floor, we smelled a faint odor. At first we thought it was some food that someone had left outside their door, but after smelling it each day, we deducted that we must have been on a smoking floor. However, our room wasn't a smoking room and once we closed the door, we didn't smell the odor. Overall, I would say that it was a great hotel and I would highly recommend it to anyone traveling to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “It was all like they said on their webpages!”
Reviews.Author: K K
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Cambridge Suites during our Toronto week. All reviews that we read before booking, were "suspiciously" good. To our delight, we found out that everything was as they said on the hotelÂ´s own webpages. The 2-room suite was clean and comfortable, room service & cleaning was immaculate, front desk staff was friendly and helpful. Even in the breakfast rush-hour, the staff kept everything well-stocked despite many people filling their plates at the same time. Location is super - just blocks away from shopping & sights. We parked in their garage, which is reasonably priced, compared to parking houses. We are surely coming back !!

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Hotel in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: gina021
Reviews.Content: Super clean, modern, roomy suites. 2 flat screen Tvs in each room, French doors separate the bedroom from living room. Nice exercise facility with large hot tub on top floor overlooking the city. Great location downtown. Definitely recommend this one.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value with a friendly, helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: jphoban64
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Camebrige Suites on July 26-27, 2010. The experience was first rate in all categories. The staff was friendly and helpful, The room was large, very clean, comfortable, and quiet. I made use of the resturant and found the food to be very good. I will absolutely be staying here during future business trips to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Very Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: jimmygene
Reviews.Content: We recently spent four nights at the Cambridge Suites Hotel. We were very pleased with our suite, both is size and furnishings. The two flat screen TV's were a nice touch. We were in Toronto as tourists and the location of the hotel could not have been better.It was very centrally located and was less than a block from the subway station.
