It was also only a short distance to the huge shopping mall, Eaton Centre. The staff at the hotel was friendly and helpful. We were very impressed withl the city of Toronto asnd staying at the Cambridge Suites only made our visit that much more memorable

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Downtown”
Reviews.Author: gardenlover31
Reviews.Content: Recently on our first trip to Toronto we wanted to stay at location that would give us easy acess to many sighseeing locations and not break the bank . We chose the Cambridge Suites in downtown Toronto. Overall aside from a small house keeping problem ( that was promptly fixed) we loved the room and great service. Parking was reasonable for a downtown location , although a valet would of been nice. We would stay there again. Only down side was a slight musty hotel smell. Aside from that were made to feel very welcomed at the Cambridge and Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Good decision to stay here!”
Reviews.Author: fensterbattersea
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel on the basis of the reviews on this web site and were not disapointed. The suite was extremely roomy with two rooms, a king side bed and tv in one and a desk, sitting area with sofa and another tv and a unit including fridge and microwave. It also has a large dressing room. It was more space than we actually really needed but great value for money. Location: Very Safe and good location especially for shopping. We were able to travel on foot to most places and various times of the day. Breakfast: Didn't think much of the buffet pretty standard (and not included in our room rate) so opted for the Big Easy grill on the same road. Would recommend this cafe for excellent value for breakfast and great service. If you fancy a treat on a (sunday only) head for brunch to the distillery area to the Boiler House. Internet: Had free internet in buisness centre and printing facility which we used. Wifi and internet in room was an additional fee. Staff: Helpful

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, clean and spacious room. Good location”
Reviews.Author: Morgante
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a long week-end. It is located in a good spot of the city, the suite are nice with big windows (and nice view). The service is good: in the evening they bring you some chocolate and a bottle of water for free. The front desk is very kind and helped me to organize my trip to Niagara Falls. The restaurant and the bar at the hotel are good as well, but a little bit pricey (Toronto is not cheap regarding restaurants). The hotel has two internet stations where you can use internet for free. Breakfast buffet is ok with a good variety of food. I would recommend the hotel, check the discount if you stay for more nights.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed for one night - could've stayed for a month!”
Reviews.Author: CapitalLady
Reviews.Content: Even though I checked-in super late and was gone first thing in the morning, I felt so at home in this space. The room was so clean and inviting. The bed soft - best sleep on a pillow I've had in ages. Crazy about the vicinity to everything I like to appreciate in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay at the Cambridge Suites Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sfslinky
Reviews.Content: My husband and I really enjoyed our five night stay at the Cambridge Suites. We loved our suite that had a separate bedroom and living room with sliding doors separating both so one of us could sleep peacefully when the other was awake. We didn't have glass doors so one of us was always able to sleep peacefully in the bedroom. We also liked that you could access the bathroom through the bedroom or living room (two separate doors). We loved the green pharmacopia bathroom products that were replenished daily. Our rate included continental breakfast which we were happy with. There were also free newspapers available on our floor as well as the floor that had the breakfast room and business center. The free business center has two computers and a printer so you can print out boarding passes. There is also a small fitness center upstairs that has a few treadmills, weights, sauna and whirlpool. We found the hotel to be small and extremely personal. Checking in and out was so fast with no lines or waiting time. The staff gave us great suggestions for our first time in Toronto including restaurants and neighborhoods that we loved. The train is around the corner and everything is walkable so we only took the train and street car one day. We were able to walk everywhere. We recommend the Cambridge Suites and look forward to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “So Close to Everything with a Comfortable and Large Room”
Reviews.Author: skepticaltraveler
Reviews.Content: I'm surprised at the negative comments below because we had a great time in Toronto thanks to Cambridge Suites. I kept checking their website to get a super rate and it paid off. The staff treated us well even though we weren't paying top dollar for the room. Just around the corner from the subway, we could get anywhere very quickly. The breakfasts were excellent and constantly replenished - oatmeal, dry cereal, soy milk (which you seldom find anywhere at free breakfasts), pastries, yogurt, fresh fruit, and more. They have a business center with 2 computers as well. The room was large, clean, and comfortable. Even though we were in town, the siren noise wasn't bad at night. I'm a light sleeper and I think I did fairly well. I can't think of a nicer or safer place to stay in a big city like Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and central location”
Reviews.Author: Alecko
Reviews.Content: Cambridge Suites have been highly recommended by most TripAdvisor reviewers and deservedly so. Compared with most hotel suites, this offers excellent accommodation (including first class service), great facilities and a central location just off downtown Yonge Street that is hard to better. And the price was very good with a significant discount for our extended stay. The actual suite - a CityScape on the 21st floor - in which we stayed in was comfortable, very well-equipped and the lines/towels were spotless and changed as regularly as we wished over our nine-day stay. The staff were particularly helpful, particularly in respect of flexibility over house-keeping, booking tours and providing general advice and assistance. The suite layout offers a very flexible accommodation solution, so that two people can share one suite but sleep in separate rooms (one using the very comfortable double sofa bed). The fact that the en-suite bathroom can be accessed independently from both the bedroom and the sitting room is another helpful feature. The restaurant facility on the ground floor - Portico - is excellent and a similar menu is available for in-room dining. This was not my first trip to Toronto, but I would definitely choose Cambridge Suites again with any hesitation. Although we were travelling on vacation, it would be equally appropriate for business travellers since the suite is equipped with a good sized work desk, high speed wireless internet (free in the Cityscape suites) and even some handy office stationary, plus an on-site printing service. Just bring your own laptop or use the business facilities. Thanks to all the staff for making it a most enjoyable stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: maxbird11
Reviews.Content: I usually travel for business but this trip I accompanied my husband on a business trip to Toronto and stayed at Cambridge Suites Hotel. What a wonderful stay. I'm used to staying in a five star hotel on my company's dime but this hotel was way up there in my book. I went on line and found a special rate of 168.00 per night breakfast included (continental). I was a bit nervous since I didn't think any hotel that charged 168 could fit the bill for me. I was very pleasantly surprised. Clean, neat, wonderful rooms and great staff. Each room is a suite with a living room which is quite large and has a table and chairs to work at or eat a meal. The bedroom is separated by glass doors and there is a separate bathroom with tub. Another room which is the dressing room with large closet and sink. This comes in handy when waking up early and not wanting to disturb the other person who is still sleeping. The linens on the beds are extremely soft and comfortable with down pillows and comforters. Extra pillows are available through housekeeping and arrived quickly. We arrived late the first evening and had dinner in the restaurant at the hotel 'Portico' which was excellent. Then, once in our room we found a few minor issue, a lightbulb was out, the safe was locked shut and the AC couldn't be lowered. Called down to the front desk and as it was 11:30PM they said they would have someone come up first thing in the morning. Sure enough, it was all fixed by 9AM. Location was great too. Near lots of shopping, restaurants and attractions. Parking on premises.

Reviews.Title: “great value/excellant location”
Reviews.Author: RossChampion
Reviews.Content: Just got back from another great visit to one of my favorite cities . First time staying in a Hotel this close to downtown. Got frustrated with various travel web sites. called the hotel directly, got same rates. Consciergehooked us up with theatre tickets. Great staff. And an aside to the people complaining about the price of parking= Park in downtown Chicago or New York if you think $20 a day is high. I paid $25 in Cleveland last Oct. Its not the Ritz-Carlton but a very nice place

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding location, amenities and service”
Reviews.Author: pmirchan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for 14 days to attend a conference and I cannot recommend the hotel highly enough. The room was spacious and comfortable with an additional sitting and working room. The staff were outstandingly helpful and courteous and the service overall was exemplary. I had a great time and would return unhesitatingly.

Reviews.Title: “Yet another amazing stay - the staff have become like family”
Reviews.Author: gal_businesstraveler
Reviews.Content: My last trip to Cambridge was my fourth long-term stay (2-3 weeks). I can't even refer to them as staff any more as they truly have become family. Anna at the front desk over heard me mention how much I loved the orchids in the lobby (they get new flowers in every Tuesday) and what a shame they were leaving as they still looked so beautiful. Returning home (to the hotel) after a 12 hour work day, Anna caught me before going up to my room with the amazingly sweet and thoughtful surprise of a vase full of the orchids she saved for me. Actually, all of the front staff are extremely knowledgeable in the best sights and tastes in the area. Their level of care and attention is nothing short of exceptional! Looking forward to my next stayâ€¦actually, return home!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but tired, odd rooms”
Reviews.Author: stuckinmuscat
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here twice on out tour round Ontario, once when we landed and the last few days before we left. Best point is the location, right in downtown Ontario 1 block from Yonge Street and the Eaton Centre etc. Easy walking to explore. the hotel entrance is very nice if a bit cramped if you are heading out around 8am. Lifts are quick and rattle free, but the rooms just seemed a little tired. the first one we had was better, a bit newer, but the second room was dated and you could hear everysingle little door being closed as well as the lifts. We didn't worry too much as it was more a place to crash after exploring Toronto, but maybe a bit much to ask for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Decent location, odd room”
Reviews.Author: CleveRocks
Reviews.Content: We stayed only one night. We arrived in Toronto mid-morning on a Friday and left on Saturday before dinner. The hotel fit the bill as our base of operations to tour a few spots in the city with our two elementary-school-aged children. We got what I thought was a decent rate, $164 per night for a deluxe suit with 2 double beds (the least expensive type of room). The location was great, a few steps from Yonge Street, a block away from the nearest subway stop. I was disappointed with the size, layout and privacy of the suite. Now, it's important to keep in mind that this was our fourth hotel of our trip, and the third suite hotel. Our Embassy Suites suite in Niagara Falls was huge in comparison to this room, as was our suite at the Niagara Falls Great Wolf Lodge. Our suite in the Cambridge was, it seemed, the size of about 1.5 "regular" hotel rooms. That's fine, small is OK, especially in a hotel in a downtown location. But what was odd to me was the layout of the room and the relative lack of privacy. The bedroom and the living room are connected by double-doors. The doors are comprised of glass ... not totally clear glass like a regular window, it was different than that, but it was clear enough that it did not afford any privacy. I'm having difficulty describing it ... it wasn't like glass brick, where you can tell there is something there on the other side but can't tell what ... with this, you knew EXACTLY what's on the other side. [I wish I'd taken photos!] For example, were I a modest person, I would not want to get undressed in the bedroom if there was someone sitting on the living room sofa, as the person in the living room would be able to tell it was me and would be able to see me getting undressed, just through a sort-of gauzy distortion but still clear enough to tell me what I was still wearing (if anything) and whether or not I need to lose weight. :-) Now, don't get me wrong, it's not like my wife and I needed privacy for any sort of adult activity ... I slept in one bed with one child and my wife slept in the other bed with the other child, all in the same room ... but I post this just in case someone might WANT the privacy you'd expect in having a separate bedroom. An oddity was that there was no closet in the bedroom, and no dresser ANYWHERE. There were three dresser-sized drawers built into the vanity of the large bathroom, and there is a closet in there, as well. The vanity is more than large enough for 2 sinks, but there is only one ... not having the second sink allows for the location of the drawers. The toilet and tub shower are located in another small room adjacent to the outer bathroom. The outer bathroom is accessible by a door from the living room and a pocket door from the bedroom. There was no safe in the room. But the wet bar and supplied dishes, glassware and flatware was a nice touch. Through some miscommunication during the check-on process, I was led to believe that wireless Internet was available for free in the lobby and in the business center. I found out the hard way that it is available for $11.95 for a 24-hour period (in the room, it must be WIRED Internet, same charge). I was in the small lobby at 5:30 a.m., and nicely explained to the front desk clerk (after he told me the fee) that I needed the web for only 5-10 minutes to solidify some touring plans. He gave me a card with a complimentary wireless code that he said would be good for 30 minutes of wireless Internet (in the lobby). That was a nice touch, I must admit. It was on a pre-printed card (but he hand-printed the 6-character code in the provided blank space), so this must come up a lot. Parking was convenient ... $22 a day, unlimited in-and-out privileges, no need for a ticket or talking with a booth attendant, it's all reportedly done electronically with cameras keyed in on your vehicle's license plate. The complimentary breakfast was pleasant enough ... breads, fruits, pastries, hard-boiled eggs, sliced American cheese, beverages. I'd stay here again. It was a fine place to sleep. But beware about staying there if you need to share the suite with someone you're not intimate with (that is, someone you'd not want to share a regular hotel room with) as the glass doors between the bedroom and living room afford no privacy whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PhucDong
Reviews.Content: Perhaps one of the most elegant and nicest hotels I have ever stayed in with awesome views of Toronto from downtown. The staff was exceptional. Front desk provided me with a wonderful check-in and check-out experience and the waitress at the restaurant was really friendly and nice. Even though we had arrived a little late for breakfast she was still accommodating. The rooms were everything I had expected. We stayed in a Cityscapes room which was clean, updated, and pleasing. The room had a bedroom along with a living room and although it was a little small, I felt that the place was really cozy. I liked the large windows that gave a nice view of the city from downtown. Lastly, my partner really enjoyed this hotel and for me that was all that mattered.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Luxury Hotel, good location!”
Reviews.Author: Minoue-Sisteron
Reviews.Content: Got a corner room with separated living room and bed room. Both very big rooms with big TV in both rooms. Clean and spacious bath room. Just off Eaton Centre Mall and easy access to main down town area of Toronto on foot. Also just off Queens subway station. Got a little problem in the room, but hotel stuff fixed it right away. Bit pricy, but worth every penny!! Definitely recommended!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms & location + best service”
Reviews.Author: FamilyTravelReview
Reviews.Content: Family of 4 with 2 young children under 5 Location: 5 min walk to subway & shopping Taxi in front of hotel at all times Visitors can park in front of the hotel for up to 15 min Room: VERY GOOD We got 20th floor city view, very clean and good size for Toronto Comfortable beds, microwave, fridge, safe box , 2 TVs... Service:BEST ( MUCH better than United States) 1) We got weather report daily on a card, free bottle waters every night 2) Front desk girls were very helpful, booked baby sitting service for us 3) Special thanks to the Breakfast manager/team I took my 2 young children to breakfast room a few minutes after 10 am (door was locked), A short hair Asian female manager opened the door for us so my kids could eat something. Breakfast team helped with baby chair , carried food for me without asking ( I was the last customer there but did not feel rushed at all) We liked this hotel so much that we decided to stay 3 more nights here (and they gave us same discounted rate we paid) Suggestions: Change breakfast time to 10:30 Update the washer/dryer to front loader styles large bags fill with toys for family with kids to borrow (charge a small fee is ok ) Snack machine

Reviews.Title: “Tremendous Service!”
Reviews.Author: Texasbart
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights in May and they were remarkable in helping with a lost purse. My wife left her purse in Duggan's brewery (across the street) where we had dinner Saturday night. It included her passport, driver's license, phone, and our car keys (some lessons are learned the hard way). Unfortunately, we were due to fly out Sunday and Duggans was closed for the day. The front desk e-mailed and left messages at the owner's home to no avail. After some time with customs, we were able to return to the US Sunday. The Cambridge Suites staff then went over to Duggan's on Monday, collected the purse and sent it to us in Texas - where we received it with all items in tact! It really was a wonderful effort and very cheerfully executed. Other thoughts: The service was consistently good - from dinner recommendation to directions. The room was quite spacious, clean, and nicely furnished and has to be the best value for the space and quality available downtown. Breakfast was good, lots of fresh fruit. Location was a bit far from the conference center, but had easy access to the subway which made moving through town simple and cheap. Fitness Center was small but adequate with a great view from the 22nd floor.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: Morjohn
Reviews.Content: We experienced our first - but not last - stay at the Cambridge Suites with our 26 year old son who we were visiting for the weekend. He was too tall for the pullout but nevertheless, had a good sleep. We enjoyed the adjoining room and the guys played cribbage on the dining table. It was really a wonderful stay from the warm reception, right through to check out. We ate at Portico restaurant for dinner and the food and the service were excellent. We enjoyed the continental breakfast one morning and ate a full breakfast the last morning and both were first rate. As folks have already commented on, the location was excellent. We look forward to coming to Toronto again and will stay here. Apples in the foyer were a nice touch. Thanks so much for your great hospitality! Kiim

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel is the Best..Amazing..5+++”
Reviews.Author: cindyjohn
Reviews.Content: Where do i begin.... From the moment you walk in till the moment you go to sleep.. Fabulous....Its one of the best places i have stayed at... I totally feel at home here..comfortable rooms.. all the staff are very very friendly.. They all know be be my name... There is no attitude here... Tim the General Manager is outstanding.. You have to meet him or simply email him..Prompt response... I love it here....I do not want to leave......HELP!!!!

Reviews.Title: “It's home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: dbfg309
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best hotel I have stayed in for a long time! I was greeted warmly and everyone looked after everything that I requested. I took a little bit of Cambridge home with me as you no doubtingly will too once you sleep on their beds. The suites are set up so that you feel that you are not living in your bedroom. I felt very safe in the heart of Toronto. What a treat that I decided to try the Cambridge!! Will always stay there when I go to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy with good resto near Eaton centre”
Reviews.Author: whatwhatMontreal
Reviews.Content: It's just a five-minute walk from the downtown shopping zone and theatre district area of TO. It's also a short walk from the main churches and medical facilities downtown. Generally good value for money. Hotel staff were helpful and efficient. Portico restaurant has a good menu, high-quality cuisine and good service. The free complimentary breakfast for guests is better quality and more generous than that of many other hotels. There is also room service but we didn't have time to try it. Nice room decor and good housekeeping. But: the Cityscape room that we got only had a view of offices in surrounding blocks. And, the coin-laundry in the basement-parking area contains washers and dryers that seemed to be a bit old.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: Weerobbie
Reviews.Content: The suite was very well laid out , clean and comfortable. The bed was good making for a good night's sleep. The Front Desk staff were extremely friendly and very helpful. A short walk from the train station and all the major downtown attractions, you can't beat this hotel for location. The room was a bit noisy from city traffic but I have stayed at far noisier in the downtown core. I will definitely be staying here again for a holiday or business.

Reviews.Title: “Same consistent exceptional experience each and every time!”
Reviews.Author: Gibber22
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Cambridge Suites well over 200 times over the course of the past 8 years and what I love is that the experience never changes. That's why I keep coming back. The employees are always friendly, the rooms are always clean and kept current with furnishings and amenities. Check in and out is a breeze. Convenience, service and select at the continental breakfast and Portico restaurant is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, what a deal!”
Reviews.Author: Lotus777
Reviews.Content: My two daughters (teenagers) and I booked a room for three nights at this hotel during the March Break. I could not have made a better choice! Not only did we get an excellent deal (we booked online at the hotel's website) but the location, the service and the suite were way beyond our expectations. We booked a Cityscape suite and just as the website promised, this suite was located on one the upper floors (ours was on the 18th floor). Not only was the view enticing (especially at night) but we were also spared the sometimes deafening sounds of Toronto's traffic. Needless to say we slept well at night and woke up fresh in the morning to an adequate hotel b'fast on the second floor. I say adequate because it's a continental b'fast, but they had an array of different cereals, pastries, fruit and breads. More than ample I would think. I also absolutely loved their old-fashioned oatmeal...delicious! The room has a mini bar and a Keurig beverage maker which was really nice for that 11 0'clock cup of coffee or for an evening cup of tea. While their rooms are great (spacious and clean) and the location wonderful, it's the staff that is the hotel's true treasure. No matter where you go - the Front Desk, Housekeeping, the Restaurants - the staff are friendly, efficient and eager to please. If I had just one squabble, it would be with the b'fast hours. When we were there b'fast was served only from 7-9am. I think keeping the b'fast going till 10:00am would be a nice touch and definitely helpful for those of us that like to sleep in.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with cigarette smell in room.”
Reviews.Author: teagran
Reviews.Content: In reading reviews on Tripadvisor, I gather that renovations are underway at Cambridge Suites hotel. My husband and I stayed in a suite that was not renovated, so there were minor flaws as reported by previous reviews - cracks in the bathroom tiles, marks on the wallpaper in the bathroom, etc. But that sort of thing doesn't bother me, and I wasn't surprised that we got an un-renovated room considering the lower rate we received when booking on the hotel website. However, what really bothered both my husband and me was the STRONG smell of cigarette smoke that permeated the suite. It was enough to make my eyes burn and water. Clearly someone had smoked in our room previously. It made the room feel dirty. We lit candles and opened the window in the bedroom for a little bit (it was a really cold night, so we couldn't leave it open), but even that didn't help much. This was definitely disappointing, as it became all I could focus on. Looking back, I should have requested a room change immediately, but we had already settled in and were too tired to make a fuss. Very disappointing and not a relaxing stay as a result. That being said, the bed was comfortable and the view over the city at night was great. Staff were pleasant and helpful. When I reported the cigarette smoke at the front desk upon checkout, the movie we watched was comped, and the staff person apologized, which we appreciated. I also received an apology from the hotel's manager when I emailed him with feedback. Still, we won't be staying at the Cambridge Suites Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Suites in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Traveling-Trojan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located only a block from the subway, streetcars, and the Eaton Centre shopping mall. Only a few blocks away are the Canon Theatre, Massey Hall, and the Hockey Hall of Fame. Although we arrived at 5:00 pm, our suite was not available, but we were immediately offered a better suite. Our suite was roomy, modern, comfortable, clean, and well-maintained. The complimentary breakfast is adequate, but the breakfast room was crowded on a Sunday morning. The hotel has an attractive bar, and the food and service in the restaurant are upscale. Parking is reasonable by downtown Toronto standards, or the "Green P" parking garage across the street is another low-cost option. We received a good rate on a pre-paid reservation made online. On that basis, I would recommend the Cambridge Suites as good value and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks Cambridge”
Reviews.Author: djtsunami
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here for both business and pleasure and love it here. This time it was a pleasure trip for the night and my son's first night in a hotel. It was fantastic that they let us check in early, and it's also nice that we could have our son on the pull-out couch in the living room area, close the doors, and still watch TV in the bedroom and not disturb him. Cont. breakfast is good, and was enjoyed by all. Close to Eaton's Centre, and walking distance to other areas of interest (Union Station, Restaurants, Nathan Phillips Square, etc). Thanks again!

Reviews.Title: “What a great find!”
Reviews.Author: Travel-Girl-19640308
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a one night stay at the Cambridge Suites in Toronto. Went with two girlfriends to take in a Sunday Matinee at the Winter Garden Theatre. We chose this hotel because of the fantastic location and I will say that it was a stretch for me since I do have another FAVE in downtown Toronto that I never stray from. Guess what FAVE.....I will be straying. We enjoyed everything about this hotel! The front desk staff was friendly and efficient, the room was lovely, the continental breakfast was more than adequate and the location simply cannot be beat if you are going to the theatre or just going for some Yonge Street shopping. The Eaton Centre is a five minute stroll. The only negative to our little getaway occurred when we went to check out and one of my friends discovered that a bracelet that she had been wearing, (one with great senitimental value as well as great value) was no longer on her wrist. We scoured every inch of the room but it was not to be found so one of the others in our group returned to the stores in the Eaton Centre where she had been shopping. Well.....people of Toronto.....THANK YOU! Some kind soul found the bracelet and turned it in at the lost and found of the Sears Department Store. You have no idea how much my friend wishes she could thank you personally! The hotel staff were more than sympathetic and vowed to call the instant they found the bracelet, so you can stop looking now. Again, thank you for your genuine concern and optomistic outlook. We will definitely return to Toronto and will definitely return to the Cambridge Suites!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: JENNMCC
Reviews.Content: Second time at the hotel. Suites are clean and very large. Loved having 2 modern tvs in the room. Staff is very friendly and accomodating. Great location. Also was very happy that you are allowed to park in the garage until 6pm day of check out. Will be back.

Reviews.Title: “the best place if you are looking for all your dreams to come true.”
Reviews.Author: stantron
Reviews.Content: i have stayed by other hotels but everytime i go to this hotel it make all of my dreams come true the rooms are so valuable and elegant the staff is so friendly that if you feel lost they will make you feel like home.

Reviews.Title: “Staff helped make this stay extremely enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: Parisismyfavourite
Reviews.Content: Room was very clean with nice quality toiletries provided. Bed and pillows very comfortable. The front desk staff were always available, pleasant and helpful. The only disappointment I had was there was no room service available for breakfast. I have just been informed that this will change as of February 2010.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel...don't think I will find one that is better!”
Reviews.Author: ykf
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing. I don't think there is a better one in Toronto. The staff was outstanding, very friendly. The hotel felt very clean, and check in went very smoothly. I wish I could have stayed longer! It was my best sleep at a hotel to date! I also really liked the location of this hotel - if you are looking to shop at the Eaton's center.. this location is great! Will return for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Excellence across the board”
Reviews.Author: satchmo0575
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Cambridge Suites in Toronto multiple times and I must say that the hotel delivers excellence across the board. There cannot possibly be another hotel to compare with the charm, refinement, service and staff attitude than at Cambridge Suites. The location is superb with an abundance of amenities within walking distance. Parking although a bit pricey is still competitive with any downtown parking rate. The staff at the hotel are very professional and courteous. Specifically, they actually think ahead and anticipate your requests. Rooms are generously sized and the separate sleeping quarters are very nice. What is most important is how the General Manager Mr. Tim Ostrem cares about your experience with follow-up emails. He definitely makes you feel that your business is valued and appreciated. George

Reviews.Title: “Another great weekend at the Cambridge Suites”
Reviews.Author: mmedlyn
Reviews.Content: This is the second stay for my husband and I at the Cambridge Suites in Toronto. Although we live only an hour north of Toronto, we have enjoyed escaping for our second weekend stay in the city since discovering this fabulous hotel located in walking distance of many great restaurants, shopping and sites. The rooms in the hotel are fabulous with large LCD tvs, an extremely comfortable bed, large bathroom and sitting area. The hotel staff is extremely friendly and helpful. We loved the accessibility of the Eatons centre and many other great shops, fantastic restaurants and day excursions within a short walk. This trip we walked to the AGO and around many other streets in the area. Despite living very close to Toronto, this fantastic hotel makes us want to just stay over the next time we are in the city!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Gem in Heart of Toronto”
Reviews.Author: us3andthedog
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights just after Christmas 2009 and was warmly welcomed by the reception staff. We had booked a 2 night stay then were going to Niagra Falls for a few nights and returned 31st Dec for 1 night. We booked a Cityscape suite and was very happy when we entered the room. It was very clean and had a large lounge area complete with fridge, sofa bed, chair, coffe table and table with 4 chairs. The bedroom was also big, a large bed, which was the best bed I have ever slept in. The bedroom led to the dressing area and to the bathroom. The breakfast was ideal, toast, cereal, muffins, fruit and coffees, selection of tea's. As we were returning to the Cambridge Suites a few days later we were offered a chance to leave unwanted luggage until we returned. There was a laundry facility on the lower level which was great for us. When I return to Toronto I will definatly go back to the Cambridge Suites. If I had to rate this hotel it would be 10 / 10

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, friendly and helpful staff, super room and we could not fault this hotel”
Reviews.Author: GotravelEssex_UK
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Cambridge Suites situated in downtown Toronto for six nights. It's a perfect location, within easy walking distance of the Eaton Shopping Centre, Massey Hall, the metro and lots of great restaurants. We found all the staff to be very friendly and extremely helpful and the Concierge dealt with our theatre bookings, arranged a very good excursion to Niagra Falls and booked our tickets for the open top 'on / off' tour bus - a great way to see all Toronto's sights. We don't believe our room was one of the newly refurbished rooms but, nonetheless, we found it to be of a very good standard. It was equipped with everything we needed in an apartment so that we were able to prepare breakfast and snacks in our room. Small kitchen area with microwave, fridge, sink etc., comfortable lounge area with TV and a very comfortable bed with second TV in bedroom. The cleanliness of the hotel was of a high standard. Had two very good meals in the hotel's Portico Restaurant - their pre-theatre meal was very good value. Would definitely recommend this hotel and hope to return there again one day. Thanks to all the staff for making our stay so enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay if you want to shop or go out in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: disneygal
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Cambridge Suites Hotel again with a girlfriend as we had some Christmas shopping to do and like to leave the families behind and shop and relax in Toronto. The hotel is in a great location for the Eaton Centre and surrounding shops on Yonge St. as well as for the Mirvish theatre shows at the various locations. The hotel offers underground parking at a reasonable fee and it includes a continental breakfast which was plenty to get us started in the morning. The room was great and spacious and very clean. The front desk staff and all the other staff we encountered were very nice. We have been before and will return again to the Cambridge Suites! Look into shopping/theatre packages with the hotel as they are offered and sometimes including parking etc.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, feel right at home. Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Kazza31
Reviews.Content: I always stay at this hotel on business trips. It is very comfortable and roomy. Staff is consistently pleasant (both hotel guest services and lounge/restaurant staff). Location is perfect for shopping. Rooms are clean and beds are very comfortable. I have tried other hotels over the years and ALWAYS come back to Cambridge Suites. It is truly my favorite.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: Guest1
Reviews.Content: From the moment we walked into the hotel, everything was perfect. The checkin experience was quick and efficient and parking was right beneath the hotel with an elevator to take you up. We stayed on the 20th floor in two of the most beautiful suites I have ever stayed in. The view was fantastic (we could see the fire works that go off on weekends in December) from the room which was an added bonus. Everything clean and very modern throughout the entire room. The bed was one of the most comfortable I have ever slept on in a hotel. Although there are snacks you can purchase in the room for an added fee, they also include some free snacks as an added bonus. Microwave popcorn and cookies was such a nice treat! The maid came by for turndown service and gave us water and a chocolate which was such a nice touch. Room amenities are top notch and include Aveda products - who doesn't love Aveda products! Overall I give this stay a perfect 10 and I am already looking forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “The whole package- clean, comfortable, very nice decor/amenities, great staff and location”
Reviews.Author: onthegoDetroit
Reviews.Content: Booked a weekend with the Hot Dates Great Rates deal on their website ($119/night- cheaper than all the travel websites!) We arrived in the evening and we were nervous that the standard deluxe suite room would be shabby, so we requested an upgrade to Cityscape but they were all booked. We were given free continental breakfast (beware, it only runs 8am-10am, which made me glad I did not get Cityscape room for more money) simply because we asked and they were unable to upgrade! That was really nice. And the room was beautiful! Extremely clean and modern decor (not like the picture that was emailed to me upon booking.) Two flat screen tv's, nice sitting area, separate sink and toilet/shower areas, bar with sink and glasses, microwave, refrigerator. Really nice layout. Beds were really hard in the deluxe suite but the feather pillow option was nice. The front desk staff were very helpful and approachable. We were able to walk to the Distillery District, St. Lawrence Market, PATH, Bloor St, ROM, Spadina area from this location. Perfectly central. TIP: if you plan on using the subway, buy a day pass. $9 for two adults, unlimited riding all day until 5:30am the next day.

Reviews.Title: “Toronto Cambridge Suites like visiting family and firends.”
Reviews.Author: Andrew737
Reviews.Content: We have been here a few times and the friendliness of the staff is the BEST. They make us welcome, and are very sincere. The hotel is right downtown and a short walk everywhere, and right at the subway. The rooms are new, elegant and not stuffy in decor. The value for what you get is great. The king size beds have these pillows and sheets that you literally melt into at the end of the night. The whole place is like a big family and you are treated like you are one of their family. It helps that it is not a big hotel, and it feels more cozy, but with elegance and the amenities of a 5 star hotel. We will be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: FourfriendsCanada
Reviews.Content: Cambridge Suites in Toronto has become our "hotel of choice" when we visit Toronto for our annual "women's weekend" of shopping, theatre, dining and fun. The location is perfect - close to the subway and shopping - and the amenities at the hotel suit our tastes. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: Swan_tim
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a couple of times in the past, and if you can get a good deal, it is a great hotel. Very nice rooms, good service and location. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Multiple business stays- gets better every time.”
Reviews.Author: newf1982
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Cambridge Suites Hotel for the first time on somewhat of an extended stay (6 nights) and later returned for 11 consecutive nights. All in all I have spent most of the month of November at this hotel and was quite pleased with the facility. I have had deluxe rooms on both occassions (5th and 15th floors). The location of this hotel is great, located at the center of all Toronto has to offer. It is across the street from the Eaton Centre and major attractions such as CN Tower, ACC, Rogers Centre and the entertainment district are close by. Overall, you can't get a better location. What I really like about this hotel is how great it is for long stays. It feels like being home with a "condo style" feel to it. The living room and bedroom are seperated by two french doors, and there at LG 37" LCDs in both rooms - a great feature. There is a fridge, microwave, sink, mini bar, and enough dishes and cutlery for one-two people. There is a gym on the 22nd floor with an amazing view of the Toronto skyline. The staff at the hotel are geat. I checked out to go home for a weekend and in between, the staff took care of an extra suitcase and delivered it to my room shortly after I rechecked in. The staff at this hotel really do care, and the hotel Manager is committed to guest satisfaction (see how often he checks this website and replies to guest comments). Overall, if you are looking for a great place to stay in Toronto, for both personal reasons or business travel, I highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great home away from home”
Reviews.Author: shazzie_canuck
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in a junior suite, and I could not fault a thing. The hotel is in a great location - on the PATH, steps away from Yonge Street, the Eatons Centre, subway station, restaurants etc. The suite felt quite spacious and was clean, bright and very comfortable. Amenities included fridge, microwave, coffee maker, iron, ironing board, TV in sitting room and in bedroom. There were plenty of glasses, dishes etc The staff were very friendly and helpful on the few occasions we spoke to them. We called down to request a kettle and it was brought to us within a few minutes. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally Located Property with large rooms”
Reviews.Author: Sensenigr
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Cambridge Suites Toronto for a three night stay in October 2009. We found the property to be centrally located near Younge-Dundas Square and really close to the Eaton Center. The rooms were very spacious with plenty of storage space, a nice wet bar with minibar, separate refrigerator, and microwave. A large living room, dining area, a bathroom separate from a very large vanity area, and a enclosed bedroom. Our deluxe suite, which is there standard room, was recently remodeled. Nearly all of the furnishings are new and in good condition. Only the vanity, parts of the bathroom, and the microwave seemed to be not included in the refurbishment. But, overall, a very good room. There is a large television in both the living room and the bedroom. One thing to be very aware of, is that the bed mattresses are VERY FIRM! I do understand that some people like firm mattresses, so for you this would be perfect; however, for me it was generally uncomfortable. I am told by the hotel staff that feather tops are available to make them more comfortable; however, did not realize this until after check-out. The exercise room is very adequate and there is also day passes available to a larger fitness facility nearby. The hot cider and cookies were a nice touch to come back to in the middle of the afternoon. The only negative thing I would mention is that the staff certainly did not go out of there way with being friendly, like I generally experience from a hotel of this sorts. Not once during our stay was I acknowledged with a hello or how are you doing from any member of housekeeping, the front desk, or anyone else I encountered in the hotel. To there benefit, I would comment that they were generally friendly when approached; however, they certainly did not go out of there way to be nice and warm.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff made the stay!”
Reviews.Author: mcbainjoe
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Cambridge for 6 nights. The hotel has a great set up in that all the rooms are suites, which was perfect for my husband and me, as we have different sleeping schedules. The small kitchenette was great for the longer stay. We were able to buy groceries before arriving, so we would have breakfast in our room, and popcorn at night. The room was clean and quiet, although the noise from the street was sometimes loud (but that is the city). The staff was super helpful!! We wanted to go to the Science Centre, which was far away, and they recommended we take public transit. They broke it down for us into easy instructions (there is no subway where we are from). Then, they even gave us free admission, as another traveller had dropped off vouchers!! Even the girl dropping off our room service was nice (although room service was pricy).

Reviews.Title: “A Pretty Good Experience...”
Reviews.Author: ByrnesSL
Reviews.Content: Parking was a little expensive and only had COLD water to shower with on the day of check out, but the hotel gave me a credit on my bill for that. Hotel was clean and well kept and had a great night view of the city. Easy walking distance to subway and attractions. Overall a pretty good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay...”
Reviews.Author: BartiraC
Reviews.Content: I like this Hotel because it has all the structure I needed to relax and also to work. Breakfast is not bad, but it cannot be compared to the ones I have in Barzil! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Nice New Feel”
Reviews.Author: KyleHunter
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel for business travelers. Nice rooms and beds. Large space in the room. Good restaurant and bar. Helpful staff

Reviews.Title: “Great base to explore Toronto”
Reviews.Author: CMarkC
Reviews.Content: We booked this after reading the Tripadvisor reviews and we were not disappointed. The location is excellent, we walked almost everywhere and were just 2 minutes from Yonge Street (the main street running from the lake up through the city). The rooms were superb (I've lived in smaller flats) and the staff were very helpful. I can't recommend this hotel highly enough, we thoroughly enjoyed our time there.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay in Toronto!”
Reviews.Author: cfudge
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Toronto, stayed at the Cambridge Suites for two nights after the Westin Harbour Castle cancelled our Hotwire reservation at the last minute and Hotwire rebooked us into the Cambridge. Couldn't be happier with how it worked out. We were in a corner room on the 8th floor, newly renovated. Room was great, bed was firm and made for a great sleep. Considering the hotel was fully booked and very busy it was quiet, never heard any noise from the hallway or other rooms. Really great location for walking to the Eaton Center (5 minutes) and all over the downtown area. We'll stay here again for sure and have already recommended it to others who are planning Toronto trips.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel for any purpose”
Reviews.Author: pscprof
Reviews.Content: I am normally very critical of hotels and usually look for the best deal under US $100. I had to attend a conference and the Cambridge Suites was not one of the eight conference hotels but it cost a bit less than the rest and sounded like it had much more to offer. It is the best of all possible worlds. It is close to all of the major hotels but has none of their drawbacks (overpriced hotel stores and ammenities, dozens of halls and towers, impersonal feel, etc.). The standard rooms have a bedroom and living room and each has a 37 inch TV so two people could easily have different living spaces or you could entertain guests. It has a refrigerator separate from the minibar and a microwave and sink as well as dishes and utensils. There is a large desk with a comfortable swivel desk chair, a nice sofa, two arm chairs. At the top floor there is a small fitness center with a hot tub that overlooks the entire city. But one of the best deals is that they will let you use a luxury fitness center that is two blocks away for FREE. The Adelaide Club would cost $25 a day if you were not a guest. The service is also excellent- they gave me a toaster, made up the room exactly when I wanted it done every day I was there, and gave me a special price for three days of high speed internet access. The food at their restaurant is also very good and they offer ten dollars off your first dinner entree. The hotel is also within two blocks of a drop off point for the Airport Express, a block from a 7-11, and one block from the Eaton Shopping Center. There is nothing not to like about this hotel. I highly recommend it. It is particularly good if you have a conference at a major conference hotel and want your money to go to the quality of the room and service instead of to the conference facilities overhead expenses. First rate hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for a visit to Toronto”
Reviews.Author: gchrist256
Reviews.Content: Good location in Toronto. Rooms were large and comfortable. Staff was polite and efficient. Nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, large comfortable Room”
Reviews.Author: Scottraveller6
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and i stayed here in july for 3 nights, as the first stop on our round the world travels. We got the bus from the airport and got dropped off down the street, we asked the driver for directions and the hotel was a short 5-10min walk. getting the airport shuttle bus was no trouble, however make sure you have an idea on what direction the hotel is. The entrance to the hotel slightly sits to the side, on arrival we were pleasantly surprised, reception in modern and frsh, reception staff were very polite and helpful, we got checked in as soon as we arrived and it was a quick and easy process. the rooms themselves were very large, the bedroom was very spacious, the bed was very comfortable, the room had a small wardrope and a large flat screen tv, the living room had a sofa,a chair, another tv, a desk and chair and a small kitchen area. The kitchen comprised of a fridge microwave,sink etc. it was great having the extra space and the fridge was useful for storing drink etc, there is a 7/11 store round the corner from the hotel for room supplies. my boyfriend was a little unwell during our stay and we ended up spending a lot of time in the hotel, the tv has a large range of tv channels which was good.only negative i had about the hotel room was that it did not have a safe, but there was safety boxes at reception which could be used free of charge. the hotel location is great is 5min walk to the large shopping centre, the eaton centre which has lots of shops, a large food court and places where you can exchange currency. i would recommend a trip up the Cn tower for great views of the city. also we did a tour of the nirgara falls, witha tour company called chariots of fire, it was $60pp which is a lot cheaper than many of the other tour guides. the tour was fantastic, it includes the maid of the mist boat tour, you get 2hrs to spend at the niagra falls, i would recommend walking up the street which you pass on the way in, it was burger king, ripleys believe it or not, ghost houses,great sweet/candy shops, it is just really fun the kids will love it, my boyfriend said it was tacky but it was the highlight of the trip for me ;-) the tour also includes some time at the village of niagara on the lake, it is truely beautiful little village, with gorgeous little houses and colourful flowers and lovely little shops.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and good location, would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: hedgehog61
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed in a nice suite and enjoyed our stay. While we didn't take advantage of many of the hotel's ammenities, we found the room more than adequate. One nice think is that the suite had a couch bed eliminating the need for a rollaway. The location was great, right near the corner of Yonge Street and the TTC so getting around was easy. Madison, the concierge was fantastic. Very friendly and really helpful with maps and reservations. Only one gripe and it is a small one. We stayed in room 302 which faced the corner of Richmond and Yonge so it was mildly noisy. Also could hear the elavator from this room but it didn't really bother us too much. A light sleeper might have trouble with this room. Overall a really nice hotel. We will definitely use the Cambridge again when we return

Reviews.Title: “Excellent home base for our family!”
Reviews.Author: keggcom
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights with our young children (ages 5 and 3) and found it an excellent home base for our busy vacation in Toronto! When we travel, we tend to spend our time seeing the sights and not hanging out in the hotel, but we do like to have a pretty comfortable and spacious room where we can put the kids in one room and take the other for ourselves. The Cambridge Suites met our needs just about perfectly. The staff was unfailingly courteous and professional. With just 12 rooms per floor, it is quiet - from the sitting room we could hear doors opening and closing in the evening from time to time, but from the bedroom it was silent - no street noise, hallway noise, or noise from other suites whatsoever. We were very happy with the cleanliness, size and layout of the room, especially the large closets and the spacious sitting room. My older child was very comfortable on the pull-out couch; we brought a kiddie inflatable travel bed for our little one; we were very happy with the king bed. The bathroom is nothing special but was fine with both a shower and a tub, and a large dressing/sink room. The suite had two closets and a small kitchen area with a microwave, sink, and fridge - we had breakfast in the room most days to save a little money and hassle! Best of all is the location - perfect for our family since we could get to the subway and streetcar right around the corner or easily hop on the highway to get to the zoo and science center. There wasn't much to do in the hotel itself, but that was fine with us since we were pretty much just sleeping and eating breakfast there! We never tried the hotel in the restaurant, which didn't appear to be particularly family-oriented, but we found several family-friendly restaurants nearby. The only minor problem we encountered was that our room, due to be ready for check-in at 4, wasn't actually ready until almost 4:30 - a minor inconvenience, more than made up for by the excellent service the rest of our stay. The two times we asked for something to be sent up to the room, it arrived in under 5 minutes. The hotel guests seemed to be mainly business travelers, but there were other families there as well and we felt very comfortable and welcome. I would certainly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “I'm Spoiled Now...”
Reviews.Author: ladymacb29
Reviews.Content: The hotel was easy to find. Check-in was fast and the employee was very polite. Parking was easy to get into and well-worth the extra charge. We also opted for internet access (at $11.95/day). The internet was very fast, although it seemed the wifi signal wasn't very strong. (We ended up using the ethernet cable to connect instead.) Room layout is wonderful. - Entry hallway (with little coat closet). - Living room included a chair, couch, desk (with leather desk chair), large flat panel tv, and bar area that included a large fridge, two sets of plates/utensils, minibar, coffee pot and coffee, sink and glasses. Fridge was large enough to stand up a 2 liter of soda and still able to fit leftovers on a shelf above. Living room had glass french doors to the bedroom. - Bedroom included another large flat panel tv on a dresser, king size bed, chair, table, 2 night stands, and a closet. Our bedroom had 2 full walls that had windows. One of the windows also had a small window that could open. Bed was very comfortable. Linens were clean, although there was a little stain in one spot (but that's really be helped and it was very small, so it most likely was overlooked). - Bathroom was large. Shower was odd in that there's a little button under the handle to push that will turn on the shower portion. GREAT water pressure. We were on the 15th floor and couldn't hear much street noise, except for an ambulance and every so often a louder-than-normal car. (And note, although the hotel is near St Michael's hospital, we only heard maybe one siren a night before midnight and were not awakened by any sirens during the night, despite me being a very light sleeper.) Also, the curtains were very thick - no light came through. We asked for directions while we were there, the front desk staff was very friendly and gave us directions that were more accurate than Tom-Tom. Hotel is in an amazing location - very close to the Gardiner Expressway and the Don Valley Parkway. Also, it is connected to Toronto's 'PATH' underground walkways, near two subways and on a street car route. There is a Tim Horton's across the street (also with Taco Bell and KFC), a convenience store where we bought some drinks for the hotel room, and a block away from the Eaton Centre mall. There is a laundromat on the P1 level with coin-operated machines. I was telling my husband that I don't know if I could go to a traditional hotel room anymore - we enjoyed having the separate living and dining rooms so much. The only problem we encountered was when we got up on our departure day, there was no power. (Apparently this outage was city-wide.) There wasn't an emergency light in the room that I could tell, however, the light from the windows in the bedroom and living room were sufficient. The elevators also were working during the outage (thankfully!). Although the outage wasn't the hotel's fault and affected a large area, the hotel did offer to comp one night of our internet (after I asked). We were able to check out despite the electrical outage. Despite the outage, I would definitely recommend the hotel to anyone who needs a place to stay in Toronto and wouldn't hesitate to go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location But Just Average Room”
Reviews.Author: KibaChow
Reviews.Content: We are a family of three, 2 adults and 1 child. This was one of 4 hotels we stayed in throughout our trip. We booked thru Expedia so the price was great for a downtown hotel. The location was good because it was close to alot of restraunts and to Eaton Center. But after having stayed at 3 other hotels, Hampton Inn, Marriott at Niagara falls and Residential Inn, I would have to say that this one was the least favorite. The issues I had with this hotel were: 1) Bed was hard as a rock. We slept on it for 1 night out of a 4 night stay. I had to ask for a foam mattress the next day and they did provide one. Bed was much better after that but I really shouldn't have needed to ask for it to begin with. 2) No Breakfast included. Again this was the 4th hotel I stayed at and it was not the cheapest one. All the other hotels provided free breakfast except this one. It was close to alot of restraunts so getting fed was not a problem but it is something for one to consider when comparing hotels. 3) The rooms are small. Mainly due to the way it's configured. Again been thru 4 other hotels. Two of which included my mother in law making it 4 people. It was difficult for my party of 3 to move around once the sofa bed was pulled out and even in the bedroom. 4) Had problems with the internet. They do charge for the internet, about $10 a day but the hardwire connection didn't seem to work for me. I had to go Wifi . Something to consider for those to don't do Wifi or don't like paying for it. 5) The upkeep of the room was o.k. but there were missing tiles in the bathroom walls. The housekeepers does not clean underneath the faucet of the sink so there was mold type stuff underneath the faucet. My bed sheet had some old permanent stains on it. The bedsheet should have been tossed. The cabinet where the fridge and microwave was not in the best of shape. 6) The front desk staff was very very nice but when I wanted to sign up for one of those hop on and hop off tour bus that takes you around toronto, I had specifically asked if it picked up at the hotel and if it had air conditioning. I was told that the one the hotel used did pick up at the hotel while the other ones didn't and had air conditioning. Well after I was picked up at the hotel by an air conditioned bus, I was brought to another location and was told that I had to wait for another bus. That bus did not have air conditioning and if I wanted to use their tour bus services for the next few days, I would have to walk to this location to pick up the bus. Felt quite misled by the Cambridge staff. Didn't trust what they told me afterwards. 7) They do have 1 restraunt on site. But I swear while I was there I didn't see 1 person eating there. I can't say why it was so empty. Could be the price or the food. We stayed away because it looked like no one else wanted to eat there. There was alot of choices in the area and those places were packed sometime. Alot of folks had great reviews of this hotel and that's why I went with it. But I can't give it a good recommendation after our experience.

Reviews.Title: “2nd class for smokers...”
Reviews.Author: AlliesMum
Reviews.Content: If you have a smoker in the family, Cambridge Suites is not a place where you feel you are treated the same as non-smoking guests. The smoking floor was obvious the minute you exited the lift. The room itself smelt absolutely disgusting and there were more burns in the carpet than there was pile. There is absolutely NO excuse for this as was evident when we spent nights in other suites on this trip, notably the Embassy Suites in Niagara Falls, where everything smelled and looked pristine. The Cambridge Suites needs to recognize that just because 1 member of a party smokes, to treat the whole party with such disrespect and disdain is very wrong. If inferior accommodation is supplied, then reduced prices should apply!

Reviews.Title: “Better than my own apartment”
Reviews.Author: CapitalLady
Reviews.Content: Everything about my stay took me by surprise, from the spaciousness of the suite to the immediacy of service and meticulous housekeeping services. I loved the porridge and dried fruit as part of the continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Staff Ruins Stay”
Reviews.Author: JoLiNewYork
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel, the woman behind the counter talked to us in a condescending manner. I had requested adjoining suites on my reservation, but when I arrived and they initially had to find 2 together, the girl at the desk insinuated I was lying, until I "proved" I had requested adjoining suites. I asked for help (we had 5 people, 2 suites) with the luggage. She pointed to a cart, and made no offer to have someone bring them to our room (although, subsequently, I saw guests being assisted). One of our suites wasn't quite ready, so we waited in the other suite (which was adjoining). When the cleaning people finished, they invited us in, so we put our luggage in. I went down to the front desk for my keys. The same, nasty woman told me I wasn't allowed my keys. I told her My luggage was there, and the people let me in. "That's not what I heard," she snarled, as if i was lying to her. She refused to give me my keys until she "officially' heard the room was ready. Not sure what type of clientele she was used to, but this was so put-offish, I was moved to write here for the very first time. The suites, themselves, were inconsistent. Paying the same money for each, one was 40% larger than the other. In my suite, my head on the pillow was literally 3 feet, 36 inches from the toilet bowl. I never saw a set-up like this. The bathroom had no exhaust fan, and was very cramped; very unappealing. Our suites were directly across from a building being renovated. we weren't warned, and could not change our rooms. The noise started at 7 AM. By this time, I was dreading any more confrontations with the desk woman, so my wife convinced me to just "put up with it". We travel, 8-10 times ayear, and i have never been treated so poorly. This hotel would be "okay", if it were not for the attitude of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “This is the place to stay in Toronto!!”
Reviews.Author: aebcpama
Reviews.Content: We stayed from Sunday to Friday and toured the city each day. Suite was large, comfortable and clean. Location was in the center of the city with easy walking access to everything. Desk personnel were very knowedgable and helpful with good restaurants, day trips, etc. Entire hotel staff was great including maintenance and housekeeping. Suite was equipped with a microwave, refrig, sink, two flat screen tvs. large bathroom vanity/sink, table and chairs and plenty of room to move around. Morning breakfast served on the second floor was OK but the in room coffee was the best. Fruit cereal, muffins/pastry was available each day without cost. Parking was on site for $22/day +tax. We never touched the car for the week. Washer/ dryer was accessable near the elevator. Exercise room/hot tub was on the top floor with great views of the city. We were very pleased withour stay here, staff was superb, room was excellent!! We were directed to many places that we may not have found on our own. The George Brown University student-run restaurant was fun and very good. Several recommended restaurants were excellent and reasonably priced. We will definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Room, Great Location, Good Price”
Reviews.Author: lifterguy
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Cambridge Suite by car on a Friday afternoon. The directions were excellent, but there was no place in front of the hotel designated for guest parking while checking in (only taxi & limo parking), so we left the car in a no parking area and checked in quickly, getting instructions for parking in the hotel garage. The rest of our week's stay was very pleasant. The deluxe suite was one of the quietest hotel rooms I've ever stayed in, and very spacious for such an affordable room in a downtown hotel. The room was a true suite, with a separate bedroom and living area. There was a wet bar with microwave and fridge, and the room had it's own thermostat. The temperature was very comfortable. The king bed was unusually firm and creeked a bit, but the bedding was clean and in good condition, and we slept well. We paid extra for internet access, and were only able to use one of our two laptops, but the wireless connection was fast and reliable. The room also had hardwired ethernet (we had to choose one or the other when signing up for access.) Furnishings seemed fairly new, with two flat panel TVs. New lamps were placed in the room during our stay. The fitness room is very limited, but better than nothing. The hotel does offer free access to a nearby health club - although finding the club on the sub-basement level of a nearby office building proved to be a challenge. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful and checkout was fast and easy. There were no unexpected charges on my bill. The room was booked through Hotels-dot-com and was very affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean”
Reviews.Author: Buccos1
Reviews.Content: We were in Toronto for a few days and stayed at the Cambridge Suites for the first time. We arrived at the hotel very late and check in went relatively smooth, with a few minor obstacles. One, mainly, the room was booked on the hotel website, which included the parking charge on the invoice, but the front desk clerk had no idea about the parking (being selected on the website) which delayed us some. We stayed in one of the upper-level suites which was very nice. The room is split and very spacious. There is a nice table with four chairs overlooking some of the adjacent buildings. The couch is next to the tables and bar and right near the tv. There are two 32" flat screen TVs that are a step above the competition. Each came with a DVD player, though we didn't use it. The bedroom is spacious and the bed is a little on the hard side but sitll comfortable. The bathroom is broken into sections with a very large counter and the tub/toilet in another room. The vanity part is carpeted and you are given a ton of complementary toiletries. There are several Aveda products (cleaner, shampoo...) that are provided. The shower/toilet area is much smaller in relation to the rest of the room layout. There was ample closet space and a digital safe was provided. If you plan on workiing out, you will not be able to do much in the hotel fitness area. Dumbells up to 35 pounds and an oddly shaped flat bench are included. There are a couple of treadmills, a bike and an elipitical machine. There are other gyms within close walking distance though. The hot tub and sauna are excellent. The hot tub is the appropriate temerature and the jets are nice. The sauna did it's job. We frequented the hot tub several times throughout the day and it was only croweded once. Our stay was excellent and we were very pleased with the location, quality of the room and many of the extras provided (in the room). This was definitely one of the top hotels I have stayed at in a downtown location.

Reviews.Title: “Very disapponting breakfast”
Reviews.Author: annikenNorway
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Cambridge suites for 2 nights in June 09. The hotell is easy to find and the area is very quiet. It is very vlose to Younge street. The satff is nice and we could check in and got our romm at 10 a.m. The room was big and nice. The big disappointment is the breakfast. We were actually very hungr. We werw expecting a good breakfast because the hotell was nice. The breakfast was very, very poor...in fact I have never before got this lousy breakfast ...The hotell sholud not have breakfast if this is what they can provide...We were joiking a lot of it and we went out to Tim Horton after brekafast. I would not stay here again because I think breakfast is importent... Sorry.... But it doesn t help with free chocolate and water...

Reviews.Title: “A new home away from home”
Reviews.Author: rfmoon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel June 26-28 2009 in room 1017. I was a bit concerned about being next to the elevator, but it turned out to be no problem. We did not go to the in-house restaurant during our stay. When I booked our deluxe suite I had told the staff it was my husband's birthday. Ten minutes after check-in a bottle of chilled champagne and glasses were delivered to our door, with a happy birthday card for him. The room was absolutely perfect and totally spotless in spite of its being a smoking room. Since the living room/dinette area is closed off from the bedroom and the sink/wardrobe area is separate from the tub/shower/toilet room I has able to sleep in while hubby watched TV in the morning and we were able to go about our "grooming" without stepping on each other's toes. We had a very nice view all the way to the lake from the 17th floor. I appreciated being able to open a portion of the window to let some air in, having the extra pillows and comforter, as well as the ironing board, iron, hairdrier, "kitchenette" with sink, "real" glasses, dishes and silverware and a small refrigerator which we put to good use after buying treats at St. Lawrence's market. The staff was quite prompt in providing extra coffee packets when we asked. The only downside was that the cleaning staff did not get to our room until 5:30 PM on saturday, by which time I was in the bathtub and was not about to let them in. The location is perfect for going to Eaton Centre as well as St. Lawrence Market and Nathan Phillips Square. It is also just a block away from the subway and the trolley line. A 15 minute walk will take you to the harbor. Parking is indoor and quite secure but does cost $24/day canadian/day If you don't mind leaving your car outdoors, there are a couple of parking lots basically across the street from the Hotel which are cheaper. Deluxe rooms do not "come" with free internet service (CAD 11 for 24 hours, so we hooked up at 9:30 PM Friday and had it all day Saturday) or a free breakfast (lots of inexpensive places around). Frankly I do not believe these features areare worth paying for the room upgrade. Overall we have gone to Toronto 4 times, and this is the best Hotel we stayed in. We will certainly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: MaxPsdn
Reviews.Content: I stayed 5 nites. Htl has excellent location near Eaton. Cheap taxis take u anywhere in yhe city within few mins and dollars. Suites very clean and spacious with 2 flat tv-screens. Hint: breakfast is actually not included, but it is ;) I asked from reception, if I can take out cup of coffee and this was OK. When I asked the price of breakfast, there was none. I think they donÂ´t want to promote it, becauset the bf-room is so small, so if everybody would come there, it would be chaos...

Reviews.Title: “Great value and service, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: travelLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: I recently visited Toronto, and stayed at this hotel which offered great service and lovely accomodations. I especially appreciated the Concierge service--Jennifer Z. shared great info about getting about town and making my next travel connection. The room was spacious, clean and very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal”
Reviews.Author: GMforever
Reviews.Content: I spent a very pleasant night at the Cambridge Suites. I was attending a convention in Toronto, but the hotels provided by the meeting organizers very too pricey for a single lady. Thanks again to Tripadvisor ( dont travel without it !) , I had a large king bed, a separate lounge, 2 plasma TVs , free wireless Internet, Continental breakfast, a large bathroom with all the trimmings at a very competitive price. The bed was very comfy I had also a gorgeous view of Toronto ( therefore the name Cityscape suite) on a quiet street, downtown Toronto ( It does exist !) The hotel is steps from the Queen Tube Station and behind the Bay I did not try the fitness or the restaurant. The Continental breakfast was very basic so I ended up eating another one at a well known coffee chain at the Tube You can print your boarding passes for Pearson Airport from a kiosk in the lobby ( but not for the Toronto Island Airport) I would go back for sure

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Hotel Stay”
Reviews.Author: jtstargirl
Reviews.Content: Pros: I was able to find a great deal for a suite with a king-size bed (it was the same price as most of the 2-star hotels). Some of the chairs and the couch were a bit worn but everything was very clean. The 2 flat-panel TVs were great too. It was nice having a bar with a separate sink, real dishes, mini-fridge and microwave! The bed was very comfortable and it was so nice relaxing and we had a decent view of downtown from our room. The fitness room is a great added feature and has a fantastic view of the city. I didn't get a chance to use any equipment (a few treadmills, pilates ball, hand weights) but everything looked well-maintained. There is also a hot-tub in the fitness area but it was always occupied. Location is absolutely fantastic - we were right next to Eaton Centre & Yonge Street and very close to the great Queen St. West neighborhood. Cons: The only thing a little lacking was the service. My boyfriend and I are in our 20s and we look young and it didn't seem like we got the same kind of friendliness as a business person would. They did provide us with a map of Toronto when we asked, and were helpful at giving us directions for specific places. Another little nit-picky thing was that the ice bucket was dirty and it was difficult finding the ice machine which is inside the fitness area on the top floor. Lastly, the parking charge was $22 which was added to our bill, so just be aware.

Reviews.Title: “Everything I wanted”
Reviews.Author: DallasGal43
Reviews.Content: Since I smoke, I wanted a smoking room and many hotels are totally smoke free. I lIke to read and it was important to have a comfortable chair and good lamp for reading. With two rooms, I could read late at night when my husband was asleep in the other room. Located right downtown close to shopping was so convenient for me when my husband went to his conference at another hotel. Enjoyed the large screen TV and watched a movie I had wanted to see. Coffee in room for husband was important to him as was the newspaper. Ate a good meal at the restaurant. Best place for us in a long while. You might want to check the small leak under the sink in room 1711 before it gets too bad. Thanks for a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for families”
Reviews.Author: PineTreeOhio
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a cityscape room for three days and it was wonderful. The bedroom had a king size bed, and there was ample room for a pack 'n play or a peapod plus travel kids tent beside the bed. The bathroom had both a shower and a tub. The living room was large as well, with a microwave, bar fridge and plates/bowls/cups/cutlery. A previous poster said there was a glass window on the sliding door between the bedroom and the living room, our room did not have a window on the door, and while it was a sliding door it was pretty good at keeping things quiet. Also, a previous poster mentioned swimming, there is no pool although there is a hot tub in the fitness area. The location is wonderful - the Ivory Thailand restaurant around the corner has great Thai food. It's easy walking distance to lots of attractions including the ferry for Centre Island (great for kids) and even the CN Tower. I found a great deal on the hotel website and would definitely stay here again. Our rate included free wifi and continental breakfast (cereal, toast, muffins, pastries and assorted juices/tea/coffee)

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel - luxury at a budget price”
Reviews.Author: CartwrightOxfordUK
