Reviews.Content: We got an amazing deal on this hotel and having stayed several years ago I was dismayed to read some negative comments about it being "tired" and "shabby" - it was still fabulous. Amazing location and so much more than your usual hotel room - it feels like a one bed apartment - incredibly well equipped and comfortable. The roof top jacuzzi while the sun sets rates as one of the more romantic experiences of my life!!! Really comfortable for a weeks stay and amazing value.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, lots of space”
Reviews.Author: Beancounter4
Reviews.Content: I stayed overnight for business so did not really need all the space that I had. However, I would definitely return again for business or with my family. The layout of the room is very nice with a separate bedroom and then a sitting room/desk/kitchenette. The bathroom can be accessed from the bedroom or the entrance hall. Check in was quick and courteous, great location for access to downtown, parking was underground in the next building but very convenient. Although it is right downtown, the rooms were quiet and the intersection it is at is not they typical downtown Toronto busy street.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: owensoundmother
Reviews.Content: Thank you for our pleasant stay on June 6th. The staff was very friendly and helpful

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel in perfect location-you wont be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: europeangirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 5 nights with my boyfriend.We got a really good deal online,if you stay for 5 nights you get 50% off the price of the entire stay!this worked out at 400EUR instead of 800EUR which was fantastic. Firstly the location is fantastic,on yonge&richmond st two blocks fro dundas sq,1 block from the eaton centre...just great! We were so impressed with the hotel,the hotel is laid out in suites,there is a large bedroom with a kingsize comfy bed and large TV with a desk and chair..the room has a double door opening onto the living room area with a couch and chairs with a huge TV. The bathroom is large with a power shower,plenty of towels. There is separate room just outside the bathroom with the sink and a huge dressing table,loads of storage and the closet. The whole flow of the space works well. The mini-bar is fully stocked and there is a kitchenette with microwave,fridge,sink plus plates/glasses etc. Fast wireless internet available also, it is pricey at 11.99 a day...but thats the only slighty negative point. The whole hotel was spotless, the staff were extremely helpful with any queries/tour suggestions etc. We never ate at the restaurant in the hotel,but it looked good if a little pricey.I would highly recommend this hotel, it really made our stay in Toronto perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Right hotel in right location”
Reviews.Author: saktunes
Reviews.Content: This is our third time staying at the Cambridge Suites since 1996. The hotel continues to be just the right place for us. The two-room suite is a good size for two adults and one or two children. The staff is friendly and attentive. (We had our bathroom light go out and they came to fix it within 5 minutes...at 10:00 PM!) And the location is among the best in Toronto. In fact, this stay it rained quite a bit, but one can go from the hotel to many places in TO underground, so we stayed fairly dry. (OK, Chinatown was a problem.) Parking on-site with in-and-out privileges is a big plus. Our room appears to have been updated recently and it is in very good condition. The bed is the most comfortable bed I have ever had in a hotel (or at home), hands down! Two minor complaints: The continental breakfast is nothing special. The coffee is good, but the breads are ordinary, as is the selection of fruits. The other problem is the wireless Internet service. It goes out fairly often. However, these two minor items will not keep us from staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location. Highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: Steve3681
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights as a long weekend away. The room was perfect - enough space to stretch out and relax, big bedroom with a very comfortable king bed, nice split bathroom with vanity in one room and the bath/toilet in the other. 2 large flat screen TVs with 50+ channels in the room, high speed internet available. On site parking (nominal daily charge with no in-out limits). RIght in the center of downtown - 2 blocks from Eaton Center, 5 minute walk from the Winter Garden or Elgin Theatres, easy access to cabs, and easy to get to via car (off Yonge Street). Would highly recommend to anyone looking for a place in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable suite, would return.”
Reviews.Author: archibalda
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with value for money although the level of housekeeping dropped a bit over the Easter holiday period.

Reviews.Title: “Toronto Is a Great City. This is an Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Buccos
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our 16 year old and 11 year old daughters. We like to have a door in between us and our kids so we can relax and love each other. The "door" was the primary reason we chose this hotel. Imagine our surprise when we entered our room and found that the door had multiple glass panes. What the heck were the room designers thinking?? We requested extra sheets to cover the door, but it was bizarre for us and our kids. We like to treat ourselves to room service when we travel. Our kids expect it. We expect it. The room service menu is incredibly inadequate. Embarassing actually. We upgraded so that we could get free breakfasts, but no one checked room numbers on the second floor. We wasted our money. If you stay here, know that free breakfasts are available on the second floor. Free internet in the business center? NO! Incredible. Actually stunning by today's standards. The location of the hotel is great. We love Toronto. This hotel is over-rated.

Reviews.Title: “Not what it makes out to be”
Reviews.Author: the4ofusBucks
Reviews.Content: Whilst the hotel staff were very helpfull and friendly (as one would expect), the suite that we had was no larger than some of the standard hotel rooms that we have stayed in, the only difference being the inclusion of sliding doors to seperate the bouble bed from the sofa bed. The suite looked and felt tired and, as a probable result of renovations, was constanly full of thick dust. The hotel website indicated that the room was serviced twice daily. In practice this was once for cleaning and once for the mini-bar. In addition they had a "turn-down" service in the evenings. The suite was stuffy and the aircon noisy and the small window would not open. As we had a "cityscape" suite (albeit without a view of the city) we were entitled to the complimentary continental buffet breakfast. I'm not sure which continent they were eluding to but it was certainly none that i have been to. The selection was extremely poor, cereal; toast or stale pastries with a choice of hot drink or juice. There was insufficient cutlery on most mornings and the room was far too small for the number of guests and on 2 occasions we had to return later, towards the end of service in order to get a table for 4. Although the hotel was in a convenient location, we've had better quality and value for money from Holiday Inn Express and Premier Inns.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: chocolatetwistcone
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here on our way back from Costa Rica to Winnipeg. I had found a great deal on Expedia an paid almost 1/2 for a deluxe room. The location was perfect, right on the PATH so that we could walk underground to Eaton Centre and shop ( it was Feburary, thus quite cold). The room was fantastic, huge, with 2 TV's so no fighting over the remote. Very clean rooms with a separate bathroom and Makeup area, Living room, and Bedroom with a very comfy HUGE bed, and glass doors separating the bedroom and living room areas so that they could be separately temp contolled. the minibar was well stocked, we got a paper every morning, it was perfect. We didnt take advantage of the breakfast at the hotel, opting to eat as we were wandering the downtown. I would highly recommend this place again, the front desk staff were totally professional and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Great location in the GTA”
Reviews.Author: bosox1010
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay at the Cambridge Suites. I was there visiting a friend and to experience the downtown Toronto life. It is located very close to the Queen TTC subway stop going north-south and just as close to the street cars going east-west. A subway stop or short cab ride to all the restaurants, nightlife you could possibly imagine. The hotel room layout is very cool. Shaped in an L the bedroom and living area are seperated by french doors. To my delight there is a 36 inch flatscreen in each room...Yay!!! One thing that turned me off a bit was that the tub definitely needed to be recaulked and possibly had potential for mould. But with my very reasonable room rate the hotel does like to nickel and dime a bit. There is a $20 per day parking charge for underground parking and wireless internet is also at an extra charge. I ate two meals at the downstairs restaurant Portico, the service and draft beer were very good and the food was decent but maybe a little over priced. Overall though this was a very good stay and I would definitely stay there again along with recommending it to anyone that is going there.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, large room did it for me”
Reviews.Author: Monkeyo
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Cambridge Suites for 5 nights with my boyfriend and could not have had a better time. The rooms are massive - a large bedroom, living room area with dining room table, medium sized bathroom and mirror/dressing area. The rooms were clean and the bed was huge - the only problem we had all week was when we tried to order a movie and the connection was down. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, it is close enough to all the main sites, the staff were friendly - we could not have asked for a better hotel. My boyfriend goes abroad a lot on business and even he was impressed. Big thumbs up!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: met101
Reviews.Content: The front desk personell I dealt with was very friendly. The room was clean and the layout was fantastic. You could have privacy in the bedroom and in the room set up with a big mirror and sink for getting ready. The washroom and shower are in another room. The two tv's can be seperated with pocket doors so the noise from each does not interfere with the other. It has a microwave and fridge. Great little seating area. Comfortable pull out couch. Quiet. The best thing was probably location. On the closest corner there is a Tim Hortons, Sunset Grill (great breakfast). It is a block from the Eaton's Centre and a few blocks from your choice of 3 very nice pubs. We really enjoyed our stay and would love to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Below expectations”
Reviews.Author: ethan1171
Reviews.Content: After seeing the reviews for this property I had high expectations, especially since I paid extra for the CityScape upgrade. I stayed at the Cambridge suites for a week together with another 9 colleagues from work, all of us had different rooms, different sections of the hotel but we reached the same decision: next time we are staying elsewhere. Although the receptionists were great and helpful the main problems were: 1. Dirty carpets, worn down furniture, doors with smudges showing their age etc. The room looked more like a motel, low quality 2. We had out luggage stored and when we needed to recover them before heading to the airport we had to wait for 30 min since the luggage guy was not available 3. One of my colleagues had a problem with her window not closing properly and had the heater running all night long 4. Continental breakfast seemed to have been free for all although it is advertised as part of the Cityscape rate. My colleagues on the cheaper rate got the same breakfast as I did, even though that was one of the reasons i upgraded 5. Internet at a cost of 12/night! The pros: Rooms were of good size with flat screen TVs, comfortable beds, and some goodies for turndown, cheap rate at expedia.... Next week we decided to stay at the Hilton, some of my coworkers stayed there last week, and they said that it was much better than Cambridge suites. I am starting to seriously doubt whether this hotel deserves to be rating so high of all the places to stay in Toronto. Be aware

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: mizlori
Reviews.Content: Cambridge Suites Toronto was a great find. Location is perfect for exploring the Yonge Street/Eaton Centre area; we walked to St. Lawrence market, even to Second City! Each suite is a slightly different layout. Nice little living room area with couch, some have a dining table. Dressing area separate from bathroom and bedroom. Microwave and decent sized-mini fridge. Nicely maintained. Was a bit strange how one switch worked the dressing/bathroom lights. What I didn't like was the air vent that blows directly onto the bed. You can redirect the vents but you still feel the air blowing. First parking deck in Toronto I've seen that has spaces your car actually fits in without being too close to the car next to you. We didn't get the breakfast package and went to Tim Horton's instead. LOVE their breakfast sandwiches! Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at the Cambridge Suites”
Reviews.Author: Bobkitten74
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week at this hotel. I checked the hotel on Expedia who had a great offer, I then contacted the hotel and luckily enough they offered to match the rate, so I did not have to pay in advance. The suite was very nice. Maybe a bit small after we had just stayed in a huge suite at Le Square Phillips in Montreal. This felt more cramped, there were a lot of furniture in little space. We decided to have the two french doors to the bedroom open at all time, then the livingroom felt a bit bigger. The staff is amazing. The concierge was really very helpful and he took good time to suggest what would be good to see and to help us book a tour to Niagara Falls. The housekeeping was great as well. You would get many visits if you stayed home during the evening. One evening we were very tired and went to our room early. We got a visit by a man who should fill the minibar, a women with cookies and popcorn, and a women with water, evening chocolates and a card over the weather tomorrow. That was funny and all the staff were so sweet and friendly. We did not eat at the hotel. There were plenty of great restaurants in the area and a huge food court at the Eaton Center just some minutes away. Toronto is a wonderful city. Try to make time to eat at the CN Tower, that was an amazing experience. Also a visit to Toronto Island and ofcourse a trip to Niagara Falls.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Experience!”
Reviews.Author: staro88
Reviews.Content: we were not happy with the hotel. The rooms were plain and outdated. Our room wasn't even cleaned the first day and when it was the job was done very badly. The selection at breakfast was poor and the restaurant was closed for the first two days of our stay. Good location though and friendly staff!

Reviews.Title: “Close to shopping, large rooms”
Reviews.Author: lpoel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Cambridge Suites on business for 2 weeks. The location was excellent for shopping, restaurants and entertainment. Get convenience items before you arrive because not much close by after business hours. I really liked the set up of the suites with a walk in dressing area and separate sitting room with a large LCD TV (one in the bedroom area as well). Internet was expensive and not wireless. Elevators were extremely slow so I switched to a room on a lower floor about half way through my stay. Continental breakfast was as you would expect, toast, pastries, cereal, fruit, pretty standard. Overall I would stay here again since the main things I consider are the rooms and the customer service and both of those were excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: AliandMin
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a deluxe suite at the Cambridge Suites Hotel 28-31 December 08 at a rate of approximately Â£70 per night. Although the decor, fixtures and fittings aren't to the standards of a flash new hotel, we thought the extras that were included more than made up for this. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful throughout. The suite was made up of a lounge/kitchen area with a desk, bedroom, dressing room and bathroom (with bath and shower). The kitchen had a microwave, full size fridge, mini bar, coffee maker and various utensils and items of crockery. The bathroom contained complimentary Aveda products and a powerful hairdryer, an iron and ironing board. In the lounge and bedroom were two huge plasma screens. Wifi was provided at an extremely reasonable rate. The hotel offers a free grocery delivery service and the room service plate fee was far cheaper than most hotels. Each day we were provided with a free newspaper. The 'guest services' book in each room was extremely helpful and although the hotel had a bar and restaurant (which we didn't get chance to use but they looked inviting), they allow local restaurants to deliver, ie pizzas, etc. There is also a boarding pass printing service in reception. The location is just off Yonge Street, the main street going through Toronto, and extremely close to the Eaton Centre, which is a massive shopping mall with fast food restaurants. It is a 20 minute walk to the theatres and a bit further on to the CN Tower. The hotel also scores well with their green credentials by allowing guests to elect not to have bedding and towels changed every day. I'm sure I've forgotten something but all in all, a really pleasant stay in a comfortable, friendly hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet Suites at Cambridge”
Reviews.Author: caribartTT
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for an economical downtown hotel in Toronto that affords lots of space in their suites and is conveniently located to EVERYTHING then CAMBRIDGE SUITES is the place. I am a repeat guest here and usually stay at trendy boutique hotels when I travel. Although Cambridge is not that, it certainly is sufficient. The staff are friendly, the suites are spacious, the rate was competitive and the location is right on Yonge and Richmond Street. Church St is two short blocks to the East, Queen Street one block North, King Street 2 blocks South and right at Yonge Street. THE PATH leads you right into THE BAY & EATON CENTER. The beds are comfortable and suites have two flat screen tvs. Double doors to bedroom allow for more spacious feeling in the room. Nearby restaurants worth visiting: OVER EASY for Breakfast on Yonge, just below King. Colborne Lane, Spledido, Nota Bene, Rain were all awesome dining experiences and Spring Roll just two short blocks East of the hotel on Church has ecomiical Asian food. So, in your search for hotels in downtown Toronto, consider Cambridge. I love it and am sure you would too. Not pretentious, great space and value for your buck. Enjoy your Sweet stay.

Reviews.Title: “Used to love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Paul045
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Cambridge Suites several times over the years. We loved the rooms and service but our last visit in December was a major disappointment. When we arrived early, shortly before 3 we were told our room wasn't ready which wasn't a problem as we had shopping to do. We returned about an hour and a half later and the room still wasn't ready and they couldn't give us an estimate. We had a Christmas party to attend and they offered to downgrade our room. We opted to wait and return about an hour later and our room was finally ready. No apologies for the delay or explanation. We quickly learned that they no longer offered the complimentary in-room continental breakfast but were offered the continental breakfast on the second floor for an additional $10 each. Don't even go - poor selection and quality. The Sunset Grill on the corner offers better food and selection at a better price. Our room was as nice as we remember and no complaints. After we returned home we received a survey to complete. We outlined our complaints about the delays getting our room. The manager replied and explained that the delay was caused by an increase in requests for late checkouts. Considering we were returning guests who have recommended this hotel to all of our friends when they are in Toronto, we found the service and manager's reply quite disappointing. Unfortunately we won't be returning to this hotel again or recommend it to our friends. There are alot of nice hotels in Toronto and this is no longer one of them.

Reviews.Title: “A Place To Remember”
Reviews.Author: whis08
Reviews.Content: A place where you can go and receive outstanding service. A warm and friendly staff will greet you and take care of every need that you may have. From the minute you walk in to the moment you leave, the entire staff is there to serve you. The rooms are clean and very spacious. The fitness room is well equiped and well maintained. A safe and quiet hotel where you can take your family, have a business meeting, or even a wedding and every detail will be complete. We have been to Toronto every year for the past 5 years and this is by far the best in or around the town. A place you could call "HOME".

Reviews.Title: “Find Another Place”
Reviews.Author: CharlieCrist
Reviews.Content: Find another place. Trust me FIND ANOTHER PLACE. Loud and no frills. This a place aimed at losers on a per diem who aren't smart enough to shop ( I was one). Buy internet from the local provider for a fraction of what the hotel charges. The only sources for snacks, sodas, or water are the mini-bar or across the street before the 7/11 closes. FIND ANOTHER PLACE.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel experience, except”
Reviews.Author: PhilipOwenSound
Reviews.Content: This has been our favourite Toronto hotel for years - excellent location, friendly staff, very clean, superb restaurant, nicely furnished. But they charge $9.95 per day for Internet access & even charge for Internet access in their business centre. This in so out-of-date. We noticed too that there were no complimentary bathrobes in the room this time & the beds were not turned down in the evenings. I do hope the hotel is not going down-market.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and large rooms”
Reviews.Author: Jetlagger4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in mid-december and were pleasently surprised. The location is perfect (2 min to the huge Eaton Shopping Center, nice restaurants around) and the staff was always very helpful and friendly. Our suite was really nice, 2 rooms and 2 flatscreen tv, everything clean and tidy. The furnishment was new and comfortable, at night quiet in the 11th floor (minor street noise). The helpful consierge Michael organized for us tickets for a concert and theatre, even for the same evening. Internet for $ 9.95 for 24h, wireless or cable. We would really recommend this hotel and would like to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Downtown Choice”
Reviews.Author: MobileResident
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights at Cambridge Suites earlier this month. I had only positive experiences. I booked a City Scape Suite on the hotel web site which put me on a higher floor with complimentary continental breakfast and unlimited Internet usage in the Business Centre. The hotel is conveniently located with easy access to the Queen subway stop. I had a nice dining experience at the Portico restaurant in the late evening on my arrival date. The suite was quiet and very well appointed. Housekeeping came twice daily and the bed was very comfortable. The staff were friendly and helpful. I had no problems with delays in the elevators that others have reported. This is an ideal choice(reasonable price, well maintained modern facility with helpful, friendly staff) in downtown that is within easy walking distances to St. Lawrence Market, Air Canada Centre, Hockey Hall of Fame and the AGO.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Cheerful!”
Reviews.Author: Britannic
Reviews.Content: Located just off Torontos main street Yonge,this hotel is a good option for cheap and cheerful travel in the GTA. Large suites with kitchenette,big bedrooms and lounge area. Helpful staff and good food at the Portico restaurant off the lobby. Torontos a mish-mash of a city with a certainly varied set of neighbourhoods from the good in Yorkville to the rather suspect in Kensington,either way the Cambridge Suites are a great base to centre yourself.

Reviews.Title: “A great experience”
Reviews.Author: bumblebee10
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the weekend of December 12-14. We booked a King Bed Suite and we were very satisfied with everything about the trip. There is a parking garage with an elevator that leads directly to the lobby. We parked very close to the elevator, and always felt safe while inside. Parking is $20 per night, but the nice thing is, that on the day of your checkout, you can stay parked there until 6pm that day. That meant we could go shopping all day, then go to the car and depart. Check in was a breeze, and we were given a suite on a lower floor. My kid enjoyed the view from the window of the cars and people going by. Two big TV's and a seperate sleeping area made it nice to put the baby to sleep and then watch TV in the living area. There are several fast food places really close by, Tim Hortons, Subway is across the street, McDonalds around the corner, KFC/Taco Bell next to Tim Hortons. The Eaton Center is a very short walk. We walked there on the outside, and returned via the PATH which is completely underground, saving us the bitter cold walk back. The prices for room service seemed pretty high $17 for a tuna sandwich plus tax, gratuity and service charge, I'd expect the entire fish to arrive. We ate from local places instead. Contrary to other reviews, I found the wait for the elevators wasn't long at all. Maybe it was the fact we were on a lower floor, but we didn't wait long at all when we used them. Nice also was checkout was 1pm giving us time to relax, and pack at our pace. Really enjoyed the convenience of the coffee maker, fridge and microwave. We used them alot during our stay, and my kid enjoyed the popcorn (Orville Redenbacher, not some no name popcorn, nice touch!) All in all, we would definately stay here again, and the rates were very competitive to other hotels in the area, you really do get a lot of space for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Cambridge Suites”
Reviews.Author: Mat_McAdams
Reviews.Content: I booked two deluxe suites for me and my parents. Both rooms were of a good standard although the layouts were slightly different. The rooms were very good value for money, and are similar to a european four star. Comfortable beds (quite hard), all appliances worked fine, and the complimentary popcorn helped keep my jet lag at bay!! One of the few downsides was that the lifts were dreadfully slow, and I seemed to spend a good five minutes waiting for them each time. The staff were all very friendly and accommodating. The bar was small but worked well, even if the prices were a little steep. The hotel is ideally located for sightseeing/shopping etc., and I recommend the Sunset Grill diner next door for breakfast - good value and great coffee. All in all I will definitely stay here again when I next visit Toronto with my family.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: tmccaleb
Reviews.Content: Spent Labor Day weekend at Cambridge Suites in Toronto. Decent but not spectacular price, but an excellent accommodation. The location was convenient for everything we wanted to do in downtown Toronto. We were able to walk everywhere, even though the wife had a broken foot in an immobilizing boot (but she's a trooper). We liked the extra room provided by a small suite. It was clean, comfortable, and quiet. Parking was on-site. We did not use public transport, but it was nearby. There was also an excellent and inexpensive breakfast restaurant across the street in the next block.

Reviews.Title: “It was nice, But”
Reviews.Author: M00se1111
Reviews.Content: I booked my stay and was pleased with the location. It's right in downtown Toronto, close to the Eaton Centre. I arrived very early due to my flight and my room wasn't ready. That's ok. It was the day after American Thanksgiving and a huge holiday weekend. So I went out shopping and visited the Tim Horton's close by. I returned a few hours later and sat in the lobby. My room still wasn't ready, but I was too exhausted to go walking more. A couple came in just checked in and got thier room right away. I was confused and told " Oh they have a different type of room". When I wanted to check in, I said " Please, just a room, I'm exhausted". I got a room within 30 minutes of this and the room was ok. Note to self, check BOTH tv's when you get into the room. The 2nd tv didn't work. The room was nicely sized and a good price, especially with the exchange rate being what it was. My room was right next to the elevator, but I really couldn't hear that. What I did here were men working in the hallway outside my room while I was trying to nap. The privacy please tag was on my door. The Internet was loky. I had to call three times to have the situation taken care of. The in room coffee maker didn't work. Which again, no big deal since there's Tim Horton's across the street. But still its the point. I found the front desk clerks condescending, especially when I asked about the airline check in. If you're looking for a centrally located hotel, this is ok. But there's a few other hotels up Yonge Street and off Carleton I plan on checking out when I come back.

Reviews.Title: “The Best of Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Imagine290
Reviews.Content: After a great deal of research, my family and I decided to stay at the Cambridge Suites hotel and loved every minute. The hotel's location is central to everything downtown including: shopping, restaurants, tourist attractions and the underground. We felt very safe walking around at all times of the day and the room was clean and spacious. The restaurant downstairs is very good, but I would not recommend the hamburger when ordering room service. The staff is very friendly and knowledgable. The main selling points of the hotel are the large suite and the location. Keep in mind that the suites need a little rehab, (new faucets, carpet and a more comfortable bed, I actually liked the bed but my parents thought it was a bit too firm) however, nothing that would deter me from staying here. I am pretty picky about where I stay and this hotel passed the test. I would definitely recommend to anyone who wants a nice, quiet room at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for extra special hotel”
Reviews.Author: subzeror
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading reviews on this site, plus the hotel's own website and we weren't disappointed. Right from the off the service was excellent - we emailed the hotel directly to book and found the staff to be helpful and very happy to meet any extra requests we had so we had high expectations for our stay. We had one of the rooms with two double beds and it was a very good size, spotlessly clean and fitted out with two 42" flat screen tvs, one in the bedroom, one in the living room area. The rooms also have a small kitchen area with a microwave, sink and coffee-maker. The decor is elegant, although maybe a little tired but overall in very good condition. The bathroom was a good size, with a separate toilet and shower/bath area to the vanity area which was large and included a hairdryer, closet, iron and ironing board and lush aveda products to use. It was the little touches that made the difference though - the complementary robes, the chocolate on the pillow in the evening, complementary bottled water each day and free popcorn and cookies in the kitchen area. Oh and the beds were the comfiest I've ever had at a hotel! The service at the hotel really is excellent, the staff are friendly, helpful and knowledgeable about the area. We had a problem because one of us had lost the key to the padlock on the suitcase - reception arranged for the caretaker to come up within less than 5 mins. This doesn't sound like much, but how often do these problems get sorted so quickly? Because it's a slightly smaller hotel, they clearly have more time for customer service. The health suite area was small but perfectly pleasant with a beautiful view of the city. The hotel is in a great location, close to Yonge Street and a subway station, and in easy walking distance to most downtown areas, whether CN Tower (10-15 mins), harbour front (15 mins), shopping centre (5 mins) etc. However, because it's slightly off the street, it's quiet and we didn't have any bother from traffic noise. There's also a great breakfast restaurant just around the corner - very cheap, very tasty and we found it very handy. If you're used to 5* luxury accommodation then this probably won't meet your full expectations, but we found the price we paid to be excellent value for such a good quality hotel - fantastic service, great size rooms with extra special touches in the perfect location to visit downtown Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like home”
Reviews.Author: Kahlan18
Reviews.Content: The service made staying at this hotel a good experience. However, I agree with other travellers that this shouldn't be a 4 star hotel. The room was clean and welcoming, but it was the little things that I noticed. When attempting to open a curtain, I found out that the rod wasn't even attached. The decorative piece in the bathroom faucet wasn't attached either, and the toilet had trouble flushing down toilet paper. However, the bed and pillows were incredibly comfortable. The televisions (2!) were large flatscreens. There was a large counter space in the dressing room which allowed me to spread out my makeup when getting ready to go out. The curtains blocked out light completely. I also have to note though, that it was not soundproof. Other occupants starting showers in other rooms woke me up while sleeping due to the loud noises. We could hear televisions and laughter through the walls and ceiling. The noise from outside wasn't incredibly loud though, despite only being a few floors up and directly above the entrance. I can't say enough about the staff, though. They were incredibly helpful and welcoming, and always smiling. It made me relax as soon as I stepped through the door. It's the staff that made this an above-average stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice little lobby bar”
Reviews.Author: seblong
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business Rooms: Really good size. En-suite bathroom and small living room (can easily fit a friend on the couch!). Not the most modern of styles, however, size is really good. Service: Decent - as you would expect really. Food: Ate a couple of times at restaurant. Decent, but nothing to write home about. Lobby bar is fairly intimate and worth a drink. Breakfast was average. Location: Good - within walking distance to all the main downtown offices and the shopping centers. Facilities: Wifi in the rooms I think. Didn't use gym, etc...

Reviews.Title: “recommended without reservation”
Reviews.Author: robinpa
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Cambridge Suites for a conference downtown and was pleasantly surprised. I found it to be clean, spacious, and the service was quite friendly/helpful. Also, the room (19th floor) was EXTREMELY quiet. I never heard any noise from the hallway or adjacent rooms, nor did I hear any from the street below. The beds are quite comfortable as well. The mattress seemed to be higher in quality and firmer than typical hotel mattresses. I really recommend this hotel highly. I'm used to staying in the Ritz and Four Seasons chains and am a bit fussy about hotels, but I really have no faults I could point out with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great find”
Reviews.Author: AymanN
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel through trip advisor and I have to say it lived up to the hype. Great location downtown, only a couple of blocks from the main shopping area and restaurants. Massive rooms or suites rather. Very comfy beds, large bathrooms and 2 TVs in each suite! Even the kitchenette was cute even though we didn't really use it. There is also a car park there, the charge is around $20 per day. Anyway, highly recommended. Would def stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room & Location”
Reviews.Author: mcn_mi
Reviews.Content: my husband & I spent this past weekend in Toronto & stayed at the Cambridge Suites for 2 nights. it's definitely a good location - on Richmond btwn Yonge & Church..we were able to walk everywhere we went. about a 20 min walk to the Bloor shopping area, 15 mins to the CN tower or entertainment dist. we felt very safe walking around at night after dinner. the staff was extremely nice & helpful. they gave us simple, accurate directions to anywhere we needed & offered great recommendations for restaurants. the conceirge also gave us numerous amazing recommendations for dinner & nightlife. we ate at Terroni and Fuzion - both highly recommended..great environments, delectable cuisine..Fuzion is swanky and offers a menu with the not-so-usual fare. Rex Hotel is great for live jazz. our suite was great -- spacious, clean & comfortable. the bathroom itself is a little snug (does have a huge vanity area) but hopefully you're not in Toronto to spend too much time in the shower, etc. fitness room was mediocre - but it did the job. there's a nice hot tub & sauna for those interested. all in all, would definitely recommend this property & consider staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great sense of occasion, but a tiny bit underwhelming”
Reviews.Author: schmevelyan
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel solely on the reviews on this site. I was not disappointed and we loved the whole suite thing for the price of a ( very good) city hotel room. Pleasant arrival with genuinely friendly staff throughout - a good vibe. The suite was lovely and spotless and great fun if you want to play hide & seek with your partner. The room has a proper suite feel with plenty of complimentaries refreshed regularly. Only criticism of the room is that it looks a teeny-weeny bit dated in comparison to many new hotels - but it didn't spoil our stay. If you think you're going to get proper five star luxury, this place could possibly disappoint, but if you get a deal on a cityscape room as I did (with a few extras & breakfast), this place will compliment your visit to the city and give you a hotel stay to remember.

Reviews.Title: “Fanatastic City”
Reviews.Author: woody159
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Canada where we stayed in the Cambridge suites for 3 nights. The rooms are very clean and comfortable. They are very large although it is a suite so to be expected really. Its location is along the main streets for bars and clubs which are about 10 mins walk from the hotel. There is a massive shopping centre literally around the corner called the eaton centre. There are no real bad points but the rooms do look a little dated and the bathrooms are a little small but nothing to cause any concern. I would recommend this hotel to anyone although it is not a 5 star so go somewhere else if it is luxury you are after. Niagara should definitely be visited from Toronto and is an hour and half drive. There are loads of guided tours from the city or rent a car and drive there (the QEW runs from toronto to Niagara). We also visted Killarney park and camped for 5 days. I would fully recommend visiting one of the parks if you have the time (about 4 to 5 hours from toronto). We chose this over Algonquin park due to recommendations and were not dissappointed. If you would like any more info about the provincial parks or any questions send me a msg and I will try and help if I can.

Reviews.Title: “Warmly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Washo59
Reviews.Content: My wife and 3 teenagers had 2 nights in Toronto and we were very pleased with the Cambridge. The rooms are a good size, its well located, there is easy parking and the staff are helpful. It has a nice bar and smart looking restaurant, although with plenty of local restaurants to choose from we didn't use it. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Itabella
Reviews.Content: Great hotel that is located off the main street, but still in close proximity to shops, restaurants, and the hustle and bustle of town. The hotel really tries to showcase as a first class hotel even though the building is older. The front desk is very friendly and helpful. All the rooms are decked out as suites with a separate living room from the bedroom. Both rooms have flat screen tvs and aveda toiletries. They even have snacks like popcorn, candy, etc for you to choose from. It's part of their snack bar, but definitely different than just the run of the mill hotel. In the evening, they bring up some complimentary cookies and bottled water. It was also our anniversary and they left a box of chocolates to show that they were thinking of us and had a pleasant stay. Their parking garage is one of the cheapest parking prices in the city too. The only downside I could say is that they don't have a pool, the walls can be thin (but with the living room, it blocks out the noise), no breakfast buffet, and sometimes waiting a long time for the elevator. But, this are only minor things.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: OntarioTravelboy
Reviews.Content: I, my wife, and daughter booked the Cambridge Suites while enjoying a two day stay in Toronto. We have stayed in Toronto many times and thought we would try a different stay this time. We thought the Cambridge Suites was excellent. We have stayed before at the Intercontinental, Royal York, Delta, etc and never had too much problems. But in my opinion, Cambridge Suites was by far superior. Generally reasonably priced (for downtown Toronto), great location, and lovely large rooms. If you are travelling with a child the nice thing is that you can plonk your child in the pull-out sofa bed, turn on her own 37" LCD TV, shut the doors to your room, lie out on your king bed and watch your own 37" LCD TV. Ahhh, heaven. Strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Phantomcube
Reviews.Content: A great hotel, with large, clean rooms and attentive staff. Excellent central location made for a really good stay. Would happily recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Indeed”
Reviews.Author: PooksNorthCarolina
Reviews.Content: I'd pretty much agree with all the positive comments from the other reviewers. The hotel doesn't actually look all that wonderful on approaching it, but is one of those places that is much, much nicer inside. Parking is very convenient, right next to the hotel and there is an elevator directly into the hotel from the parking garage. We tried to check in early, but our room was not ready, but the receptionist (who was most charming and professional) said that she would call us when it was ready and that she would 'have a rush put on it'. Past experience in such circumstances made me think that she probably had good intentions, but would forget - but she called an hour and a half before the designated check in time of 4.00pm to inform us our room was infact ready - I was definitely impressed. When we did check in our room was lovely - we had a top floor corner suite with lots of windows and everything was just as other reviewers have described. There was also an invitation to the Manager's Reception that evening (every Wednesday) where free drinks and hot and cold snacks are provided, which was a nice surprise also. Location is excellent too. I had thought that maybe the riverfront area of Toronto might be preferable, but after exploring I think that this location is the best and within pretty easy walking distance of most things. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: grotbags
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights.The hotel is centrally located for the tourist sights and restaurants.The suites are comfortable and well equipped. We had a great time and would thoroughly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The suites are sweet!”
Reviews.Author: SteveInMinn
Reviews.Content: The Cambridge Suites is tough to top. My wife and I just returned from a four-night stay and enjoyed the hotel. The only surprise was that I thought breakfast was included. It was not -- perhaps because we booked through hotels.com and got the room for $168 a night. My advice: Go for the deal, skip the hotel's $20 breakfast, and eat at the place across the street (I forgot its name), which advertises a decent breakfast for $3.99. Or there's a McDonald's a quarter-block away. Or eat in the room (plates and silverware are in the cupboard). My only other complaint was that internet access was $10 a day -- fine if you're traveling on a business expense account (as many of the guests clearly are), but steep for pleasure seekers like us who have gotten used to reading restaurant reviews while traveling, not beforehand. But the suite's layout was perfect -- two new wide-screen TVs, 70 cable channels, beautiful bathroom, comfortable living room area, fridge and microwave (with free popcorn). The king bed was oh so comfortable. The place was super quiet. I used the small gym's free weights every morning after a run. There's a whirlpool and sauna too. And the location is perfect -- not immediately next to anything of interest, but very close to pretty much everything you'd want to see. All in all, an experience somewhere between "above average" and "excellent." We'd stay again and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel for family, great location, wonderful and very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: NorthwestStuffy
Reviews.Content: our trip to toronto was in celebration of our grandson's 13 birthday. when asked if he would like us to take him somewhere his response was yes: canada, toronto to visit the hockey hall of fame. I researched hotels and booked directly with hotel. It was a great hotel for family, great location and wonderful friendly and very helpful staff. highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “You must stay @ Cambridge Suites!”
Reviews.Author: Imago_Bklyn
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel for anyone visiting Toronto. The layout of the rooms are fantastic. There's separate living room space and sleeping space as well as a small kitchenette featuring a sink, two fridges [one is the mini-bar] and a microwave. There were some complimentary treats like water, candy, and microwave popcorn to greet us. The thing I loved was the room layout. The sleeping space was separated by two french doors off of the living room. There was a dressing room area where the bathroom sink was located and the tub and commode in a separate room off of that. The space was larger than many NYC apts and calling the hotel direct I was able to get a very affordable rate for a cityscape room. I also suggest checking out their website because they have promotions there. The staff is super professional and warm. Rooms are spotless. Also two gigantic flat screen televisions in both the living room and bedroom. It was a fantastic stay! I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with Cambridge Suites”
Reviews.Author: Patichou
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Toronto and wanted to say how much I enjoyed my stay at the Cambridge Suites. My suite was very comfortable with bar, microwave, fridge, and 2 TV's. Best of all was the layout - each sleeping area is private and totally separate from the other. Every day coffee, cookies, popcorn and bottled water are delivered to your room - gratis. The staff could not have been nicer. Location is very good - close to Queen Street, Yonge Street and subways. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in Heart of Downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: SusanLLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 night stay at this hotel and liked it very much. As the name iindicates, it is an all-suites hotel and is a very comfortable place to return to after a day of sightseeing. The suite we had was a decent size corner suite with a living room area equipped with a wet bar and refrigerator. The bed was comfortable and both the living room area and bedroom had flat panel TVs. Amenities included terry bathrobes and toiletries. The size of the bathroom was good but the counter space alongside the sink could have been a bit larger. Included in the rate is a very ample continental breakfast which includes cereals, fresh and dried fruit, yogurts and breads. The hotel was a few blocks from the subway and there is a lot of shopping nearby. The concierge and front desk staff were very helpful and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: ec76
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 3 nights at the Cambridge Suites in Toronto and had a fantastic stay! We had a standard suite with King bed. The suite was roomy and clean. The bed was on the firm side, but to me that's a good thing; very comfortable. The restaurant was still closed for renovations but that was okay. We'd recommend two restaurants very close to the hotel on Richmond East: Golden Thai and Harlem. Both were very good meals. The staff were warm and very helpful. We asked for restaurant recommendations for our last night and Stuart came back to us later that day with printouts of three great restaurants and their reviews. The place we picked was exactly what we were looking for that night. The location of the hotel is great; Yonge Street is just to your left when you exit the hotel; Queen Street is one block north. We walked all around Queen Street West, Theatre district, etc. The only thing that could've made the trip better would be if it were warmer outside! We would definitely stay at the Cambridge Suites again.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: teenba
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal from expedia for a four night stay. Hotel was easy to find Hotel staff couldnt have been any better if they tried very helpful and friendly. Room was great the best bed i have ever slept in Breakfast was good plenty of fresh food. 2 second walk from the main street (Yonge) with plenty of places to eat and drink a trip to the island was lovely as it was covered in snow. I i return to toronto i will stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but underwhelming.”
Reviews.Author: myvoicecarries
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were really interested in getting a nice, chic hotel for our Toronto getaway to end the winter break from school. After reading the great reviews and browsing the Cambridge Suites website a few times, we booked (at a rate of $160 per night). The hotel was extremely easy to find after getting off the Express Way. The location was not exactly what I had hoped for as the hotel was surrounded by empty lots and a bit of construction. Parking was available in a underground garage that was accessible from an elevator that exits straight into the hotel's front lobby. Parking was 17 dollars a day which is typical. There is no valet and no attendent to help you with your bags, so once you park you have to lug all your belongings up to the hotel's lobby. The front lobby was very small, but nice. Dimly lit with marble flooring, rich dark woods, and a small sitting area. The staff were okay, but I found the most helpful and friendly were the cleaning staff (who do evening cleaning which ended up being very useful for us). The room itself was nice. Every single suite is set up a little bit different, but they all have a sitting area with television, a desk, two closets, kitchenette/bar, bathroom sink with large marble counter, seperate bedroom with television and sliding doors. We were able to get a smoking room which is available upon request, but we were told when we were booking that if there wasn't a smoking room available when we checked in and we attempted to smoke in a non-smoking room a charge of at least 200 dollars would be made on our Credit Card. The hotel is extremely strict on the no smoking policy. It was nice having all the extra room, it was welcoming to come back to after a day in downtown Toronto...but the hotel could use an update in the appliances (the mircowave was clearly old and ready to die) furniture, and overall colour scheme. It was all very dull. The bathroom was a little cramped. I appreciated the large marble counter area for when I was primping for a night out, but I found that part of the room to be too much dead space. My boyfriend and I took full advantage of the gym (that closes nightly at 11:30pm). Disappointingly it offered only two treadmills, one elliptical, and one exercise bike. During busy times we would have to wait to use equipment. One plus was each piece of equipment came with a personal television, unfortunately if the person on the machine next to you tried to change their channel they could accidently change your channel as well with their remote. There was also a full weight set, a hot tub, and a sauna. No pool. One plus is the hotel gives you a complimentary basket of coffee and tea (higgins and burke brand), two bottles of water, a bag of microwaveable popcorn, and cookies which was nice. These were refilled daily by the cleaning staff. The products the hotel uses are all by Aveda (shampoo, conditioner, lotion, mouthwash, and soap) which was nice and of good quality. My biggest pet peeve was that when I would go to the frontdesk for directions or suggestions about where to eat I found their responses were generally uninformed and lacking. We had better help from our cab drivers. I liked my stay at the hotel, but will likely not plan on staying there in the future as the overall feel of the hotel just wasn't for me.

Reviews.Title: “Sublimely comfortable beds”
Reviews.Author: diggaa
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel. You don't get marble bathrooms or silk curtains but you do get space, comfort, peace and quiet and the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in. Check-in was a bit of a disappointment ,with no-one to help up with our bags (it was late a night) but it was all up from then on. We had a twin bedded suite which, even though it was right opposite the elevators, was very quiet. Traffic noise was only distant, - exept when the Toronto police decided to go screeching through with their sirens blaring in the middle of the night. Should just menion that our suite had glass panel doors between the sitting room and the bedroom which might be a problem if you were intending to use the sofa bed in the sitting room as the light shone through from one room to the other. Room service was excellent with a lady coming round in the afternoon with a basket of cookies and the tea, coffee, popcorn etc. constantly replenished. We brought breakfast up to the room to eat and they supplied us with a kettle and toaster as soon as we asked. The hotel is in a great location - easy to walk down to catch a ferry to the Toronto islands or to walk up town. It is also surrounded by lots of good restaurants. We enjoyed the Golden Thai and Le Papillion, both within easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: Celticgrl
Reviews.Content: Stayed there with my husband and toddler on Dec 15th. Got a great rate on Hotwire and had heard a lot about it so was anxious to see it. Room is a suite which was great. Had a king bed in one room, living area with kitchenette and couch in another room, a dressing room/power room and a small bathroom. Decor is pretty dated and the tv was very old and kept changing colour. Very centrally located and can get to the Eaton Ctr without going outside. Had dinner at the restaurant there. Food was excellent. Breakfast was included in our rate and that was good too. All in all the stay over was good and I'd go back again. Its classified on hotwire as a 4 star which I wouldn't agree with. I think that its more a 3 star. Saying that we got a great rate and it was really suitable for us.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, clean and centrally located”
Reviews.Author: GLT-LCT
Reviews.Content: A spacious room with king bed, clean and quiet with complimentary breakfast to boot! Friendly staff. Don't let the fact that it is billed as being in business/financial sector throw you off. Walking on the street (rather than the tunnel connections) takes: 5 minutes to subway, 10 minutes to Eaton centre; 10 minutes to the Hilton and restaurants etc. Train station is 10 minutes by taxi (less than 10$ with tip!) Central and secure. Wouldn't recommend taking car since parking is rare and expensive even at this hotel. We used an agency on the Internet to book and we had absolutely no problems -saved a bundle too!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: c0reyann
Reviews.Content: After some careful research, I finally decided to stay at the Cambridge Suites Hotel in Toronto for my 3 day trip for a convention. I had never been to Toronto nor had anyone that I knew that had been so I had to go on guesswork alone. I guessed quite well!!! This hotel is exactly what it states - suites. All rooms have a view and all rooms are ample suites. I had a sitting room, bedroom and bathroom all in a circle like layout. A unique layout but it definately worked. The bed was very comfortable!!! I also really liked that in addition to the usual complimentary coffee, they also had tea, cookies and popcorn! Also included with your stay is a contenential breakfast that is more than ample! The location of the hotel is also pefect, you can nearly walk to anywhere you need to go in downtown Toronto. The mall is quite close and in colder months you can access it via the underground. Finally you must try the restaurant on site, it's divine!!!

Reviews.Title: “we stayed in a fabulous suite”
Reviews.Author: nickijane
Reviews.Content: We were so excited when we saw the suite that we were staying in. it was spacious and so comfortable. The extra space was a real luxury. The staff are very friendly and were helpful at all times breakfast was a continental one, you could load a tray and back to your room to eat if you didnt want to stay in the breakfast room. the rooms had a microwave and a fridge you could store your own shopping in. The hotel is central, just off yonge street (the longest street in the world) and very close to the eaton center shopping mall.

Reviews.Title: “lovely rooms, plenty space”
Reviews.Author: lja123
Reviews.Content: We visited Toronto with friends to visit my daughter who is staying in Canada, and was in Toronto at that time. Extremely comfortable beds, slept like a baby every night! Separate bedroom, dressing area, and lounge made this hotel very likable indeed. I wouldn't say it was the height of luxury, but I couldn't fault it either. The maid service was very good, morning and turn down service at night. At night time the maid also left us a little card with the next days weather forecast on it, as well as several little chocolates at the side of the bed. The free breakfast is a great idea, and you are encouraged to take a tray to the breakfast room and take whatever you like back to your room, or you can sit there in the sunny breakfasting room if you choose. If I go back to Toronto, I'd book it again!

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable stay , great deal”
Reviews.Author: jennypin
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 days , and it was an excellent choice . lovely two double beds , very nice service from all grades of staff , some went the extra mile .. Location is very convenient for downtown , and cab rank with cab always there . Breakfast was fine . only criticism I have was the restaurant as its expensive , nice food but not quite up to prices . However there is plenty of choice in downtown Toronto .

Reviews.Title: “loved the suite”
Reviews.Author: hrcnow
Reviews.Content: I can thoroughly recommend this hotel for a stay in Toronto. The suite was spacious and well maintained, with the added advantage of having a sofa bed in the living room, which I banished my boyfriend to when his snoring became unbearable!We loved the little touches such as the free popcorn, the weather forecast on the pillow, and the helpful room directory showing locations of nearby restaurants. The hotel was very well located: we walked everywhere and there were lots of restaurants and bars nearby. Although the breakfast room could get crowded, this wasn't a problem as there was a tray in the kitchen area of the room so we got into the habit of loading up and having a leisurely breakfast in front of the telly. If you're looking for lots of sightseeing and a comfortable place to stay the night, this is the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “High expectations rewarded”
Reviews.Author: DebbyDuck1
Reviews.Content: My adult daughter and I stayed at this very conveniently located hotel for a weekday night prior to getting back in the fall school/work routine. We were upgraded to the 20th floor and enjoyed a corner room view of the city. Delightful. Suite and bath were spacious with invitingly comforting pillows and comforters. Aveda products nice to try, and the snacks and mini-bar offerings were appreciated. Breakfast was pleasant and they make it easy to transport coffee and food back to the room. The staff was always pleasant and helpful when questions were asked. We'll be back again and will be certain to stay at the Cambridge Suites!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: smartann
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Cambridge Suites Hotel with my family. Staff very helpful and very nice. Breakfast staff Gabriella and Addis nice. Great location for downtown Toronto and 2 blocks from the Eaton Centre. Easy access for local transportation. 30 mins from Pearson Int. Airport. Faults = The breakfast room- gets a bit crowded in the morning - get there early and parking CAD$ 17 a day. Other than that would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and location”
Reviews.Author: Bobster71
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location if you are holidaying. It is situated just 5 mins from the cities large shopping complex and 15 minutes walk from the waterfront and CN Tower. Also worth a mention is that it is also situated on the PATH network. This is a maze of underground walkways that allow access to almost everywhere without going outside - nice for that hot hot day. In order to test out the path - we walked from the hotel to the CN Tower without going outside in 35 minutes - an experience. The rooms are large and spacious. There is a sitting room with TV and a bedroom with adjoining walk in cupboard/wash area and separate bathroom - so 3 rooms make up the suite. There is another TV in the bedroom. The TV has a pay per view movie service for about 11 dollars per film and they are recent releases. The main living room space has a microwave and sink, plates cuttlery etc. and complimentary water, popcorn and a nightly chocolate with the turn down service. There is also a fridge and a minibar. A newspaper is delivered every morning. This sink is in addition to the wash basin in the bathroom/cupboard area. The pictures on the other reviews illustrate this well. This set up makes a great base for touring the area and it is easy to get back to so that you can break up your day with a rest/shower if it is really hot - which it can be. Luckily the air conditioning is excellent - just set up the temp and within a minute the air starts to cool. This is the only hotel that I could find that included a breakfast service as part of the room price and it is good. You can get fresh fruit, yoghurt, pastries, cereals (museli, bran flakes, corn flakes and all bran), dried fruits, juices, toast, bagels, tea and coffee. If you want a cooked breakfast, you will have to go downstairs to the restaurant and pay extra. The breakfast room is on the 2nd Floor and can get quite busy after 8.00am. We always got a table though since we were normally there before this time. This isn't a problem though because you can get a tray, fill it up and return to the comfort of your room to feast. Overall we had a great stay - I would recommend getting a limo from the airport (about Â£30) as it is an unmetered service. If it is busy and you are in a taxi - the meter is rolling!

Reviews.Title: “a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: cjlewis
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the cambridge suites for four nights july23-27th Suite was excellently maintained and the staff were very pleasant and the whole atmosphere was relaxing. one downfall was the breakfast area it can get very crowded around 08:30 i went earlier when it was quiet. location of hotel is very convienient about 5 minutes from eaton centre and 15 minutes to cn tower and rogers centre. overall the hotel was very good and when i return to toront i will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Chris RJ
Reviews.Content: Stayed six nights early July. Large suite providing plenty of room for a couple. Nice extra complimentary touches such as bottled water, bathrobes etc. Great location with easy access to transport system, shops and easy walk to main attractions. Breakfast more than adequate though room can get overcrowded. Staff attentive, friendly and ready to always provide advice etc. Would return.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & location”
Reviews.Author: SUPERMO
Reviews.Content: We have just spent 5 nights here (15-20 July) and it was great. The suite was first class with plenty of space, lovely fresh linen every day and a large bathroom.The breakfast room was not large enough to accomodate everyone but we only had to eat our breakfast in our suite on one occasion.The location of the hotel is such that you can walk to most of the attractions easily including the Eaton Centre for shopping. We used the hop on, hop off bus which enabled you to get an overall view of the City then select where you wished to get off to explore further and the ticket is valid for the whole of your stay - unlike some other City breaks. The trip to Niagara Falls (through Grayline coaches) was great and included an excellent buffet lunch on the top floor of the Sheraton Hotel which gave you fabulous views of the Falls and the Maid of the Mist boat ride is not to be missed. I found the shopping no cheaper than in the UK, after the two local taxes were added - so be warned. Overall, a great vacation and I would not hesitate to recommend the Cambridge Suites. If I return to Toronto I would certainly stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: sdrawkcabekiM
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in early July, 2007. The suite we stayed in was perfectly adequate (clean, spacious 2 rooms) but it was nothing that you could get excited about - it felt like any of a number of business hotels that I've stayed in. However, the location is very good providing you a great starting place to discover a lot of Toronto by foot and, from that perspective, the hotel is a great place to be. There was a complimentary breakfast service on one of the hotel floors which seemed to be pretty chaotic so (after one attempt) we gave that a miss. Recommendation if you stay here is to walk out of the door, turn up the street and visit the Sunset Grill for breakfast - fantastic place to start the day :-) In summary - it's a good place to stay but don't expect to get excited about the hotel or its rooms. They're clean, spacious and functional.

Reviews.Title: “Very good all-round hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: RichD1975
Reviews.Content: Another UK reviewer here and unlike thingummyjig a few days below, I thoroughly recommend it. I actually stayed on my own, so Â£100 per night is a bit steep per night, but a sizeable, well-appointed and well decorated suite for a family of 4, given its location and the breakfast thrown in, is a veritable bargain. Breakfast was well-stocked (good juice, bagels, toast, fruit, yoghurts, coffee, danish pastries) and moderately busy, but always a table there for people. Staff very friendly and helpful, and actually added to my stay by recommending nearby restaurants/bars to meet up with friends in and also a whole bunch of local take-aways when I stayed in after landing. In-house restaurant also served up good, if maybe slightly expensive food. Beds are absolutely superb. Only gripes are the lack of shower gel (although this may just be a UK staple in hotels) and lifts being slow on occasions!

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious suites”
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights at the Cambridge and was delighted with the standard of suite and the location. It's just off Yonge Street. The suites have a king size bed in the bedroom and a pull out double bed in the living area. Included was fridge, sink, microwave and mini bar. It was so well equiped and spacious it was like staying in an apartment within an excellent hotel. What was exceptional was the complimentary breakfasts, the turn down service at night which included bottles of water and mints and the staffs friendliness and helpfulness. Nothing was too much bother. Top class hotel and suites!!

Reviews.Title: “good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: nisaq
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Cambridge Suites for one night during July 2007. Considering this hotel is located in Downtown Toronto, the apartment room we had was a very good size with a seperate living room area and mini kitchen. The location is great with the Eaton Center virtually opposite the hotel and is easily accessible. The few slight criticisms I have: 1)- Breakfast area......its far too small (although you can take breakfast to your room)and the queues were very long. Whilst it did seem that the staff were doing their best to refill the food items, it did seem to take ages........ 2)- The room that we had albeit very clean did feel a bit outdated.... However, a good hotel overall.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to rave about”
Reviews.Author: thingummyjig
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights here. This is really a functional, rather dull business-style hotel . The suites are spacious and the beds and fresh white linens wonderfully comfortable, but the decor overall could certainly do with a bit of an update. Missed not having a safe in the room. The bath/shower area in our suite was dimly lit. The front desk was brisk and efficent, but staff were not particularly warm or friendly. The breakfast room was chaotic and overcrowded so we just took a tray up to our room every day. Overall, reasonable value for money, just don't build your expectations up too much.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch!”
Reviews.Author: Peewak
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 8 nights on business trip and hotel could not be faulted.Excellent accomodation - spacious and spotless complimented by a staff team of supreme professionalism and,believe it or not,old fashioned kindness. Suffice to say,was impressed by the city enough to want to return for holiday and,if so, would unconditionally recommend the Cambridge Suites to myself!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Cambridge suites.”
Reviews.Author: Thistledome
Reviews.Content: Reviewer from Devon, England. Cambridge suites exceeded our expectations. An apartment in the city where rooms were clean and spacious. Staff were friendly and very helpful. English visitors would probably like a kettle in the room rather than just a coffee maker, but kettles are available on request. Continental breakfast was very good. Location handy for visting Eaton Centre and City Hall. Most places you might want to visit were accessible on foot or public transport. Would certainly recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: VanIsle12
Reviews.Content: Thanks Trip Advisor! Based on your reviews - we booked this hotel and we had a great experience! We would definately stay here again when we go back to Toronto. We stayed in the Cityview suite....great view, comfortable and clean accommodations in the downtown area. Would definately recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable place in the heart of Toronto”
Reviews.Author: BostonianVagabond
Reviews.Content: I would stay here again. You feel like you have your own apartment in the city. Location: This is a great location for sightseeing in Toronto -- very centrally located. It was a bit further to the Convention Center than I liked (a 15 minute walk at a very brisk pace). Pros: The rooms were huge -- with a separate large bedroom and living area (each with its own TV). The bed was firm and comfortable. The kitchenette with complimentary tea, hot cocoa, coffee, cookies, microwave popcorn and real cups/utensils was a nice touch. There are two robes for your use as well. In business center, you can print things for free (off of a USB, but you pay for the internet). The staff were courteous, friendly, and helpful. Free continental breakfast was nice. The food available was just average -- but they did have good variety (various juices, coffee, yogurt, cereal, dried fruit, bagels, bread, pasteries). It was definitely enough to start your day. And even if you showed up 15 minutes before the breakfast ended, they still had a full selection (it was constantly replenished). I really liked the complimentary bottle of water they offered every night along with a card describing the weather conditions for the next day. Cons (all minor): The towels were not fluffy -- they were a bit on the rough side. Unlike other hotels, they don't provide complimentary shaving cream, razors, or toothbrushes through the front desk -- but that is available for purchase as part of the minibar selection. The internet service costs $9.95 a day (whereas I'm used to hotels like this offering that free). The elevators were very slow and I sometimes waited close to 10 minutes. I was on the 5th floor and did hear some street noise (nothing out of the ordinary though). There wasn't much of a view from the window. I found the thermostat difficult to adjust. All in all, though -- I'd recommend this place for anyone who wants a good location in downtown Toronto and wants some of the comforts of home.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place”
Reviews.Author: travelerLondonON
Reviews.Content: This is a nice downtown hotel, within a short walk to many downtown sites and the subway system. I took the subway to the Toronto convention centre (3 stops away), and easily walked back to the hotel at the end of the day. I enjoyed the suite (one bedroom, separate living room with microwave and counter to make coffee etc). The air conditioner was not as loud as most hotels, and not much street noise. The hotel was very clean. The continental breakfast buffet had quite a few choices. It was definitely enough to get your day started. There is a Subway sandwich store right accross the street from the hotel. Underground indoor car garage cost $16 per 24hr, with full in/out privileges and no annoying valet to deal with. I would gladly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Cambridge”
Reviews.Author: traveller43
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Cambridge Suites Hotel for a weekend. The rooms were spacious and clean with a big and very comfortable bed. We were upgraded to a room on the 21st floor and had a great view of the city. We had complimentary breakfast included which, while basic, was adequate. The location is also fantastic as it is one block from the Eaton Center and other attractions of the city. We will definitely stay there again if we go back.

Reviews.Title: “A winner”
Reviews.Author: Valdiri
Reviews.Content: I reserved via Hotwire for a really good price (approx $100 cdn) for a very nice suite in the heart of downtown Toronto. It had all the touches I like: -A bright white duvet cover, -separate bedroom (you won't hear anyone in the hallway after closing the door here), -kitchenette with microwave, fridge, sink, plates and cutlery, -quality Aveda toiletries, -lots of great towels -a complimentary continental breakfast (was just average though) -friendly front desk and housekeeping staff There were even special touches like turndown services with a free bottle of water. The only things that weren't good about this hotel were the view (even on a higher floor, mine faced a couple of office buildings) and the room thermostat (which stayed at a reported 72 degrees regardless of any adjustments I made). The management of this hotel appears to be doing everything right (and their TripAdvisor score proves it). You can't go wrong staying here - I was satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Meets expectations”
Reviews.Author: AlbaToronto
Reviews.Content: I was impressed by the reviews on this hotel and booked one night stay on March 17, 2007. I called the hotel directly and was lucky to get a great deal - 140CAD for Deluxe King Suite including deluxe breakfast for two. It is really hard to add anything to what has been already posted here about this hotel. I agree with the previous positive reviews but I wanted to add that this is not a true 4 star hotel. I would assign it solid 3+ or 4- but you cannot compare this hotel with Intercontinental or Park Hyatt. It is a modest hotel with perfect service, clean and great for big families but the quality of their suites (bathroom , furniture, linen etc.) doesn't come close to four star. It is a great deal for 140CAD but I wouldn't pay more than this for Cambridge Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Cambridge Suites, one of the best”
Reviews.Author: Bastet07
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a trip to Toronto to celebrate our daughters Sweet 16. From the moment we walked into the Cambridge Suite Hotel until the moment we left ,we had nothing but the friendliest, most welcoming and helpful staff I have ever met. The rooms were good size and the king size bed was VERY comfortable. They had 6 very big and fluffy pillows which made for a great pillow fight. The turn down service with the complimentary water and chocolate was a great bonus. The staff was quick to help us find our way around and helped us with last minute dinner arrangements. Check in and out was very easy . There was a large wedding going on but you would never know it as noise did not travel through the walls or floors. The continental breakfast was constantly being refreshed by a very attentive staff so there was always a good assortment. I wouldn't stay anywhere else. I strongly recommend the Cambridge Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Downtown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: islandgirlcm
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Cambridge Suites for two nights and had a wonderful experience. I booked a package through Expedia and chose a "Deluxe Suite". It was spacious, clean and comfortable. The room had a small bar with a sink and microwave as well as a coffeemaker, dishes and glasses. The hotel provides complimentary coffee and tea supplies as well as a small package of chocolate chip cookies and a package of microwave popcorn daily. The room had a good sized living area with a desk/chair, a sofa and armchair and a small TV. The separate bedroom had a very comfortable king sized bed with four large, comfortable pillows. There was a slightly larger TV in the bedroom and a small desk area with a lamp. The bathroom was divided into a large dressing area with a sink and a huge mirror.
