The bathtub and toilet were in a separate area. All was clean and well maintained. All of the staff that I encountered were courteous. The hotel provides a basic continental breakfast and they also give you a tray if you want to take things back to your room. There is a restaurant on the premises that provides room service, but I didn't try it. As far as location, you don't get much more central than this hotel. The Eaton Centre is just a couple blocks away and so is the subway. All of the theatres are close by. The best thing is that in the building across the courtyard from the hotel is the Toronto PATH. This is an underground walkway that connects many downtown buildings, shopping malls and subway stations so you can move around easily in even the worst weather. The PATH is very easy to navigate, very clean and felt very safe. All in all, I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at this hotel and would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Penguins_Pet_Pumpkin
Reviews.Content: I believe this is an all-suite hotel, and we were in one of the smaller suites. It was absolutely beautiful. The amenities were plentiful and happily replenished as often as we requested, as well as on their regular daily routine. The staff was consistently friendly, warm, and helpful. As this was just before Christmas the hotel was decorated throughout all public areas, and the lobby was a joy to pass through, with an elegantly-decorated tree. The location could not have been better, both for business and pleasure. We were short walking distance from where we were doing business, as well as being very close to the Eaton Centre. The bar staff went above and beyond in hospitality. I wish I had written this immediately after the trip when my memory was clearer, as there was one member of the bar staff, a woman whose name I can't now recall, who made me feel as if I was simultaneously their best customer and her best friend. Although not a five-star hotel, I truly believe this was one of our very best hotel experiences - and we have had many hotel experiences due to business travel. I HIGHLY recommend staying at the Cambridge Suites. I hope to have the opportunity to stay here again myself in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, great location and really nice staff”
Reviews.Author: fcchelsea
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from December 29th to Jan 5th and we found the Cambridge Suites to be a first class place to stay if you are visting Toronto. The Suites themselves are clean and spacious to a European eye and the bed was one of the most comfortable that we had slept in and it was huge! Cambridge Suites are located right near the main shopping area and a shortish walk to the harbourfront. We only took transit twice during our stay and the rest of the time we were able to walk everywhere we wanted to go. The staff couldn't have been nicer and were incredibly helpful particularly in getting us a better rate for our hire car when we travelled out of town. Also when we discovered that we couldn't collapse the ironing board after use they were on to it straight away. We stayed at the Suites over New Year and we found out that unlike a lot of hotel the Suites do not book out rooms for single nights at times like New Year to make sure that they are not used for noisy parties. We thought that this was very considerate of other guests. WeI would thoroughly recommend the Suites and will be staying there the next time we are in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service and Festive Smiles”
Reviews.Author: littlerayofsunshine
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 10 days staying at this great Downtown hotel for our honeymoon, whilst it's possibly not the most luxurious hotel compared to some it was perfect! Very clean and with the added advantage of a seperate sitting room with small fridge and microwave if you didn't want to go out. After a horrific flight from the UK, the staff couldn't have been friendlier, a special mention must go to Jennifer who worked on the concierge desk, 110% helpful all the time. The breakfast was simple but with the option of going down and getting your own before taking it to your room. On arrival as we were on our honeymoon we were upgraded so we were on the 21st floor. It is completely brilliantly located for the best shopping outside of London!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, value, service”
Reviews.Author: mark_ottawa
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here on business and would definitely return: The location is great. The suites are spacious and cost the same or less than places of similar quality that are much smaller. The service really did stand out (which is unusual these days). I was particular impressed by the speed of check in--I think it literally took 20 seconds.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the perfect spot in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: MSkinner
Reviews.Content: Was going to book the hotel through our affiliated 'corporate' rate, but called directly and got an awesome deal on a short term special. Great start! Some mixed up person took my bag off Skycheck at the airport, so I lost my wallet, clothes, etc. I had meetings that day, but when I finally got to the hotel around 3, they let me check in without a credit card (as it was lost). They were really nice to a person with no ID, no credit card, etc. I get in my room & my bag is there, and an envelope with my replacement credit card. The concierge had it delivered up there earlier in the day. It's all about service! The rooms are huge. They really are suites. Just beautiful. A queen bed with an ensuite / change area. A sofa & chair in the sitting room / TV room. 2 TV's in the room. Room was very clean, hallways the same. And service was impeccable. The breakfast that was included was pretty good. Not bad for 'free'. The location is right where you want to be - in the heart of the City. Literally a 2 minute walk to the Eaton's Centre and all that shopping. I've stayed at a number of hotels in Toronto, and will definitely return to this one.

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms, top-notch service!”
Reviews.Author: wonputt
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Cambridge very much and would stay there again. Our room was clean, and large for the price we paid, about $150/night for a suite for 4 nights. The location is prime and we walked to most of the functions we were there to attend. One night we needed a taxi to go only about 5 blocks north up Younge St., to a wedding function at the Delta Chelsea. There was only one taxi out front and he wasn't interested in taking us there, and told us to walk because he said the traffic was slow and congested, and it would be too expensive for a short ride, etc... My wife had high heels and it was cold so we started walking towards Young (which is right there on the corner) and looked for another cab. A woman on the sidewalk who watched the incident approached us and said she worked for Cambridge Suites (PR I think, and she was off work waiting for her ride), and that the taxi could not refuse us just because it was a short haul as they prefer to wait for longer fares. She walked up to him and told him, "you're taking them to the Delta", and he got in his car like a scolded child and drove us up Young to the Delta in a couple minutes at high speed(there was no traffic, he lied), and the fare was under $5, and it starts at $3. I gave him a $10 to keep him happy!! I was so impressed with her intervention that I thought it was worth a mention here... that was what I call excellent service, above and beyond what I would ever expect. I don't know her name, but I thank her for the help!

Reviews.Title: “Striking Gold”
Reviews.Author: DrPsyd
Reviews.Content: When I was looking for a place to stay after my engagement, there were soo many option and it was driving me crazy. After comparing room size and price, Cambridge seemed the best buy. I stuck Gold! When you drive by the place, it looks like a modest hotel. We arrived late so we did not have valet service. Self parking was not too bad. We had to walk a bit, but not too much. When we got in, we thought we were in the wrong place. The exterior fools you. Inside the lobby looked wonderful. The staff was very helpful and gave us everything we needed right away. When we got inside we were blown away. The place was huge. The bed area alone was bigger than most hotels we've been to. The living room was spacious and comfortable. The bathroom was also very large. The bed was incredibly comfy. Room service was friendly and considerate. I had no problems at all. I loved the place and would definetly come again... I go crazy looking for the perfect hotel room, and this is the best thing I have seen so far. The only thing the lack is a hot tub ( but I hear the really fancy rooms have one). If you have the money, I would recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Superbly located home from home”
Reviews.Author: chris036
Reviews.Content: The Cambridge Suites sits in a perfect location in central Toronto. You are seconds from the huge Eaton Centre shopping complex and Queen Metro station, so getting around is simple. To find the hotel from Pearson Airport (and without too much luggage) try the Airport Express bus, get off at Union Station and it's an 8 minute walk, or take the Metro to Queen station (2 stops). As per other reviews this hotel does not stand tall and proud, like the King Suites for example, but is more subtle and understated. However, aside from the small and dim lobby I found the suites to be excellent. We were on the 21st floor with a Northeast corner room (2103). This suite was divided into three areas; living room, bedroom, bathroom. Living area had kitchenette, PS2, DVD player, sofa, minibar and workstation. Bedroom was smaller, but with larger TV, bathrobes and huge all-round windows. The Bathroom had a bathtub & shower, hair dryer and toiletries. Nice touches included complimentary coffee/tea, popcorn & cookies, along with bottled water & chocolates during the evening turndown service. On the 22nd floor is a fitness centre, which is small but clean and functional, with a shower/changing room, small selection of machines & weights, TV & magazines, sauna and whirlpool. Continental breakfast was included free on the 2nd floor, but its hours during weekdays is only 7-9am, somewhat restrictive. But the option of bringing a tray from your room and taking it back to your suite to eat is great. In my opinion the hotel represents excellent value for money, as you can easily spend as much or more for a much smaller room with less facilities. Top marks Cambridge Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Fossilhound
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel at the end of August and over the long weekend. The location is terrific, in the center of DT within walking distance of the harbor, CN tower, old Toronto, shops and an abundance of restaurants. The staff was very polite, helpful and accomodating, Stuart Fleming (Concierge) took care of our needs and any requests that we had. The suites were of a decent size, it was much better than just a room with a bed, having a fridge, microwave and living area seperate from the bedroom makes a stay in the hotel that much more pleasant. We found the hotel to be a bargain compared to other locations and would recommend the Cambridge to other travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: Aug60
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a disappointment in some ways, nice in others. The biggest problem I had is that it just isn't that attractive. The lobby is dimly lit, as are the hallways. I found it depressing. The room lighting was a bit better, but still not great. The towels in the bathroom were skimpy. Not thick, and pretty small. I expect more from a 4 star hotel. The continental breakfast was ok, except that the first day we arrived about 20 minutes before it ended, and they had stopped replenishing the food. The juice pitchers were empty and sitting there. There were other choices that they seemed to have run out of (I had been there earlier in the a.m. for coffee, and there was a far greater selection). There is a business center, but they charge $10 per 15 minutes, which after having stayed at 2 hotels that had free internet access, seemed ridiculous. We were erronously charged for internet use and 3 phone calls. When I pointed it out at check out, they promptly and courteously took them off. On the positive: the staff was courteous. They have a small fitness room, and also have complimentary guest passes for a local gym about a 7 minute walk away. Well worth the trouble. It was a great gym, with a separate workout area for women, and classes. The hotel fitness room had a leak and was closed when we were there. I asked for an adjustment on our rate. They declined, but then surprised us with milk and cookies in our room later that day and a nice note from the manager (not sure if they saw the irony in that, but my kids did!!). It was a nice gesture. Overall, the hotel was ok. We stayed there because it was a suite, and it was not as roomy as I had hoped, but maybe that's to be expected downtown in a big city. I probably wouldn't stay here again, as I think there probably are better choices, but I'm not sure.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly enjoyed the Cambridge Suites”
Reviews.Author: Ranwelli
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, central location. Staff very friendly and helpful. Continental breakfast excellent. Rooms very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service and value”
Reviews.Author: deskjet2
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent City centre hotel, where we found comfortable, spacious and clean suites, with a continental breakfast included. The concierge, Stewart Flemming deserves a special mention as he is so helpful to visitors and its this kind of service that makes this hotel stand out. When we phoned to book, he organised a car rental for us and when we were there his restaurant recommendations and trip advice was so helpful in making our stay enjoyable. He even mailed back my wife's reading glasses which she left behind. We would thoroughly recommend this hotel and cannot understand some of the negative reviews here which have perhaps been written by the competition?

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, could do better”
Reviews.Author: be_blunt
Reviews.Content: We stayed for five nights in late July. The suite was a good size as we were travelling with our 15 year old son, he had the sleeper sofa. The fridge and microwave were useful. The hotel is in a great location, the weather was extremely hot and we could get directly onto the PATH system and there were always taxis just outside the main entrance. On the negative side, our room wasn't made up on our second day, we returned late afternoon and had to call housekeeping to get it done. The WC was faulty, kept flushing constantly and on one occasion blocked, the maintenance man arrived quite quickly when we reported it but he only seemed to fix it temporarily. The worst problem was a faulty fire alarm system, that went off four times while we were in the hotel once at 3.30 am. The hotel wasn't evacuated but we had to be on standby whilst the alarm sounded until the fire department arrived to check it out. Overall the hotel seems to be showing its age, the staff on the desk were polite and helpful, we felt quite sorry for them as some guests were getting very angry over the fire alarm problem.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC”
Reviews.Author: Jake1509
Reviews.Content: Spacious rooms,very clean and excellent value for money.The staff couldn't have been more helpful.Also an excellent location for visitors to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Quality and service”
Reviews.Author: boxingjasmine
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Cambridge suites in the beginning of July. The room was small old and unkept looking. The satff were nothing to write home about. and My room was not cleaned!!! Very unprofessional service in my opinion. The basic amenities were again nothing special, and don't be fooled like I was that its in the "heart" of downtown.... Its not Its west of the core and to ask for the door man to fetch me a cab was even a struggle. Won't be returning. DID NOT LIKE ANYTHING ABOUT THIS DUMP

Reviews.Title: “Exceeds expectations”
Reviews.Author: second row
Reviews.Content: Booked this property as a result of Trip Advisor. It was very good, especially large suites, good location and complimentary breakfast. On Wednesday nights the staff hold a reception for guests with complimentary drinks and nibbles. Good fun. It exceeded my expectations and I will return.

Reviews.Title: “Forgot to clean my room”
Reviews.Author: lardan23
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as a result of the great reviews here. They were the cheapest room in the downtown area for when I was staying there, and a suite no less. I will say that the hotel is lovely, the room is very large, and the location can't be beat. We had continental breakfast delivered to our room right on time both mornings, by two smiling faces. In fact, I enjoyed everything about the hotel, except, that they forgot to make up my room on Saturday (we were there from Fri - Sun). We got back to our room at 3:30 pm from an afternoon of shopping, and our room was not made up. I called the front desk and told them of the situation; they said that they try to make up the incoming guests rooms first, which made sense to me. I told them we would be out until about 5, and to please have the room made up. We returned at 5:10, and the room was still not made up. I called the front desk again, and the clerk expressed surprise that the room still wasn't done. I told her to forget it, as we were there now getting ready for a play; but to please have the room turned down for the evening. We came back from our play and dinner, and indeed, the room was prepared for evening. Overall, except for that, our stay was fine; great location, great price, and the room was very, very spacious. Oh, and the bathroom and vanity area were wonderful and spacious.

Reviews.Title: “a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: abrinnel
Reviews.Content: I was a little nervous after reading the last few reviews but I found none of the problems that these others guests did. We were upgraded to a city view suite on the 21st floor upon arrival. The view was spectacular. 5 of us stayed in a suite with 2 double beds and a pull-out sofa. We've stayed in larger suites but this one was more than adequate. All the staff we encountered were helpful and friendly. The carpet had a few stains but no big deal. The rooms even smelled good. The complimentary breakfast was available downstairs or for delivery and was full of nice selections. We would definitely recommend this hotel. Other amenities included plush bathrobes, Aveda toiletries, turn down service with chocolates, popcorn, cookies and bottled water, thick/soft bath towels and a microwave and refrigerator in the room. A happy traveler from Massachusetts!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room, Mediocre Service”
Reviews.Author: TravelingClayton
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is great...connects to the underground PATH, one block from the Eaton Centre and Queen Street subway station, and plenty of good restaurants nearby. The suites are a decent size, and the complimentary popcorn, cookie packet, and bottled water are a nice touch with turndown service. Our suite also had a microwave, coffee pot, and teapot. We also enjoyed the hot tub on the 22 floor overlooking the city. The complimentary breakfast each morning was nice which included cereals, danishes, bagels, fruit, juices, coffee/tea, and muffins. (They provide trays to bring the food back to your suite if needed.) The Cambridge Suites hotel would be a much better place if the service from the front desk and housekeeping departments showed improvement. We had a heavy amount of mildew in the shower, and the turndown service was not finished on two of the five nights we spent at the hotel. The front desk staff did not appear knowledgeable of events or attractions in the area. Many of the front desk employees appeared disinterested in guest service, and they seemed to be overly playful at times. One particular employee was very helpful, and his name was Stuart at the Concierge desk. He was the only employee we encountered who showed genuine interest, seemed knowledgeable, and remained focused on his job. Overall, we would recommend Cambridge Suites primarily due to the location, amenities, and size of the rooms. However, I would not expect much from the staff members.

Reviews.Title: “Toronto-Niagara trip”
Reviews.Author: f342434
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was centrally located & allowed easy access to mass transit-Streetcars & subway. It cost $2.50 for a one-way ride but you can get on & off one & transfer to the other to get to your destination for the one fee. On weekends a couple can obtain an unlimited pass for two for $8.00-a real bargain compared to the $2.50/person fee for one trip. The room was a suite and was very large with double sliding doors separating the bedroom from the living room. There was a refrigerator, wet bar, coffeemaker & microwave. Complimentary cookies & popcorn. The liquor/soda was very expensive. The complimentary Continental breakfast was pretty good. We would definitely go back. We were able to walk to the Harbor in about 10-15 min. Streets were exceptionally clean and extremely safe to walk at night. People were extraordinally helpful - the second I took out a map to orient myself, someone would ask if they could help. Lots of college students. We went to Chinatown & Little Italy. Chinatown was filled with stores with fruitstands on the sidewalk all with excellent bargains. Nowhere really good to eat though. LIttle Italy was nothing like NYC's version in that there were a lot less restaurants & further spread out. We ate at Capitol Trattoria & Pizzeria at 597 College St. which has a very nice sidewalk cafe. The canneloni was excellent and the veal marsala was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Big disappointment”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Big Disappointment, I frequent Toronto often for business and chose the Cambridge Suites this time. It was a big disappointment to say the least. Run down rooms with a weird smell in them. The staff were the least friendly out of any hotel I've stayed at ( Believe me many !) When I callled Room service it took forever and was fast food like as well when I called reception I was left on hold for over 5 minutes. When the front desk staff finally came back on the line, I asked him why he put me on hold for long and he replied in a snarky tone "Because sir, You are not the only one that we need to attend to" I got off the phone and decided to solve the issue for myself as obviously helping guests is out of the question for the staff at the Cambridge Suites!! I would warn any one who is looking to stay there in the future not to....There are many other wonderful hotels in the area don't waste your time and money you will be very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: JDP1232
Reviews.Content: What a dissapointment. I chose to stay here after reading the reviews on trip advisor. Where the people who wrote the reviews family members to the hotel because nothing of what was raved about was at all seen during my stay! From the outside it looks like a classy elegant hotel. However not that way in the inside. The staff were ICE COLD and had no professional etiqutte what so ever. The rooms are old and very warn down (whoever said beautiful must be blind!) This is a low budget hotel with a nice outside face.Don't be tricked by this...... Trust me....You can do much better for that rate. And thank you once again to the Lovely staff who take so much pride in the hotel and customer service (YEAH RIGHT) it put a damper on my entire visit in T.O.... NEVER AGAIN CAMBRIDGE SUITeS

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, safe place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Nothing overwhelming, but we enjoyed our night at the Cambridge. The area and hotel are safe and the rooms are clean. Good location and staff knew what they were doing. Overall I would recommend this hotel to just about anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Loved every second of our stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent a weekend in Toronto as a getaway and loved every second of our stay at the Cambridge Suite Hotel. The price was extremely reasonable, considering the location (downtown Toronto, close to ALL amenities and subway), the safety of the hotel and the size of the suite. The staff was unbelievably friendly and helpful. The suite was clean and the mini-bar well-stocked when we arrived. Some could complain about the view (we looked directly into the windows of an office building) but to be honest, our trip was about the CITY, not the room. I would recommend this to any visitor in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Caribana Cool”
Reviews.Author: bigge1922
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Cambridge Suites last year during Caribana and found the hotel to be very nice. It was clean and safe. After-hours, during the Caribana season, they check key cards to ensure that people who don't stay in the hotel aren't roaming the hotel. It was a little annoying, but it is an attempt to increase the safety so you really can't complain too much. It was a short walk away from food, shopping, and transportation. I would recommend this to anyone. I stayed with 4 girlfriends and we had a great time, although the beds were a little small compared to the ones in American hotels. Loved the in-room safe and the snacks that came with the deluxe room. I found the staff to be professional yet distant, not overly friendly, but they gave great direction when prompted. Also, when the aunt of my friend came by to drop off homemade food, and we weren't in, the staff took the food and kept it warm for us until we arrived. All in all, it is a good experience for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Service-annoying front desk lady”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I decided for my boyfriend and I's 2 year anniversary I would rent a hotel I booked it and was told I was getting a specific room and that I could check in early. When I went the next day to check in the lady at the front desk was so rude. She spoke to me like a child since I look young and wasn't actaully listening to what I was saying. She just repeated unfortunally a dozen times given me a bunch of different excuses of to why I cant check in. She made me feel like garbage and I felt like she was a robot with no soul. I came later and was given a room that was different to the one I was promised. The room was nice although the TV's were outdated and fuzzy. I liked the hotel but the service was horrible I wish they wouldnt lie. It was not worth 200 for one night

Reviews.Title: “Cambridge was above and beyond the good reviews”
Reviews.Author: Viva_la_Spartans
Reviews.Content: Once again, Trip Advisor users were dead on with a hotel recommendation. My girlfriend and I stayed at the Cambridge Suites this weekend and absolutely loved it. The rooms were as advertised - large king bed and a pull out in a seperate living area. The room was clean and relatively spacious for the price. The location is excellent - especially for shopping in the Eaton Centre area. Chinatown, Little Italy and the CN Tower/financial district are all a little more of a walk, but we never even ended up using the subway or cabs considering the wonderful weather we had. Most importantly, the service at Cambridge Suites was OUTSTANDING. Not only was the staff helpful, cheerful and polite, but they went above and beyond the call of duty by sending a fruit and light dessert plate to our room upon hearing that we were celebrating my girlfriend's birthday. It's the sort of extra small touch that goes a long way. Every member of the lobby staff was knowledgable about the area, right down to which highways were under construction. Nice additional touches included crackers, popcorn and daily bottles of water left by the cleaning staff, as well as cards informing you of the next day's weather forecast after they turned down the bed. Again, the sort of small touches that go a long way. Kudos to Trip Advisor for again recommending a gem - I plan to stay here on any of my future trips to Toronto!

Reviews.Title: “Great night's sleep!”
Reviews.Author: lorichad
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Cambridge Suites and loved it. Very roomy suite for family of four. Loved the King size bed and the kids were comfy on the pull out. Service was excellent and the continental breakfast offered enough of a selection to please all of us. Located nicely in the city to promote walking to all attractions but also convenient to the PATH and subway. Would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - Baby Friendly”
Reviews.Author: LittleLittle
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Cambridge Suites Hotel in February for a long weekend break and loved it. This was our first hotel stay with our 3 month old and were a little apprehensive. We need not have worried! The staff were excellent and managed to check us in and get all of our belongings to the suite very quickly. The suite itself was great - plenty of room for the baby's crib plus our luggage. The kitchenette was functional with a microwave and small fridge/freezer. It was very convienent to have 2 televisions - one in the lounge area and one in the bedroom. The whole suite was very clean with plenty of towels and 2 bathrobes. It was very useful to have the large dressing area that adjoined the bathroom and bedroom. The breakfast buffet was well stocked - it was nice to be able to take breakast back to the suite. The turndown service with chocolate and bottled water was a nice touch! We certainly will be using this hotel again on future trips to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Room for Primping”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The room was not as spacious as I would have hoped for, however, for 2 Moms and 2 teenage girls we had lots of mirrors and space for getting ready. Surprisingly, the pull-out was quite comfortable, but the blankets were very thin and in very bad shape. The hotel was conveniently located. The continental breakfast was just your typical continental breakfast, but it was nice to be able to have it delivered to the room. The hot tub was great and has a wonderful view of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but definately not 4*”
Reviews.Author: The_Changing_Man
Reviews.Content: I always make sure i spend a couple of hours checking out reviews before i book anywhere...the Cambridge Suites being no exception! Reviews here and Expedia all overly praise the CS in my opinion, Its a nice place, superb location but the accommodation and service is just average....nothing like 4*. I travel to various places about a dozen times a year and would rate this as a reasonable 3*...no frills or anything out of the ordinary TBH. The service was adequate if not a bit clueless if you asked a question past " how much is my bill ". Not sure if its the Canadian way but you'd wait 10 minutes to get served at the empty bar which i thought was rather odd!! Breakfast is a miss, the room service isnâ€™t worth the ordering as its scant and not really edible...not sure what its like downstairs as we usually got up and out early so just ate on the run... Location is as good as it gets though...at the bottom of Yonge, walking distance to anywhere really! Its cheap so you cant complain but donâ€™t go expecting the earth!

Reviews.Title: “The Cambridge Suites - Definately Sweet!”
Reviews.Author: Deano1981
Reviews.Content: It would be pretty hard to find any faults with this hotel, it was amazing! I'm 25 and decided to take my girlfriend to toronto to show her where I came from. she loved it and I have to say that the hotel helped make the holiday even sweeter! We went in mid May '05, it was pretty sunny which was a bonus and the hotel staff left little weather cards with our breakfast each day, letting us know what weather was in store for us. Our room was really spacious and looked out onto some beautiful sky scrapers (something you just don't see in Liverpool!). We had a mid sized living room with a couch and a cofortable chair, a nice breakfast table and a large TV. across the room was a very expensive looking desk wich we used, not for the intended purpose though! A little kitchenette with a microwave, sink, firdge, minibar and cutlery aswel, We only went for 5 days so we ate out every night. Our bedroom, which was joined both to the living room by sliding doors and a dressing room by a normal door was quite basic but pretty big, our bed was so, so big and comfortable though, so that made up for anything the room was lacking in character. The dressing room was joined to the kitchen end of the living room but was quite small, but hey, at least there's a dressing room! The bathroom was a nice size and it was nice to have the dressing room for my girlfriend to do her hair and make-up while I got showered. The hotel had a gym on the 22nd (top) floor, which had a jacuzzi and various cardio machines and fixed weights, the views from the gym, and especially the jacuzzi where great. All in all the hotel was great, we loved it and at the price I got it for I'd have been mad to have gone anywhere else, when we go back to Toronto we're definately going to stay in the Cambridge Suites Hotel, we both absolutely loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous place to stay - very reasonable”
Reviews.Author: lightfootfan
Reviews.Content: What a fabulous hotel! I loved it, there is not one thing that I can even think of to try and complain about. Many friends were staying in hotels in the area close to Massey Hall. This one by far had the best room size, and the staff was wonderful. Mints and a turndown every night, breakfast in the morning. Best hotel I have stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: sonjaandrob
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 6-night stay at the Cambrdige Suites Hotel with my boyfriend. And after reading some excellent reviews about it we were really looking forward to our stay. However I was disappointed to find it didn't live up to our modest expectations. On our arrival staff were friendly and check in went without a hitch. The room was very big and comfortable with a massive king sized bed as promised but I was loathed to find the shower doors coated in mould which made the whole bathing situation somewhat off-putting. Luckily there was a good sized bath aswell. There were two TVs - one in the bedroom and one on the lounge - both of which changed colour to red and green whilst we were watching.Not very good after we'd paid $13 for an in-house movie! We never found out what it was but our room was also very noisy. We put up with loud bangs in the early hours of the morning as though we were next to some large metal factory - which we weren't. I discovered the free popcorn which is promised - hidden in a smmall basket hidden behind the tea bags and one packet of free cookies. It was DIY style pop in the bag which you had to put in the microwave. Beware of the smell it makes. When I did it it absolutely stank the room out for hours. Breakfast was OK but the first two mornings we went it was very busy and with limited seating we were told we could take breakfast back to our room on a tray. Not what we had in mind and luckily some seats became available. On the next to last morning we decided to have a bit of a lie-in and didn't go to breakfast until about 8.45ish (finishes at 9am). Food was in very short supply - no milk left, only two bits of bread and 1 bagel in the basket. Despite there being numerous staff on duty who made regular checks they never topped up any of the supplies. Didn't give off a good impression. This said, there was normally ample food to choose from - cereals, fruit, yoghurts, muffins, bagels and toast and doughnuts. Good location and close to major shops and restaurants. All in all a very average hotel. Definitely not what it lives up to on its own website and certainly not 5*. Would definitely visit Toronto again but not in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gemima
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a great four night stay at the Cambridge Suites Hotel. It really is an excellent hotel in every way. The suites are so comfortable and I think the hotel has thought of everything. My 3 friends and I did not want to leave. If you want a smart, comfortable hotel with wonderful friendly staff then stay here. When visiting Toronto I would highly recommend the set lunch at the CN Tower. You need to book but the experience is fantastic especially if you are lucky enough to get a clear day. We also booked a tour to Niagara Falls with Toronto Tours. It was one of the most expensive but it was worth every penny. Our guide was brilliant and we had a full day, culminating in a final view of the Falls by night (totally unexpected but what a bonus!) Toronto is a great place, lovely people and wonderful shops. I would love to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wonrat
Reviews.Content: Just spent 4 nights at the Cambridge Suites in Toronto. Very good location--close to all downtown stores and attractions Hotel itself was very nice with very comfortable rooms. Breakfast was adequate. Hotel bar was adequate also. I would highly recommend this hotel to business and family travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious and comfortable room, great location”
Reviews.Author: IntrepidfromMontreal
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights in Oct. Fast check-in, with 3 people on staff. What a treat to enter my room and find a real suite. Good layout, too, w/ the bed in the back, buffering any sound from the hallways. A glorious bed with 4 down pillows. En suite bathroom, w/ a long marble counter and changing space, leading to the bathroom. Some of the doors open awkwardly, like the bathroom door that banged into the toilet and the closet door that banged into another open one. Not a big deal but you had to always close 1 door before opening another. In the living area, a wet bar with marble countertop, sink, coffeemaker and mini-fridge. Although I could not find the promised free popcorn. Hmmmm... Complimentary breakfast can be ordered in. Wonderful not to change and fix my hair just to go down to breakfast. However, on both days they messed up my order, forgetting juice altogether and mixing up the muffin choices. Furniture is a slightly worn, but serviceable. Two excellent work areas, a large desk in the living room facing the TV, and another desk in the bedroom, next to the bed. Caveat about lounging in your skivvies: the staff are very eager to enter your room for various reasons (turn-down service, wash your coverlet). The 1st night, I'd just checked-in and was eating supper (not good) in bed at 8pm. The door flew open, the maid bustled in wanting to turn down my bed. Luckily, I was still half decently dressed. The next morning, at 8am, again the door opened without a knock and in marched another maid wanting to divest my bed of the coverlet to launder it. Uh, okay, but I was still using it... After the 2nd incident, I made sure to hang the Do Not Disturb sign every time I stepped in my room. Location is good, being only a block away from Yonge. Restaurant tip: Only a few blocks away, you will find an excellent Thai restaurant called "Young Thailand". If you can overlook the bad service, you will love the great food.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: HLChang
Reviews.Content: I was worried before I arrived at Toronto, there were so much discussion on tripadvisor about this hotel, and all those discussion had such diverse opinion! We arrived at 6 am, after almost 19 hours of flying from Asia. They let us checked in right away, and we enjoyed our first Toronto breakfast at 7:00, after a nice long shower! We could not be more grateful for this arrangement. The hotel room is small, compared to some other hotel of the same style(eg. Times squre suite at Voncouver), the decoration a bit out of style; but it was very clean, and the complimentary breakfast was perfect for a morning start. We stayed at the thrid floor, however, and there was absolutely no view outside the window. In fact, there was a tall office building right across our room, and we have to put the curtain down all day. But rooms on higher levels should not have this problem. The location is great, almost walking distance to all major sites in this city. We would stay here again, but on higher floor. And, yes they charged you for 9 dollars a night for internet in your room!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: neilma
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in October for 3 days in a regular suite. The size compared to a regular hotel room was apprciated with a large lounge area, hallway and a big bathroom. Not much of a view of Yonge street (we were on the 5th floor) but a reasonable view. I was worried about the breakfast expecting it to be quite busy but found a table next to the window easily and a good selection. Only disaapointing thing about the breakfast was that it only opened from 7am to 9am. All in all a great hotel, great price, excellent location, great cleanliness, nice complimentaries (popcorn, cookies, tea, coffee, water etc in the room). All staff were friendly and we would definatly stay again. Would like a safe in the room next time and I understand the upgraded rooms have these (along with complemantary internet access).

Reviews.Title: “First Class Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: anany
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Cambridge suites for a few nights, and found it to be a very enjoyable experience from start to finish. Very professional staff who were very helpful at all times, and they could not have done more to make our stay a success.The hotel itself was very clean and tidy, with a very good resturant, and it is situated in a very central position for seeing the important parts of this super city.Would recommend this hotel without hestitation to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: SnowFallingOnCedars
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently stayed at the CS hotel. Upon arrival we were upgraded to a CityScape suite which was a bonus. We spent 3 nights in room 1906, from which we had a great view of the Old City Hall, plus the many 'mirrored' skyscrapers in downtown T.O which looked beautiful as the sun set. The Suite was well-laid out and well-maintained. The two Queen beds in the bedroom were supremely comfortable and the bed-linen was gorgeous. The bed-settee in the living area was also very comfortable. We thoroughly enjoyed breakfast on the 2nd floor. There was a nice variety of food and it was always well-stocked. Each morning we were lucky enough to secure a window-table, although on a couple of occasions it was quite busy. The staff in the breakfast-room were friendly, efficient and hard-working. The location of the hotel is good, very close to the Queen subway station. It is also a short walk to St. Lawrence Market, Eaton Centre, and Union Station. We enjoy walking so also walked further afield, eg, to the CN Tower, the waterfront, Chinatown etc. Most enjoyable in the beautiful sunshine we had during our trip. I would recommend the Cambridge Suites hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Thanksgiving weekend”
Reviews.Author: churchmouse33
Reviews.Content: We have just spent a long weekend in Toronto and stayed for 3 nights at the Cambridge..We booked the Thanksgiving Weekend Special..excellent value. The hotel is in an ideal location and convenient for all shops and for sightseeing..Underground parking convenient and the hotel is easy to get to from the Gardner Expressway. Suite was clean and well furnished to a high standard..all in all a comfortable place to stay when in Toronto...Breakfast a bit chaotic, but who cares its FREE...bowls of apples in the lobby and hallways, coffee,tea,biscuits and popcorn in the room with fresh milk and cream in the fridge... Staff were helpful and friendly.The jacuzzi on the top floor is worth a visit. We had a great trip to Toronto visiting family and friends and the Cambridge was a good place to come home to each night. Would certainly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to its reviews”
Reviews.Author: SteveMackie
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there for 7 nights from the 19th to the 26th August to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary. The hotel lived up to the reviews, great staff, good location and spacious comfortable rooms. The hotel could not have been better place for central Toronto and the staff did everything they could to make our stay memorable including suggesting a wonderful place to have dinner on our anniversary (Reds on Adelaide). The rooms were well maintained spacious and came with nice extra touches. Next time we are in Toronto I know where we will be staying.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: mjlass
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Cambridge Suites from Sept 29-Oct 3 and thought it was wonderful. None of us understood the bad reviews. The standard suite was much larger than a normal hotel room and was probably cheaper than most. The free breakfast was very good and is comparable, if not better than what you get at most conferences. The free bottled water was an extra plus. Staff was very helpful and pleasant. Great location near the subway and PATH. Restaurant was rather pricey, but cheaper places close by. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: cashaw6
Reviews.Content: The Cambridge Suites hotel was a very reasonably priced hotel and the accommodations were very nice. Having a separate sink outside the bathroom is a helpful touch so that one person can be showering while the other has access to a sink/mirror. The suite itelf was good size, comfortable, furnishings above average and in good condition. The location was in walking distance to a number of places including the St. Lawrence Market.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Myself and my travel companions kindly got picked up at Toronto Airport in a stretched limo 'hummer' (this nice surprise was supplied by a family member over there). Whilst three of us got out at the Radisson, myself and my girlfriend had booked a room for the same price at the Cambridge Suites. The room was spacious and airy with a decent view of downtown TO. There were seperate rooms for the living room, bedroom, and bathroom which made the room feel like a mini-apartment. There were two tv's and a huge sink / mirrored area specially designed for girls (Well, I sure didn't need all that sink / mirror space!). The minibar was expensive (as with any hotel), and the continental breakfast they brought to the room was less than filling (I had to eat as soon as we left the hotel). All in all it was an excellent stay and our room was definately worth the money. A big window providing views was also appreciated. The best thing about the hotel is the location, however. Right on the corner of Richmond and Yonge, it is ideal for everything (shopping, eating, entertainment etc). The CN Tower was a fair walk as is the waterfront, but if you like life in the city then this area is for you. It is a bit pricey but for downtown Toronto, its not too bad. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Cambridge Suites”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family spent an enjoyable two nights in the Cambridge Suites in August 2005. We had stayed at a number of historic Fairmont Hotels in other cities on this vacation and enjoyed the change of pace in this very modern hotel. The room was well equipped and had a separate sink from the toilet/shower room. The location is convenient, a short walk from the Path which provides indoor access to virtually everywhere downtown. The teenagers enjoyed the proximity to Eaton Mall. We had an exceptional (if rather expensive for children) meal in the hotel restaurant and daily continental breakfast was included. The service level did not match the service provided at our other hotels but this was a three star rather than a four or five star hotel and it was priced accordingly. Our only complaint was the long wait for elevators (it apeared that only one of three was operational) and our floor was too high to climb the stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Really liked this hotel. Good location”
Reviews.Author: casa40
Reviews.Content: First trip to Canada and very impressed. Stayed in deluxe suite and room was exactly as descibed. As we had teenager with us the room suited perfectly. Room very clean and abundance of fresh towels. Never saw the room servicing staff as we were out of hotel most of day. Check in nad out was very fast. Staff were very helpful and informative. Really good location as advised by other contributers to Trip Advisor. Could walk to everything we wanted to go to. A bit quiet at night. We went on bus tour recommended by hotel which was probaly a rip off. Good gym. Nice bar to retire to at end of busy day. I liked breakfast in hotel but my hungarycompanions wanted more and went to Sunset grill on next block and thoroughly enjoyed their breakfast. Would definitely stay here again. Good if you have younger family with you.

Reviews.Title: “Genuinelty surprised by all the negative feedback....”
Reviews.Author: daccas
Reviews.Content: I have to say that having stayed at the Cambridge Suites in July '05, I am very surprised at all the bad press it seems to be getting! (oh, and I can assure everyone that I don't work for the Hotel, am not it's owner and have absolutely NO reason to lie!). We stayed at this hotel as our 1st stop of our Honeymoon. We arrived at 2am and the receptionist was very attentive, knew who we were immediately and was very helpful. We were shown to our room which was of a good size and very clean. I have to admit I didnt check the carpets in detail however I would have thought that after 3 night stay I would have probably notived had they been that dirty! We're not the most demanding of guests so I can't really speak for the levels of service when something is requested however we did ask for a wake up call which was on time and at all times the hotel staff were very welcoming and helpful. I would have no hesitation in recommending the Cambridge Suites however I can only speak for the room we stayed in which again, was more than satisfactory.

Reviews.Title: “Just right”
Reviews.Author: JohnEverson
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Cambridge Suites for two days on our way out West and for another night on the way back to the UK. It was "just like home" and the suite felt less like a hotel than many places I've stayed. It was really nice being able to completeley shut off the bedroom area. Also the breakfast (which we'd expected to be just a few rolls and coffee) was excellent. and the location...well that couldn't be better. Would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family & I stayed at Cambridge Suites for 2 nights in August, 2005 based upon the stellar Tripadvisor reviews. The suites are a comfortable size and configuration for a family but the staff and service were very poor. Upon a 4PM arrival - used breakfast dishes cluttered the hallway on 2 floors. The dishes were still there at 6:30PM when we left for dinner. The room was not made up until nearly 5PM. Unlike our other hotels in Canada, the Front desk staff did not advise about or process a refund of the Guest Services Tax. Housekeepers were surly when called to make up room. Carpets are dingy and appeared dirty. Like another recent reviewer, I am suspicious that Cambridge staff and friends are submitting misleading reviews of this hotel to boost the Tripadvisor ratings.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i was on a business trip to toronto arriving at midnight leaving at 4:00, so time was crucial...i needed a place close by to my business appointment...i called the hotel to confirm the location was good for me, i also requested non-scented cleaning products to be used in the room,a room located far away from the elevators and i needed two double beds. i read the negative reviews others had written about the hotel, became concerned and called the hotel to review my reservation and requests...i was assured all my requests would be met, and that the hotel was a short walking distance to my destination. i arrived at the hotel at midnight, was given a room with only one double bed....after i called down to the front desk, they agreed to change rooms, but the other rooms had been cleaned with scented cleaning products, so i stayed.... the room was clean, and the bed linens are the best! i requested a wake-up call, and room service of coffee and tea to coordinate with the wake-up call....this was delightfully carried out by friendly staff. the short walk,which they actually gave me directions to.... ended up being a 15 minute cab ride (after i had walked about 15 minutes)...and i was late for my appointment. when the front desk asked me about my stay, i related my disappointments, in terms of service, it was disappointing, and my tardiness to my appointment reflected poorly on me.

Reviews.Title: “not what they say they are”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I usally try select my hotel by the rating on trip advisor. Someone within the Cambridge Suites must be sitting there and just giving all these positive reviews. The hotel is old and out dated, dirty carpets in the rooms, and to top it all I shared the room with a guest yes a ROACH. when i complained i did not get a response but we we look in to it and thats the last I heared. Do not belive the the faulse reviews with the excellent rating, none come close to reality

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TravelWithKids
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Cambridge Suites. I have to admit to being a little disappointed when we first saw the suite. The decor reminded me of a Hampton Inn or something of that level, not a nice hotel in downtown Toronto. That soon faded away, however, as I discovered what an excellent location it has and all of the nice extras. The mini-bar area was nicely equipped with glasses, corkscrew, etc. The refrigerator was a nice touch, particularly the real milk for coffee. The room was spacious and well-laid-out and the bed was really comfortable. The turndown service was very nice, particularly the bottled water that they left. The best feature, though, is the 2pm check-out time. It was great to be able to have access to the room until it was time to head to the airport. The complimentary breakfast was good, but the breakfast room got extremely crowded. Overall, this hotel is an excellent home base for exploring Toronto and boasts lots of nice extra touches. We'll definitely stay there again when visiting Toronto!

Reviews.Title: “just ok”
Reviews.Author: luv2shop2
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Cambridge Suites hotel in early August. The room was quite small for 4 people, and was nothing special. It overlooked ugly buildings with graffiti on them The location is right in downtown, and not the prettiest section of Toronto. The concierge however was very helpful and the front desk was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: wbere
Reviews.Content: My family stayed there 4 nights late July while attending convention nearby, and we all loved it. I saw this negative review, and wanted to make sure other potential guests realized that his experience was an the exception, as you can see from all the other rave reviews. What we loved: staff (front desk, concierges -- must have gotten tired of us! housekeeping, those nice ladies delivering breakfast exactly on time in the mornings); the free breakfasts, the size/configuration of the room, plenty of space for up to 2/2, the location, the quiet, really, everything. Even used the workout room/jacuzzi -- but you can get a day pass for the Adelaide Club 2 blocks away, which is much bigger, at no charge. A lot of hotels are charging for high speed now, so I don't think you can fault them for that, unless you are being hyper critical, or want to pay more for the room. My cost of $209 C was reasonable, especially considering Toronto prices. Tip: go see Blue Man Group, playing up Younge (subway next door). And the trolley on King or Queen St. will take you west to some wonderful restaurants - try Taro Grill or Brassaii, but many more. And we loved the RichTree 3 blocks towards water-giant food court, freshly made - the trout was wonderful, and the desserts sublime. I even forgot my digital camera charger (plugged into wall) and they had found it and mailed it back immediately at their expense, and couldn't have been nicer about it. I assumed I'd never see it again. It's that kind of place. People staying at the Sheraton and Hilton (convention hotels) were jealous when they realized they could have stayed at CS for same rate. We also stayed at CS in Halifax and loved it, so this chain (of only 3, wish they'd come to US) is exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: ScratchGolf
Reviews.Content: Rooms are pretty large for a downtown hotel but a little tired, no complaints really from service point, had to sleep on bed spread when I went to sleep found a dark stain (blood?) on my sheet, too late and tired to call anyone, why bother, never had this problem even in motels

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful / Fabulous / Don't Charge for Internet ! !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great accomodations ! Boutique feel, pricy but not exagerrated. Very professional and savvy staff and convenient location. The roooms are very comfortable and the front desk, bar, and upstairs service was outstanding. Very convenient to shopping, nightlife, conferences, King and Queen neighboorhoods, and a good breakfast is included. Management should not charge separetely for the internet.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: DaveStL
Reviews.Content: We just left Toronto after a two day stay at the Cambridge Suites Hotel. It was a great hotel in a safe area, close to Eaton Centre and the subway. We walked to many attractions, hopped the subway for others. Rooms were great for our family of four with adult daughter and son. The beds were great to sleep on. Real thermostats on wall (switchable between Farenheit and Celsius!) to control the termperature. Only downside was the silly $10 a day charge for high speed Internet.

Reviews.Title: “It Is Number One For A Reason!”
Reviews.Author: greeneyes
Reviews.Content: The Cambridge Suites is consistently rated number one by TripAdvisor members, and now I know why. We stayed three nights, and enjoyed our stay thoroughly. We stayed on the 20th floor, and our suite was very private and quiet as other reviews have stated. Having a sleeping area that completely closed off from the living area with double doors was a plus, as I am an early riser and my husband is not. The suite had all the amenities one could want, from complimentary coffee/tea/popcorn & cookies, to a fully stocked and clearly priced mini-bar, to dishes, silverware, and cloth napkins, to terry robes, and Neutrogena products for the bathroom. Coffeemaker, refrierator, microwave, ironing board & iron, hair dryer, cd player, video game console, all were included along with two televisions. Continental breakfast is included in the price of the room. They offer an assortment of cereals with well chilled milk, coffee, tea, hot chocolate, fruit juices, breads for toasting, muffins, bagels, fresh fruits, dried fruits, and assorted pastries and yogurts. Guests can choose to have breakfast delivered to their room, or to eat in the Club Room on the second floor. And the location! We were able to walk just about anywhere we wanted to go; we were literally steps from the PATH and Eaton Centre. There was a record-breaking heat wave while we were in Toronto, so the fact that a taxi was always available at the Cambridge entrance was very convenient for those times when we did not want to walk and brave the heat. By the way, the air conditioning in the room handled the heat wave very well; we were quite comfortable, even during the hottest part of the day. The staff was very pleasant and attentive. We were there to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary, and were wished a happy one upon check-in. Later, a complimentary fruit & cheese tray and bottle of wine were sent to our room, along with an anniversary card. Nice touch. There were no surprise charges at check-out; everything was as expected. I recommend The Cambridge Suites highly, and will certainly stay there again on my next visit to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: lomo
Reviews.Content: Just returned from my trip to Toronto/Niagara Falls. I stayed at the Cambridge Suites for the Toronto portion and attended a conference during that time. The overall experience was great and I really enjoyed the hotel. The rooms are nice, not overly spacious, but have good amenities such as a refrigerator, microwave, and dishes. The staff was very nice, courteous, and helpful. Jennifer, the concierge, is extremely helpful and goes above and beyond to help you. They provide a continental breakfast in the morning that you can either eat in the breakfast room or have delivered to your suite -- we did both. The rooms were very quiet and there was no street noise, even though you are very close to the street (we were on the 4th floor). The location is ideal in the downtown area and allows you to walk to Eaton Centre and some of the other places in downtown. We walked to Richtree Market in the BCE Place, Mr. Greenjeans in Eaton Centre, and Sunset Grill for breakfast. One tip: there is a Manager's reception on Wednesday evenings from 5:00 to 7:00. They provide appetizers and beer and wine. Its a pretty decent selection and they serve wines from Peller Estates in Niagara on the Lake. It was a nice experience and we were lucky to be there on that day. The Cambridge Suites is a nice oasis in the middle of the hustle and bustle of the city of Toronto. All in all, I think it was one of the best hotel experiences I have had and I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “an oasis in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Okemosian
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights while attending a conference. The suite was a little less spacious than I had expected, but it was still very comfortable. We very much enjoyed the continental breakfasts (with big pots of hot water and coffee) delivered free to the room, with real silverware and cloth napkins - such a civilized service. And it's nice to have a microwave, sink, and fridge. The bathroom/dressing area was quite large, and the bed comfortable. Our room was clean and housekeeping was very responsive and thorough. The hotel was a bit farther away from the convention center than I had thought (my own fault) but otherwise it's very nicely situated. All in all, I prefer a good smaller hotel over the large chain hotels. If you seek a quieter, more intimate hotel experience with great amenities, Cambridge Suites is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Cambridge, not suite enough”
Reviews.Author: RICHnCALongBeach_CA
Reviews.Content: Maybe it is just by comparison, but I didn't find the Cambridge Suites exceptional at all. The desk staff was "efficient and pleasant" not necessarily friendly or helpful. I would describe the room about the same, efficient and pleasant. I found it very odd that they have so many different people coming into your room at all hours of the day and evening. One makes the bed, one checks the mini-bar, one fills the free coffee/tea/cookies. One brings creamer and water, and finally one turns down the bed in the evening. I found it a bit unnerving having that many strangers coming and going from my room. Maybe that is just me!!! I would have liked to have seen the concierge at the desk in the lobby more often, or the front desk staff cross trained to perform that task when necessary. We went a couple of times in the morning and had no luck, but in the afternoon, after we had been out most of the day on our own, then there was someone there. The hotel was clean and relatively quiet, but it seemed to be more of a business hotel than a tourist/family hotel. I probably would not return to Cambridge Suites.... maybe my expectations were too high based on its ratings here.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Maxine37
Reviews.Content: We arrived home yesterday after spending 5 nights at the Cambridge Suites and we had a wonderful time. It was a special occasion, my husband's 40th and the staff on the front desk sent him up a birthday card and 2 wonderful plates of fresh fruit and cheeses as a way of wishing him a happy birthday. The room was immaculate and everything you could ever want to make an enjoyable stay was provided. The staff were friendly and helpful and went out of their way to assist in anyway possible. The breakfast was lovely, plentiful and fresh and certainly carried us well into the day before we even began to think about food again. We thoroughly enjoyed our time here and with the added bonus that Niagara Falls was just over an hours drive away - what a wonderful place to spend your 40th birthday - we can certainly recommend this hotel highly and we would definately stay in the Cambridge Suites if ever we visit Toronto again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic cant fault it stay here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a six night break to the cambridge suites it was hard to find fault with this hotel. As a family of four with two nearly teenage children the extra room provided in the suite was wonderful. The bedroom area could be closed off to enable kids to sleep, while we relaxed with a beer and T.V. or books. (tip if you dont want to use the mini bar then go to the LCBO store on Dundass / Younge, and stock up your in room fridge.) This hotel is well situated we walked everywhere as we had not hired a car, nowhere was far to go, CN tower, ferry to Islands, shopping, St lawrence market (wonderfull fresh produce), street cars, subway, and Path all within easy reach. I picked this hotel after reading other reports on this site and was not dissapointed. the only very minor fault was there was no milk for coffee in the fridge, however one phone call and it soon arrived. A Little touch that made our stay, was the evening bed turn down,with chocolates and complmentary bottles of water, plus the next days weather forcast to help you plan your day. The breakfast was always fresh and constantly topped up, providing a good start to the day, we rarely had lunch as we were still full. the bathroom was lovely and clean and always had lots of hot water. The room was also very quiet we never heard any noise from the adjacent or overhead suites. the Staff were all helpful and polite, we also extended our check out time by an hour to 3pm which meant we arrived at the airport freshly showered and unflustered for our evening flight home. Other hotels i considered were the delta chelsea and the novotel, i definately made the right choice. If we go to toronto again we will stay here. Eating out was great so much choice our kids loved eating at the old spaghetti factory (the Esplanade near the Novotel) dont be put off by the outside, it is wonderfull inside great meals ,good value for money as well. they also enjoyed the Armadillo Grill on front street west super ribs and tex mex food and an in house magician who visited the table he was brilliant. we had a fantastic time in toronto and loved the cambridge

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay at the Cambridge Suites Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I decided to stay at the Cambridge Suites Hotel in Toronto based on the reviews here and I have to stay I was not dissappointed. I stayed from the 27th May until the 4th June and was happy from beginning to end. After being annoyed at the airport (immigration had a problem with me travelling with my children alone) I was in a foul mood but when I got to the hotel the genuine friendliness and helpfulness of the staff had me smiling. The suite was large CLEAN and comfortable. The air conditioning worked perfectly and my suite had plenty of light switches and lamps so the room was not dark at all. I was on the 12th floor and could see the top of the CN Tower from the windows. The minibar was always stocked (mainly because I didn't use it). The maid was thorough and friendly and always gave us extra towels. The evening turndown service was a nice touch especially the weather report for the next day.The complimentary breakfast in the suites was a blessing because the kids could eat whilst still in their PJs watching Teletoons on the TV whilst I was in the shower. Having 2 TVs with 2 kids was great and I came back to the UK with a full packet of headache pills. The location was fantastic (Richmond and Yonge) we were able to walk to most places within 10 minutes. We walked all the way down Yonge (took about 10-15 minutes) to Queen Quay and took the Ferry to Centre Island (stunning place). The path underground system which connects to the Eaton centre, Subway stations and numerous other buildings and shops is connected to the hotel. Lawrence Market is a couple or blocks away (we walked there practically everyday the Dominion Food Market across the road from there is a great place to get snacks fruit etc cheaper than the corner shops). We also walked to the CN Tower (a must for anyone visiting Toronto) and the Rogers Centre and took in the Toronto Blue Jays (another must family zone $9 a ticket for adults $6.30 for kids bargain very enjoyable and a safe atmosphere). The hotel is a gem believe me I walked past alot of hotels and the vast majority looked like dumps to me Hotel Victoria, Scrathcona, Sheraton and the Delta Chelsea to name a few. The great staff, appearance of Hotel and Suites as well as the location make this hotel a must stay for vistors to Toronto. I am already planning my next trip to Toronto and my children insist that they will not be happy staying anywhere else apart from the Cambridge Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Very, very nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: dimaak01
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel 3 nights May 22 â€“ 25 and loved every second of being here. We had one bedroom suite with two TVs (one in the living room and one in the bedroom), with refrigerator, bar, microwave and much more. There was always a newspaper in the morning, also complimentary breakfast in the room. Rooms were nice and clean. Also there was a workout facility on the 22nd floor and Jacuzzi with sauna. Staff is friendly. Also there is a good restaurant and bar on the main floor. Hotel is conveniently located near the Yonge st and not far from the most other downtown attractions. We loved this hotel and will definitely return when visit Toronto next time.

Reviews.Title: “Would have been perfect ..Really! ...except ... : -(”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What would have made things perfect but instead seemed to make every little annoyance worse was the horrible mattress. In the begining I made a mistake by not asking to change rooms but, I was staying such a short time and had so much that I wished to do that the thought of having to pack and change rooms seemed a greater inconvience... By the day of check out I realized what a mistake that decision had been. I was sooooo looking forward to the comfortable bed I had read about in the reviews!! At apperance level the bed looked wonderful! Both Myself and companion have back problems so when we woke stiff and sore after the first night, we made excuses saying 'perhaps we just need to get used to the mattress & maybe it was the pillows ...etc'. ( Though we haven't had that problem happen in other hotels we have stayed) We could bearly move the 4th morning, trying to pack for check out. Since I did not ask for another room it's not really fair to blame the Cambridge, but I thought I'd warn other's who wake from an uncomfortable nights sleep not to wait thinking it will get better. It won't! I'll also suggest if you run out of something in the room frig prior to the weekend, let them know before Friday afternoon because though there are several different people coming into the room to check on things daily, it seems the frig is not stocked daily and you will spend a dry thristy weekend! One last thing, if you have reason to use the spa you may want to be sure it is going to be in working order. After the pain and stiffness brought on by the mattress I was even more than looking forward to a nice long settle in the spa and enjoying that gorgious skyscape. But that last evening I was met with a sign saying the spa was closed. The room itself and the service offered by those employed was truly excellent! I did mention something about my problems upon leaving but I think the desk help thought I was looking for a discount or perhaps didn't understand my accent ( American) or something as he just shrugged it off. Again ... since I was leaving anyway I guess there wasn't really anything he could have said ...but it did make Me feel uncomfortable... and after some thought I decided to write in order to spare other's a painful ruined vacation.

Reviews.Title: “all sweet at the suites”
Reviews.Author: MarilynMcCarthy
Reviews.Content: very good location,we were three ladies visiting canada for the first time.we felt safe and were close enough to walk to shops(lots of shops),restaurants etc.rooms in hotel good size,clean and had everything we needed.we loved the breakfast.all in all,couldn't fault it,as arnie says "we'll be back"

Reviews.Title: “Mainly a good experience but....”
Reviews.Author: Comparsita
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our 4 night stay at the Cambridge Suites & everything positive that other users have said about the suite facilities, good value complimentary breakfasts & location is correct. Also I should mention concierge Jennifer who arranged our airport pickup as well as a private tour of Niagara. She also went to a lot of trouble to find us a dinner dance venue on Saturday night - The Old Mill where there is dinner dancing Mon-Sat - very enjoyable if pricey. The front desk staff too were unfailingly courteous & helpful. BUT I was amazed at the absence of a room safe in a modern property. I like to place valuables in a secure place and it was a real nuisance having to go to the front desk each time to get something out, whether it was cash or credit cards. Other things that could be improved upon were the lighting - we were on 11th floor so suite was quite dark, the pillows - I think that they could offer the option of feather ones & the bath towels which were small, although they did give us 2 each as well as hand towels & face cloths. I would have preferred one proper sized bath towel. I'm not sure if we would return, as although our overall experience was excellent, I was really inconvenienced by the absence of a room safe.

Reviews.Title: “Would Definitely Stay There Again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here (on a Monday through Friday) for our wedding anniversary, and thoroughly enjoyed it. Upon knowing of the reason for our stay, the hotel staff made us feel very special, which was a nice surprise. Keep in mind that the photos you see of the very large rooms on various websites are the more expensive ones. But ours--with the sitting area, separate bedroom (plus two TVs!) was a perfect size for two people. Other things we liked: (1) Room was very well maintained (2) Extras like the bathrobes and turndown service were great (3) Hotel is very quiet, and is not extremely large (4) Great location--steps from the Path, subway and other sights (5) All the staff were friendly, helpful and very responsive to any requests (extra supplies for our room, restaurant recoomendations, directions, arranging sightseeing tours) (6) Wet bar area with the sink, microwave, mini-bar, mini-fridge and free goodies (7) Bathroom was spacious (8) Good closet space (9) We found the bed comfortable Minor room for improvement: (1) Our bathroom needed a little bit more lighting over the sink (2) Room service for continental breakfast forgot a couple of items toward end of our stay, but were prompt (and apologetic) in bringing up what we had requested. Keep in mind if you want large quantities of food, it's likely best to go the the breakfast buffet in the hotel dining room. (3) Would be ideal if room had a small armoire that could not only hold the TV but also provide an extra set of drawers. In closing, we were very pleased and will stay there again the next time we visit Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Good but Need to Step it Up a Notch”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Cambridge Suites Hotel with my wife for a weekend after checking pricing / Trip Advisor etc. Good Things: First off, relatively new, clean and modern - and very quiet. Second, pricing was the best of any comparable hotel in the area. Third, evening turn-down service was very well done c/w chocolates, card with weather forecast for the next day, and bottled water (although why they would deliver luke warm water every night is beyond me...). Fourth, the young lady at the concierge stand was very knowledgable and helpful. Thanks. Suggestions for Management to Turn it Up a Notch.... First, king bed is the smallest I have ever seen. Definitely a quasi-king bed about 9" wider than a queen bed and not a full-size king. Bed was very hard. This alone made my wife want to change hotels. Second, house keeping should knock before entering - which they didn't. Luckily we were decent !! She did apologize though. Third, both tv's in our room faded from colour to dark purple and back again every minute or so. We asked staff on the first of three nights for replacement tv's. It never happened. Why ask again?? We shouldn't have to. Fourth, the very small lounge was always full so you could never get in. Finally, please deliver cold bottled water in the evening and not luke warm water! It will make all the difference. Oh yes, and if there are two guests in the room, you should deliver two bottles of water and not one. Otherwise, I would definitely give them another chance. While Cambridge advertises they are the best in Toronto, I have stayed at better hotels but none with the potential of this place for the price- provided they do turn it up a notch.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from our first trip to Toronto where we stayed at The Cambridge Suites Hotel. We booked the hotel online with no trouble and found that the Hotel itself was exactly as other reviewers had claimed. It was clean, well furnished, had large rooms and a great location. The beds are massive and comfortable and there is satellite TV in both rooms. There is an optional Video Games console and even a microwave to complement the tidy mini-bar. The Bar Staff were friendly the Front Desk were also helpful. I would not hesitate to recommend this Hotel to anyone staying in Toronto. Tip for anyone who has not been before...hire a car from Union Station for a day and go to Niagara Falls, its easy to do and the road to Niagara is straightforward.
