Its unforgettable when you are there, just avoid the over-commercialised area set back from the road and carry on down to Niagara-on-the-lake instead its beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Will always return...”
Reviews.Author: wqh
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a number of times (for weeks at a time) and have had not only superior service but excellent accomodations. The beds are very comfortable and the rooms are large. It is across the street from Eaton Center and the PATH downtown. You can walk to almost anywhere! The exercise facilities are fantastic as well..

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Nell55
Reviews.Content: Whenever we go to Toronto, my husband and I stay at the Cambridge Suites. This hotel is extremely comfortable and very convenient to the Hummingbird Center. The suites are very roomy, the bathrooms well appointed, and service is excellent. Being connected to the "PATH" is also a plus that we especially appreciated on a snowy April 2nd visit.

Reviews.Title: “OK but not great”
Reviews.Author: jenster
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was nice and the location was good, especially being on the PATH system and so close to The Bay and The Eaton Centre. The room itself however was a little outdated, the bathroom fittings and shower doors were rusting, the tv sets in both rooms had poor picture quality, and the kitchenette facilities were quite disappointing. Usually we book through last minute sites and pay a fraction of the price, only to end up with one of the poorer quality rooms in a hotel, this time we booked directly with the hotel and still got what we felt was a poorer quality room so I don't know if all the rooms are like this or we're just unlucky! All in all I'd say if you can get a good price then it's worth it, but if you pay normal rate like we did then you will leave feeling a little ripped off.

Reviews.Title: “It's been a long time since I've had such a nice experience...”
Reviews.Author: dctravelor
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over the weekend for a conference and I canâ€™t say enough about this place. The room is terrific â€“ clean, comfortable, quiet, nice view, and soooooooooo great to have the extra space. The staff was friendly, polite and helpful (? have they gone to the Ritz Carlton college of hotel niceness??!) Even the complimentary breakfast was better than I expected for the price of my room. Next time I am in Toronto, you better believe I will stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Feb. 26th, 2005”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Treated my Wife to a birthday evening night on the town and from all the rave reviews of the Cambridge Suites I had to come and try it out. I stayed in one of the skyscape suites on the upper floors and the view was pretty good. The service is very good and the hotel staff was very happy to help me decorate my room for my wife while we were out for dinner. I was very dissappointed in the quality of the bath towels and the shower head was very clogged, which made your shower time some what cold. They also have complimentary continental breakfast delivered to your room in the morning and I had checked delivery at 9:00 a.m. and at 9:10 a.m I called to find out where our breakfast was and they were just leaving and had 30 orders to deliver and since my floor was very high (20) they said it would be 15 to 20 minutes. All in all the room is a little smaller than what I had imagined, but very well put together and all the comforts at home. I probably wouldn't stay there again unless they have an unbelievable special.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: paulgriffuk
Reviews.Content: There's not a wrong word I can say about this hotel. The hotel it self is in a great location, but that hasn't got a stitch on the staff that are worth double their weight in gold. Their main objective is making the guest feel as comfortable as possible and your stay as harmonised as possible. I couldn't fault them in any way and they were always happy to help be it from the little things such as info on opening times, to arranging days out. You simply tell them what you want to do and they will tell you the best area to visit how to get there, etc... This is a team that works and has that friendly professional attitude, they are just so customer focused. The rooms are more like mini apartments; they are clean to the highest standard. Clarita kept my room to the best possible standard. To round it off, this hotel provides exactly what I needed for travelling alone: safety, security, comfort, and location. Why this hotel isn't a 5star I don't know.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Weekend of Feb 4-6, 2005 Perfect location for a girl's weekend! The concierge was most helpful prior to our arrival. Best views are high floors facing east - unfortunately, none of these have 2 double beds. Our room was very clean and had all the amendities we needed (free coffee, water, popcorn). The bedroom was on the small side but the living and dressing areas were nice and big. Eaton Centre is a short block away (no need to go outside) and the theatre district is less than a $10 cab ride away. Free continental breakfast was very good. We had it in the conference room the first morning and had it delivered on Sunday morning. Didn't use the jaccuzi - was not very hot. Gym only has a few machines but nobody was there when we went. There's also a sauna - it was off. Would definitely return.

HotelInfo.Name: Cambridge Suites Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 15 Richmond St. E., Toronto, Ontario M5C 1N2, Canada
